1.content:
First Decide Who you will play as-

Human Male - If you are playing as a human you will be playing as yourself

Giantess - Make her gentle of evil, determine general appearance, size and where you are at

Human Female - Not sure what to say, i figure someone will want to play as a female

Other - None of these interest you think of something else
1.title: Getting Started

11.content:
Alright then next off determine how you wish the giantess(es) to act

Gentle - She will be friendly and helpful depending on how you write it

Evil - Cruel Destructive, enjoys long strolls through cities (while crushing people) and (if you want) eats plenty of humans

Neutral - Not necessarily concerned with well being of humans she tries to ignore them, however she doesn't really hate them and wish to cause them harm

other - again if you guys have any better ideas feel free to add
11.title: Giantess Type

111.content:
Alright now, just a few more steps until we start the story where do you want this to take place

Near Civilization - If you are willing, have you giantess appear near a city, neighborhood, anywhere that humans live in the present time, Giantesses could be common and relations with humans are not so good

Yet to be discovered - You find a giantess whether it been in a hostile region, on a uncharted island or hidden away by the government in a secret lab

Other Times - Go back and write you story in a different historical time period, (If you choose this i will tell you now, giants and a race known to exist and humans to not like your kind to much)
111.title: Gentle

1111.content: Ok now just decide on a size
1111.title: Near Civilization

11111.content:
Alright i have some story ideas for you to work with go ahead and choose one

Refuge - A terrible war is going on and your home was destroyed, as you wander the streets trying to avoid danger you meet a helpful giantess

The Little People - This one is not necessarily about giants but instead, a race of tiny folk who live in the forests and underground you somehow are found by a giantess
11111.title: 50ft - 100ft

111111.content:
You walked through the ruins of your home town, it had once supported about a million people but now it was a ghost town. Most of the buildings had been flattened by the constant bombardment from enemy aircraft, leaving only a few buildings left standing and those that remained seemed to be on the verge of collapse. Still, there was still a chance that it contained food as well as ammunition that you needed to survive in these harsh times.

What started the war was not important, the important thing is that you survived. It was mid day judging from the heat of the sun and you were wearing clothes that had been reduced to rags from being worn for months and even years on end. You carried a pistol with you incase you encountered hostile human beings but you were low on ammunition so it was wise to ask question firsts rather than shoot.

Your name was Matthew Steele and you were 20 when the war started, you had no family and no home to go to but you were determined to survive regardless of what it took unless it went against your moral beliefs. You were protected from the sun by a hood but it made you perspire proofusely plus there was often a sense of paranoia as you checked your surroundings for signs of life.
111111.title: Refuge

1111111.content:
As you wander the streets you suddenly spot a supermarket just beyond the old burnt out hospital. As you are about to run over to you herer shouting followed by several gunshots. You quickly duck down behind an old dumbster, and then you can see a woman with reddish brown hair being pushed into a covered van. Rebel Guerillas, they were a nasty bunch, with shaved heads, tattoos covering their arms, and their signature dark blue bandanas. You were curious as to why they were rounding up straglers but it didn't matter, you couldn't take on that many.

After a little while they drove off and you quickly sprint across the street and into the supermarket. They place is trashed most everything is strewn about. Doesn't matter to you though you gather some provisions and water, until you hear something outside....
1111111.title: You chance upon a supermarket.

11111111.content:
As you step outside the ruins, you spot a rather unusual and frightening sight. A giantess is right outside and staring down at you! You freeze up, before remembering your gun and taking it out. The giantess is a young woman, probably around your age. She had tanned skin and long black hair that reached down to the middle of her back. Her azure eyes looked at you, fixated on what was probably a tiny creature to her.

She wore clothing that was meant to cover up rather than provide modesty, a makeshift bra and panties, indicating that she was like you, probably on the run. Though you wouldn't believe that, she was many times bigger than you and whatever scared her would probably kill you without breaking into a sweat. " Put your gun down, I mean you no harm." Her voice was sweet but seemed to have a tinge of sorrow in it, in this age you wouldn't fault anyone for that though. " Can't, you are huge and frankly, I can't take that chance. So no chance until you can convince me otherwise." you say to her, not wishing to fall for her traps if she had any planned for you.

She seems hurt by this but tries again to persuade you that nothing is wrong with her, " I can help you. I could protect you from the guerillas, we're alike you and me. We both want to survive." she says to you, taking a step forward. The ground shakes as she steps forward, you are under her shadow, you thought she was about 70 feet tall using nearby buildings as a comparison. " I would love to but I can't trust strangers." you say, turning off the trigger. Suddenly, it occured to you that this pistol probably couldn't kill her or even inflict significant damage. " I just want to help you, we could survive together and even be friends, you have no idea how bad it is to be alone. I don't even know how I got to be like this, just woke up and I'm a monster to everyone plus we're all at war!" she howled, tears welling up in her eyes.
11111111.title: A giantess is outside

choices: You ask her about her life before the war.
111111111.content:
You decide to trust the giantess, who you realise could have killed you by now if she intended to. Plus, she seems sincere about her condition and the two of could help each other out in the end. " Alright, I trust you." you tell her and put your gun away. You didn't want to expend ammunition anyway. She smiles before saying, " Thank you, you're the first one to trust me. The rest just run or even shoot me. I have some scars it." She turns around to reveal small scars, where the bullets had been.

" Well you are very intimidating, even the guerillas seem friendly when I saw you." you tell her, she understands why but it seems to make her sad. " Where are you heading?" you ask her. ' I don't know, somewhere safe I guess." she said. " Well I hear there is a safe place about 500 miles to the east. No guerillas, protect by government forces or whatever is left of them." you tell her.

" Guess that is where we are headed then." she says, she places her palm next to you, intending for you to get on. ' Look, I don't know how to say this but we just met and I-' She cuts you off before you can answer. " Look, it'll be faster this way. I can cover more distance than you can. Besides, I won't bite. I just ate." she says, you wondered what she ate but it was best not ask.

" Do you need supplies or anything from the supermarket?" you ask her. She laughs at that, " I don't know how but I can go without food and water for days on end, I've never felt the urge to eat until after a week of being a giantess." she says to you.
111111111.title: You put your gun away.

1111111112.content: "So, what's your name?" ask as she sets her hand down. "Jenny, what's yours?" "I'm Matt" you tell her. "I'm gonna grab some resources from the supermarket" You run into the supermarket to get food and water for the trip. You rummage in a box until you hear a shotgun being cocked. Then you hear the voice of a kid of about 16 say "Those are mine, and so is the rest of this store." you then see the pile of dead guerillas in the corner. You look over at the kid. He has cold ice blue eyes short dark brown hair. Guns and grenades are strapped to him everywhere. The shotgun is currently out of a holster on his back. You put your hands up and back out of the store. He follows until he sees Jenny. His eyes go wide and he backs into the store. She knocks on the roof saying "we just want supplies, nothing else" he is already in a back corner cowering. "I won't hurt you!" Maybe it was fate the guerillas showed up then. A van is driven up the street a ways until 10 armed soldiers jump out. You climb over a fallen pillar and take cover. They all see Jenny and take aim but she is running at them full speed. They start to run seeing a seventy foot tall lady running at them. The van pulls away leaving the guerillas to find hiding spots. They all escape through allies and side streets leaving you alone again. Jenny calls into the supermarket again. "Can we get some supplies now?" "Take anything, please don't hurt me!" he eventually calls out of the store. You fill up an old backpack with supplies before leaving. The guerillas drive up again this time in four vans. They all have SMGs or RPGs. You go back to cover and Jenny ducks behind the remains of a building. With this many both of you would be killed. Then the kid appears on top of the store. He throws a grenade into a van and ducks down again. The whole van explodes leaving a good chunk of the guerillas dead. The remaining guerillas run into the store. The kid jumps over to the next roof and hits a hand trigger. The entire building falls to the ground but the supplies are in the next building over. You look over at him and Jenny pops out from behind the building. Shots are fired at the kid and he falls behind the cover on top of the building. You gun the last guerilla down with your pistol. Jenny runs over to the building and looks down at him holding his stomach. Blood begins to pool beneath him and he says to Jenny, " There's a medkit in every crate inside. She pulls a crate out of the building and sets it by him. He pulls the kit out and administers himself. "Help yourself to a crate. There's everything you could ever need in there." Jenny looks down at the poor kid, and asks "do you want to come with us? There's more than enough room."
1111111112.title: You ask for her name.

11111111121.content:
"Sure, I guess, safety in numbers right", he replies. He struggles, but eventually pulls himself up, wincing in pain. He looked to you, briefly with a distant look on his face. He then peered up at Jenny rather nervously, at he started to limp towards you. You can tell he is uncomfortable with the giantess, but you think he may get used to it. Jenny then reaches down and reaches for the boy. He jumps a little when her hand gets close but then tense up and holds his breathe as she wraps her figures around him. He grimaces as she lifts him up and she loosens her grip as she set him down on her open palm. She then looks to you with her sharp eyes and lowers her hand. You quickly step up onto it and she then lifts you up as well. You get a nervous sense of vertigo as she picks you up, and calmly set you next to the boy.

Just before the three of you leave, jenny takes one of the crates and turns south. She begins walking through the ruined city, keeping an eye out for any guerillas. Its a little bumpy but you manage to stay on well. "You two ok down there?" Jenny asked, "Sure, just fine." you reply while the kid stays quite. "Do, you really buy into all that?" he asks you almost inaudibly. "What do you mean?' you reply, but the kid just shakes his head a looks away. You think for a second, but you're sure that you aren't in any danger.

After awhile you come upon a......
11111111121.title: He says yes

111111111211.content: The boy looks down at a school, it had been bombed when soldiers used it as a base. His teeth clench, and he balls the hand not holding his side in a hard fist. You look at him wondering what he was thinking. He sees you and starts to explain. "I used to go there before this started. When they bombed it, there were still kids inside. My brother died. My father was shot trying to protect me and my mother. They took her but I hid. I lost everything to the guerillas. I'll do what it takes to get revenge." You and Jenny are surprised he opened up like that to two strangers. "I'm sorry" Jenny says sadly to him. He just gets more mad. "SORRY WON'T BRING BACK MY BROTHER! SORRY WON'T SAVE MY MOTHER! SORRY DOESN'T COUNT FOR ANYTHING ANYMORE!" He curls up into a ball, starting to cry. You had left home to come to this city. Your family remained unbombed. Jenny tries to comfort him but he continues to sob. The guerillas had taken his life away without killing him. He was just getting his revenge. After a few minutes he emerges from his self-pity. He apologises to Jenny and then you continue through the city. As you walk....
111111111211.title: Burnt out school

1111111112111.content: As Jenny walks along, to your horror the kid has passed away. You tell Jenny. Her eyes envelop with tears, but she holds them in. You bury the kid next to the trail. You go along with Jenny for about an hour, your pretty much past it, and so is Jenny. you walk along through another city. Suddenly, two guerillas pop out, guns at the ready. One runs away from Jenny, while another in a gullie(Gi-ll-ee)suit stays behind before he gets a chance to get you in his sights, you shoot him. He screams in pain as he falls down. You're in shock as you realize
1111111112111.title: Not all are evil

11111111121111.content: "Arrghhh!" The kid says as blood pools beneath him. you almost puke, as you've never seen that much blood come from a 12 year old. He screams in pain as he takes out the bullet. you debate on what to do.
11111111121111.title: He's a kid!

111111111211112.content: While you are in shock Jenny shouts "We must help him." You can only ask "How?" She puts you on ground near the kid. Then she puts a medical crate (which we had from the supermarket earlier). You open the crate and take some medical equipment but you are unsure what to do. In the past you had fought in the war and killed people but you have never cured people. You hear Jenny's loud voice "Clean the wound with alcohol later put a bandage." You follow her instructions. When you look at his pulse ...
111111111211112.title: Jenny helps him

1111111112111122.content: When you check his pulse you realise that he is alive. "Is he okay?" Jenny asks. You reply to her. "Yes." She gives a deep breath. You see the sunset and say "It's getting dark we must camp, there's a giant building over there, even you can fit there." She looks a bit upset about the last part but still carries you and the kid to the building. You regret about saying the last part. While camping no one talks. You think about Jenny all night. Next morning you see that kid is pointing you your gun.
1111111112111122.title: He's alive but uncouncious.

11111111121111222.content: Upon realizing that Jenny is still asleep, you took matters to your own hands and began to talk to the kid. "Kid, you don't have to pull that trigger. We can work this out." The kid remains unchanged about what you said. "Stand back or I'll shoot!" says the kid loudly. "You were wounded and we helped you. We thought we could trust you." "Stand back. Don't move another inch." says the kid anxiously. "You're young to be part of the guerrillas. Did you join this group because your parents died? Because you lost everything?" You start to move slowly towards the kid as you say these words. "Killing people won't bring what you once had back." You start to notice that the kid is tearing up. You move even closer toward the kid. The kid stands frozen as his grief overwhelms him. It was at this moment that you came closer and made eye contact with him to take the gun away peacefully. The kid runs away crying. "Kid, come back here!" At this point, Do you...
11111111121111222.title: Try to handle it yourselp

choices: Go up and see whats happening
111112.content:
You still feel the ground shaking. "When will this end?" a stranger asks in the darkness. You know it will not end for a while but thats how things go when you are so small. You get curious perhaps maybe one quick look, you think to yourself. You know its dangerous though, its dangerous for everyone. You are one of the little people, a hidden race that lives in underground burrows, and cities. Everything threatens you insects, birds, rabbits, mice, cats, rain, wind, Humans. Your mind goes blank, Humans you think to yourself, "Humans" you silently whisper. They are so much like us except so much bigger, you think. You have never seen a human up close before, you have seen them from a distances, but never close enough that they might notice you.

Humans are the greastest threat out there, thats what you grandfather used to say before he was eaten by a spider. The ground shakes violently again and wakes you from your trance like state of thought. You know its agaisnt the rules to go up to the surface when humans are near, but the curiosity is killing you. You know they are huge, you can tell from their enormous houses, but you wonder how big would they appear up close. Your mind is at war with itself, Go up take a look whats worst that could happen, NO you fool are you insane you can easily be killed.

What will you do?
111112.title: The Little people

choices: A huge metal machine with swirling blades of death (lawn mower)
1111121.content:
You, know right away that this may be your last chance to really see a human up close in a long time. So in the darkness you slip out, and no one seems to notice your absence. You dash down the long tunnel, and once you get to the intersection of the 5 main tunnels you quickly look down each one with caution. You know if you are caught you'll never hear the end of it; the scolding, the jokes, your guardian foster parents would surely add more beatings to the usually amount. You hate your guardians, your father left into the upper world never to be seen again and your mother died when you were young, so you became the ward of 3 guardians. They were a cruel bunch; always mean and bitter about everything you'd ever done. Their lives had been pretty easy though before you came along, and ever since they had been given a degree of responsibility they'd been acting up ever since.

As you reach the first ladder which led up to the first level, you think you hear someone coming down the corridor, so you quickly bound upwards to avoid detection.The passage to the surface is not far and you head up without a second thought. You look out into the afternoon sun, it hurts your eyes; living underground most of your kind are pale and unaccustomed to the bright sunlight. You look around the tall grass and become slightly squeamish about coming out. Suddenly you feel the earth shake again as you look up and see .....
1111121.title: Go up and see whats happening

11111212.content:
You look up and there, towering above you, was the huge human. You were about the size of her little toe and if you wanted to live then you had better climb back down. Suddenly a female voice thundered from high above you. "Holy crap!" you see her rub her eyes and look back at you. You start to climb as fast as you can down the ladder but a huge finger pushes into the hole and digs a piece of earth out. She reaches into the hole and pulls you out by the stomach. All the air is forced out of you and you are lifted into the air. You struggle but are unable to even budge her fingers. You pull out your last resort, a knife. You stab but are unable to pierce her skin. She brings you up to her face and you see an innocent unblemished face. She has deep blue eyes that are bigger around than you are tall. You fade out of consciousness from lack of air and feel yourself go limp before you lapsing into darkness.

You wake and a bright light blinds you as you open your eyes. You see you are in a bedroom, laying in the middle of a massive pillow. You see the enormous girl from a distance now tending to some other business. She looks about 17, only a few years older than you. You see her start to look at you and you snap your eyes shut hoping she didn't see you. She lightly touches you to make sure you didn't die. When her finger strikes you gag from the force, revealing your consciousness. "I know you're awake." she says, " I won't hurt you" You open your eyes and scramble back from her hands terrified that she'll squeeze you too hard again. "I'm sorry, I didn't know I was squeezing you I would never have tried to hurt you." You stop, knowing that you can't escape. She lays her hand flat and tells you to climb up on it. It takes a hop and some pulling but you get on top of her hand. She brings her hand close to her face level with her mouth. Then you think she may like live food. She opens her mouth and breathes and you feel a bunch of hot air engulf you. She raises you up to her ear and she tells you to talk into it. You ask her what her name is. "Sarah, what's yours?" you tell her your name and then ask to be put down because you have a minor fear of heights. She sets you down and...
11111212.title: A giant human jogging

choices: Escape, I can't trust her, at least not yet
Stay put, what if she finds me while i try and escape, or worse
111112121.content:
Just after she sets you down, she slides off the bed and walks over to the door. Just before she leaves she turns back to you and says "I'll be right back, stay there, alright." She then turns back around and leaves, you feel a little relieved. You are terrified, you were just captured by a human, this probably won't end well. You are greatly unnerved by all this but you are not completely giving up yet. Your mind then turns to such factors like how the colony will react. They are in mortal danger, and it is all because of you. What will become of me you think, I will die, oh no, whine whine whine.

But then your minds quickly shifts to a more optimistic perspective. Well she did seem pretty nice, besides if she was going to hurt me she probably would have done it already. You feel slighlty more relaxed as you sit back down. The pillow is soft and despite being unconcious for who knows how long, you are exhuasted and lay down for a second. Your mind then goes back to the idea of time, how long has it been, surely only a few hours. Whats going on, i can't get to comfortable now, she could be playing with me. Oh god what should i do?

If I stay i will get to learn some more about humans, but i risk my life and my colony

If I leave i will be safe but it will be almost impossible to escape

Just then Sarah came back into the room, and looked over at you with a smile. She then sat down at a desk and started rummaging through a drawer, looking for something.

So what are you going to do
111112121.title: Leaves

1111121211.content:
The immediate problems of escape are these: the bed is really high up, and her bedroom is on the second floor. Plus all the everything can kill me as usual. She eventually goes downstairs and you begin your work. You start pulling loose threads out of the pillow and tying them together. You hear huge footsteps and hide your rope. She comes back in with a huge pen and a book big enough to crush your house. She sits very slowly on the bed so you don't get thrown into the air. She does her homework, checking on you every little bit with a smile, and then puts her hand down next to you. You jump on not wanting to make her mad before the escape. She sets you on a table by the bed and tells you to stay put. She clears it off and puts a pillow on it. She tells you it's your bed for now, and then lays on her own. You wait hours before you try your escape. You get the thread and rappel down the side of the bed. You reach the floor and run for awhile, still dragging the rope, until you reach the door. You crawl under and then rappel down all of the stairs. With this accomplished you hide under a table by the front door and sleep.

That morning you hear Sarah come down and search for you. She is quietly calling your name but you continue to hide, fear coursing through you. She gives up and you start to go towards the front door. Do you make it?
1111121211.title: Escape

11111212112.content: You make for the slit on the bottom of the door but a shadow falls over you. You sprint as fast as you can but a hand blocks your way like a wall you start to backtrack but the other hand closes a solid wall. You look up and see her face looking down on you. She doesn't look mad she just looks sad. She lifts you up (carefully this time) and sets you in her hand. "If you wanted to leave so much why didn't you just ask?" she opens the door and steps out into the early morning light. She brings you back to the colony and sets you down. Your stomach rumbles. You hadn't eaten since yesterday afternoon. You realise that you don't want to go back. She sets her hand down but you stay. If she was willing to take you back, why should you be afraid of her? Anyone else though, and you could have been dead. You stay on her hand and she looks confused. "You want to stay with me?" you nod and she starts to walk back to her house. She sets you on her shoulder and you tell her you need food. She apologizes many times and brings you back. She brings up herself a bowl of dry cereal. She sets one huge flake of cereal next to you. It is nearly as big as you, and you only eat about a quarter of it. She has eaten about two hundred of them. You think about your life back home. Nobody cared about you. But here somebody you just met is taking care of your every need. Does anything significant happen in the next few days?
11111212112.title: Nope.

choices: What she plans to do with you today/tomorrow
111112121122.content:
The next day is rather boring. You wake up early in the morning around seventy thirty and see that Sarah is dressed and looks like she is going somewhere. Since you usually live underground, your people tend to sleep for a longer period of time so you were confused as to what she was doing. She noticed you waking up and she bent down and said
"Go back to sleep, I have to go somewhere I'll see later on tonight ok". You give a sort of groggy nod and slump over and swiftly drift back to sleep. After a few more hours you are woken once again by an intense beam of light. You stand up and cautiously slide down the edge of the enormous pillow. You pace back and forth from one end of the table several times and become bored very quickly. You then remember the rope you made and decide to go down and look around the house a little.

You eventually manage to get down and you decide to walk over to the desk at the other end of the room. It takes you almost an hour but you finally get there, but there isn't much to see. You become a little nervous and don't spend to much time on the ground. The day goes by pretty uneventfully until about three thirty when Sarah finally comes back home. She comes in and looks over at the table with a puzzled look on her face. She calmly calls your name and you shout a reply from where you are sitting at the base of the table. She comes over to you and lowers her hand and you climb on. As she lifts you up she asks "what were you doing down there". You tell her that you just got bored and you just decided to have a look around. She laughs a little when you tell her this and she then tells you........
111112121122.title: No

choices: One huge girl is enough for now.
1111121211222.content: She starts to talk to you and you listen intently. "Tomorrow I want you to meet my best friend Kylie. Of course It's only if you're ok with it. She's coming over anyways but if you want to meet her, then I will introduce you. Of course you can decide tomorrow." You don't know if you want to meet her or not but you can decide later. If she is Sarah's friend she won't be a bad person right? "How are you today?" She asks atfter a bit. You respond with a monotonous "Good" she smiles and then looks over at you. "Are there others like you?" you think about whether or not to tell her. Eventually you nod, but don't say anything else. She sets you down to get her backpack. She sets it down and then sits next to you. Huge pencil, massive book same as yesterday, but this time escape isn't on your mind. She glances over at you every once in awhile but knows you won't run or try to escape. The rest of the afternoon consists of her doing homework, getting the both of you food and a quick power-nap, as she calls it. At night you eat dinner, you eat about half a grain of rice, she eats an entire bowl of a stew on rice. You talk for awhile, then go to sleep. Tomorrow she goes to school and then comes back with Kylie. Do you go meet her?
1111121211222.title: What she plans to do with you today/tomorrow

choices: You listen to what Kylie and Sarah are talking about
11111212112222.content:
You've always been a little shy and you're still getting used to Sarah. You decide its probably a good idea not to meet her yet. So, when Sarah comes home the next day she brings her friend Kylie. You were completely caught of guard considering you don't know how to read the huge clock by Sarah's bed, so panicing you run across the table and desperately try and find a place to hide. You can here them coming down the hallway and their footsteps finally stop outside the door. Then Sarah opens the door and slips in, carefully closing the door and walks over to you. She kneels down and gently reaches down and picks you up with two fingers. "So do you want to meet my friend?" Sarah asks you cheerfully. "Uh....I just don't think I am ready to.....meet uh.... anyone else yet." you reply trying your best to calm down. She can hear the fear in your choked reply. "Well alright, maybe some other time then." she tells you slightly disapointed for a brief moment until she gives you another smile and takes you over to a cabinet. She opens a drawer full of clothes and looks down at you and whispers "I need to hide you somewhere safe until Kylie leaves so is it ok if you just relax in here for awhile?'". You nod quickly, still trying to recover your composure. So she carefully drops in and slowly closes it leaving it slightly ajar so air can get in.

What happens now......
11111212112222.title: One huge girl is enough for now.

111112121122221.content: You listen in on them for awhile in the comfort of the sock drawer. Sarah and Kylie talk about their school, and you start thinking. Maybe you can show everyone back home that humans aren't evil. Then again getting them to even look at a human would take hours. You continue to listen in, and hear about someone they dislike. Apparantly humans fight too. Maybe you can hold on being a human activist. You were slowly beginning to drift off, until you heard Kylie say this. "Weird question but, can I borrow some socks?" you were scrambling down into the drawer the moment you heard that. The mass of cloth was pulled away from above you and you barely got out of view. The drawer was shut all the way and darkness surrounds you like black water. "Let's go downstairs Kylie." you hear Sarah's voice muffled by the socks and drawer. After a bit the light filters in as the drawer is opened again. "I'm so sorry." She whispers before going downstairs. You sit in the drawer uneasily because of the previous events. After a bit you hear one set of feet on the stairs. Sarah comes back in and takes you gently from the socks. She apologises at least five times, and then you eat dinner. Well, she eats dinner, you eat a crumb, but whatever. Does anything happen tonight?
111112121122221.title: Kylie and Sarah are talking

choices: You ask her who the mysterious visitor was
She picks you up and takes you somewhere
1111121211222212.content:
Just after the two of you finish eating someone starts knocking on the door. At first you are startled and become anxious for you do not know what is making the noise, but Sarah calms you down and stands up and walks over to the door. She looks through a small window to the side of the door and turns back around an almost sickly look on her face. She rushes over to you and picks you up and hurriedly steps up each stair to her rooms where she almost tosses you to her bed. She apologizes and rushes out of the room, but just before she closes the door she turns to you and says, "Stay up there and if you hear anyone coming hide, got it" with a great deal of seriety in her voice. She then slammed the door behind her and you could hear her hasten down the stairs and open the front door. At first you hear nothing, and you strain to perhaps just perceive some of the discourse exchanged between Sarah and the mysterious guest. Then like sudden thunder the two voices below began to raise in volume and you could tell that there was arguing, apologies, accusation, and although you could not make out any particular words you could tell Sarah was not at all happy with this mysterious person. You grow increasingly worried, as if Sarah was in trouble, then your mind suddenly realizes something. You really care about Sarah, although not in any erotic ways but as a friend you are worried for her safety and your own. You decide to hide and try and make out what the two are saying. After awhile, for what seems like hours, you hear the front door open swiftly and then slam. Someone bounds up the steps and you start to relax. The bedroom door swings open and Sarah comes in, and calls your name. You come out from your hiding spot and see Sarah in a state of mental instability. She looks emotionally wrecked and although she wasn't crying she had a look of fear, grief, and frustration on her pretty face. She sits down and her bed and you walk up to her.

What happens........

11111212112222122.content: If you had been worried before you were scared now. Sarah picks you up and starts walking. The shaking from her footsteps finally stop and she pulls her fingers back, revealing a pond, and not a brown murky pond but a beautiful one with clear water and wildlife all around it. She sits down and slowly begins to cry. You dodge a teardrop the size of your head and then try to comfort her. She stops crying after a little while, and thanks you. The person quickens their pace and Sarah says "Don't worry, I won't hurt you." they don't slow down but they do look back. Sarah sets her hand down and blocks the person's way ahead. Sarah picks them up between her fingers and they stop struggling instantly. She lifts them up to her face to get a good look at them, and the person shouts out, "Please! Don't hurt me! I-I'll do anything you want!" in a clearly male voice. She tells him she won't hurt him(more than a few times) before he calms down. She sets him down next to you and he instantly recognizes you. "(your name) we've been looking all over for you!" you recognize him and say "Good to see you Zach! You were the one person who I've missed back home." Zach looks at you for a moment. "Home hasn't been home since you left. War broke out. My parents are dead. I brought the other children out to find a place to go so we don't get killed by those merciless crusaders. I thought they killed you too." he kept a look of a hardened man as he spoke. "I think I know a place." You explain the situation and.....

Sarah still in a depressive state looks curiously at Zach and says "I'm so confused..." and Zach interupts and says "Well my real name is Zachelieses (pronounced as Zak-ee-li-sees), but I adopted a more human nickname when....", "No, not that, just..." Sarah paused for a moment, "everything, I mean, I found (your name), then HE comes back after" she pauses again then continues "and now Zach and..." she then begins to cry again. Zach, unsure of what to do just stands there akwardly while you walk over and try and calm down Sarah. You repeatedly call out Sarah's name but she buries her face in her hands and does not respond. You look over to Zach you just stands there looking away. "You wanna help me here" you ask Zach agressively. He just sort of cocks his head to the side and says "Look I really should go, the children..." his voice just trails off. You are starting to become increasingly angry with Zach and you begin to clench your fist as he turns and starts to walk away. "Fine, LEAVE, I am not at all surprised," you shout at him, just above Sarah's sobbing. Zach stops and turns his head slighlty and says "This is not me, this is not what I'm meant to do, I have to go, humans, don't you see (your name) they aren't....... they're not something we need to be 'concerned' with right now". "So what should we be concerned with, Zach, please tell me!" you yell angrily. He doesn't answer, just stands there. After a few seconds you shout "Tell me DAMN it!". Zach turns all the way around and replies "This is not our world, not our time, they have problems that just aren't something we should...." "No, we have problems, they may have some, but WE, we have just one to many"
Zach doesn't respond and just walks away. You go back over to Sarah who by now has just stopped crying and is wiping away her tears.

I'm sorry (your name) I just didn't think he would come back, I thought it was over. She sits down once more and opens her hand and the kid starts yelling up at her. Sarah tries to speak but the kid won't shut up and you can start to detect a great deal of fear in his voice. "Calm down, I just.... No wait, all I wanted to...... Shhhh!" she says to him, but he does not listen. She looks down at you and you kind of shrug. She finally sets him down by you and he lies on the ground grabbing at his leg which is now bleeding profusely. He grimaces, but tries to keep a strait face. You ask him his name but he ignores you. He isn't much older than you but you don't recognize him. After a little while he sort of slumps over, either asleep or unconcious. "What should we do with him?'' you ask Sarah. When you look up you see she is looking out across the pond. The sun is almost finished setting and the surrounding darkness is starting to creep in. She doesn't respond. You figure you should just keep quiet, and sit down again. You grow very nervous and want to leave, you know more crusaders may show up, plus you and your people have always been terrified of the night. You feel anxious to leave but you don't want to ask Sarah, you don't want to interrupt her "moment". After awhile as the sun almost is completely hidden behind the distant mountain, Sarah looks down and scoops you up. She then looks at the kid.....
11111212112222122212.title: Sarah picks the kid up to comfort him

111112121122221222122.content: Since the burrows are dangerous she decides to take the kid home with the two of you. He starts to wake up just as you get to her home, and she sets him on her pillow. He starts to stir and you realise something. This is exactly how you first really met Sarah. It seems strange that you were afraid of her then, but not even a week later, you trust her fully. The kid is now shielding his eyes from the lamp's light, waiting for his eyes to adjust. He looks around, then sees you next to him. He has long black hair, the usual pale skin, but a rare athletic build. He looks like the average guy, except his eyes are a strange shade of purple. He then sees Sarah coming back with a piece of cloth, plenty to cover all of his body. "Oh! Your awake!" she says down to him. "Where are we?" he asks cautiously, not wanting to make her mad. "This is my room, you are sitting on my pillow." at that he blinks in surprise. He mumbles something to himself and then looks at his leg. Sarah had now ripped the cloth into a smaller piece. She tells him to hold still while she puts it on. He does as he is told. "You really shouldn't have been walking around like that." she says to scold him. "What does it matter? My friends are dead or gone. My family went missing a year ago. Not like anyone would notice me leaving." he eventually says, his voice depressed. Sarah immediately changed from scolding to pity. "You poor thing. It'll be ok." she says to him. "No. It won't be ok. I have nothing left. The crusaders took the last little things I had left. If I had any less humanity, I'd kill all of them." Sarah was surprised at this, and didn't reply. You just listened to them talk. Waiting for something to happen. He just sat there. No tears. No emotion left. Everything he had, he lost. Now it looks like he lost his emotions too. He had been hollowed out, like a bowl. After a little bit, Sarah broke the silence. "You will have to sleep on a pillow on the floor, is that ok?" she asks kindly. "Sure." came a simple reply. "I feel silly, I forgot to ask your name." Sarah said to him. "Seth." was the only thing he said in reply. "I'm Sarah. And that's (your name)" she replies to his question that wasn't asked. "Nice to meet you." you tell him. He just glances at you and says, "ok." then Sarah pits a pillow on the ground and gently puts Seth on it. You all sleep without a peep. The next morning.....

Sitting up, staring into the distance, he doesn't move. He really gives you the creeps, but you shout to him anyway. "Hey, Seth, Seth up here." you call out to him. He looks up at you his face covered by his black hair. He doesn't respond at first but then after a slightly awkward silence he replies "Yeah?". Unsure of what to say you look over at Sarah who is still fast asleep, her hair tossled about, hiding her face. You secretly hope that Sarah will wake up, just to break the silence. When you look back down you see Seth trying to crawl away. "Hey, were are you going?" you ask him, but he doesn't respond. You call to him again and again but he continues to ignore you. You look around for your rope but you don't remember where you put it so you can't chase after him.

So.........

Seth lays on the floor, groaning. You pity the poor guy. Alone in the world. Hurt. A knife wound on your leg. Now there's a massive person who he (as you can tell) is afraid of. Can you blame him? She could step on both of you, kill the whole underground colony, without really making effort. You look down at him and.....

111112121122221222122212.content:
Just as you reach Seth, you see him still on the ground grabbing his shoulder groaning. You don't feel safe, so exposed escpecially with the door open. It makes you nervous, always the chance someone may come by and see you. You want to help Seth but you want to get away from the door as soon as possible. You look down at him and he looks back up at you with a look that says 'you gonna help me or not'. You are unsure of what to do, so you sort of crouch down and try and lift him but he shouts in pain so you stop. Quickly looking from him, to the door, to Sarah your mind races in an attempt to come up with another idea. Then you hear something. Something that chills your blood. Something you have come to fear, greatly. You look down and see Seth looking at the doorway aswell; looking pale (either from fear or blood loss, you're not sure)

The almost completely silent and swift steps of massive pawed feet come down the hallway. You have seen this beast before. One of the greatest threats you have come to know, one that most all the little people are terrified of. Whereas dogs come and go, this monster tortures, destroys, waits, pounces, and preys. You quickly grab Seth's arms and start dragging him away from the door despite his screams of agony. The noise is getting closer, and as it does so you can feel the life draining from your composure. Closer, closer, and closer it comes but it is no use you are to far away. You call to Sarah, you cry for help, you try but no one is there and you feel doomed.

Then is appears. Its head poking into the doorway, with its green eyes, pointy ears, and it menacing grey color. At first the sly menace doesn't notice you, it only looks up at Sarah who still is fast asleep. It takes a few more steps so it is just within the room. Towering over you its frightful eyes come upon you. The same eyes that elders from your race make up stories about to scare little children, the same eyes which can watch you whenever, day or night. You freeze, your muscles tense up and your eyes dilate. You can feel Seth shaking, but it is no use. The beast brings one paw forward almost an inch (a normal inch so to you it's like ten feet). It lowers it head and you can feel its rank breathe envelop you. It opens its mouth and makes a loud menacing, frightful, chilling, monstrous noise which makes you feel like the whole earth is shaking. You and Seth then scream....."AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!" You shut your eyes and drop Seth. Then after waiting for it to attack you open one eye and see the beast is gone. You look behind and see Sarah towering above you, a groggy look on her face, and she is holding the terror. She steps over you and drops it outside her door and then shuts it. .........

Is that what you want?" she goes on for awhile and you see something in Seth snap. A flash of something goes through those violet eyes. "WHAT DOES IT MATTER WHAT HAPPENS TO ME? I'M JUST A TINY LITTLE PERSON WHO LPST EVERYTHING! MY FAMILY IS DEAD! MY FRIENDS EITHER JOINED THE CRUSADERS OR JOINED THE DEATH TOLL!" He starts to yell again but he chokes on his words. He collapses into a sobbing heap. He is an entirely different person from the hardened, emotionless Seth you saw last night. Sarah just looks down at him unsure if she should say anything. You put an arm around him to comfort him but he just shrugs it off, wallowing in his pain and depression. Sarah sets the both of you down on her pillow and lets Seth recover. You are quite dizzy from what had just happened so it took you a few seconds to finally realize were you were. "I'm not so sure about him," Sarah whispers to you. You're not sure how to react, he is one of your own kind, will you side with a human rather than one of your own people. She right though, you think. "I seriously think something is wrond with him, and I mean beyond losing everthing," Sarah said. You think she is right, you looked into his cold violet eyes and saw no emotion. "So what do you want to do about all this," you ask Sarak. She just looks away and shakes her head.

It's leaves go down around you, hiding you from everything. The soil is a bit wet, due to being freshly watered, and the bottom of your pants get muddy. Sarah comes back down the stairs to you after a few minutes. "He told me what happened." she takes a deep breath. "He was abused as a child, and captured by the crusaders. They beat him and tortured him until they had broken him, mind as well as body." After hearing that, you feel selfish for hating your old life. It wasn't great, but there was no abuse or torture. "He also wants to show you what they did to him during the torture." you nod and step onto her hand. She goes slowly up the stairs to Seth. You walk over to him and you see a flicker of something behind the cold, hardened stare of his eyes. It wasn't anything huge, but hopefully a start. He tells Sarah to look away. He removes his shirt, showing a deep jagged scar running from his shoulder all the way down to his lower thigh. "Oh my god." you mumble as he shows you his back. Eighteen scars from whippings. Not to mention that he was stabbed in the leg. "That isn't everything. They told me things. Stripped away everything I respected and loved. They left me with this shell that was my life! Don't you understand?" You nod, knowing that his pain was beyond anything you could comprehend. By this time he looks almost, peaceful, as if sharing this had taken a weight off his shoulders. He gives you a nod and then goes over to his pillow. "I need to thank you two. This morning I was planning to kill myself." he ends with that. And something else flickers in those strange eyes. Happiness? No, more that he's, at peace. Then.......

1111121211222212221222121112.content:
You feel a sense of relief as well as happiness that Seth now seems to have made peace with himself. You look up and find Sarah has left. You look back over at Seth and see him looking out the window not far from Sarah bedside. You recognize this as a drastic change in his former personality, whereas before he would sit and stare at the walls. You had no idea the profound effect of his revelations. "So.." you say in a sort of awkward voice, "how long,...". He turns his head without moving his body, and his black hair seems to have almost gained color in the light streaming in from the window. "What do you mean?" he asks with less hostility in his voice. You just shake your head and say "Nevermind...". He looks at you curiously; this is the first time you have seen a signifigant expression on his face. You sit down a short ways away from him and look out the window. It's sunny out, and a great deal of light is coming through despite the thick cover of grey clouds in the sky. You realize that you almost never look at the sky; it so, so vast. You never really seemed to notice with so many other things in the world that are bigger than you, the sky is the only one that wouldn't.....couldn't hurt you. Birds, you never were an envious person but you find that they seem to be something that you aren't necessarily jealous of but wish that...... Your thoughts are interupted when Sarah comes back in. She is holding a strange silvery object that has what looks like numbers written on it and has various lights shining off of it.

She sit down on the bed and you and Seth are almost thrown into the air and come rolling down into the depression in the matress that she is making. She catches site of the two of you and carefully picks you both up and apologizes. She set you both on her leg, and lifts the strange object and seems to be reading something from it. You look over to Seth and see him look back at you with a similar look of curiosity. After a few seconds she sets the object down next to her and scoops you both up and lifts you up. You roll over and sit squarly in her palm looking up at her huge face. "Are you sure you're okay, Seth?" she asks, and Seth just looks up and gives a sort of restless nod. She smiles, and look to you with an almost sad but questioning glance.

"She's just as nice as me, she would never hurt anyone." Sarah tells you to reassure you. You think, the sock drawer was not fun, and why wouldn't she be nice. Then again, Sarah was not very gentle when you first met, and you may be hurt again. You have trouble deciding so you want to sleep on it. Seth settles in on the floor. You get a lift to the table, and get ready to sleep yourself.

The next morning Sarah gets up and gets ready. Seth doesn't even wake up. He sleeps curled into a ball. It seems that even though he was appeased, his sleep was not so lucky. After Sarah leaves and sets you on the floor, he wakes with a start, cold sweat running down his back. You ask if he's ok and he nods. Once again you feel pity for him. Nothing left. Tortured. Abused. And now nightmares added to the list. Something wells up inside you. Zach, Seth, and countless others lost a lot to the crusaders. For them, you want revenge. For the dead, you want revenge. Later, the two girls arrive and....
11111212112222122212221211122.title: Later that night

Kylie and Sarah come up to her room and you had already determined that you would meet her but as the two start up the stairs you notice that Seth starts to get a little nervous. As they come down the hallway Seth gets even more restless and you look over at him with concern. "Whats wrong, you don't want to meet her?" you ask him quizzicaly. He looks up at you from were he is sitting and sort of cocks his head to the side so he is looking at the opposite wall. "Well its not that I don't want to meet her its just that.....you see I had this nightmare last night, and it involved meeting her and well..." Seth trailed off. You understood exactly what he meant. "Well you can tell Sarah that and I still kinda want to..." but you were interupted from a shout which seemed to come from outside the window. You both turned your heads and saw what looked like one of your own kind on the branch nearest to the window. You caustiously approach the window sill with Seth and see a beaten, bloodied, crusader standing there. He had lond tangled brown hair, some of which covered his cut up face. "So, you two really have come to befriend this...this human girl" the limping crusader said with disgust. The voice, it sounded familiar, but you can't recognize the face. Seth seems just and puzzled with this surprise visitor as you. "Well I should have expected your clansmen to run and HIDE, while the others fulfill there (cough) their (cough, gag)." but before he couldn't finish what he was trying to say Sarah comes in and walks over to you. You turn your attention to Sarah and the crusader charges you and tackles you to the ground. Sarah doesn't notice so when she kneels down to Seth she asked him "Where is (your name)" but before he could respond the crusader and you struggle to the point where you fall off the window sill. As you two tumble down he lands of a one of the branches and gets knocked out. You struggle but manage to cling on. After a while you loose your strength and slip down and as you start to fall you manage to grab onto a crack in the outer brick wall. You pull yourself up and sit in the small gap in the mortar.

Meanwhile back up in Sarahs room Seth hadn't noticed where you went and so he couldn't respond to Sarah's question. "What do you mean you don't know were he went!" Sarah exclaimed in an annoyed tone. Seth was starting to get really scared, not only at your disappearance but Kylie and Sarah getting frustrated he started to rock back and forth trying to collect his thoughts. Just then Kylie came in without warning "Who you talkin' to?" Kylie asked as she slipped out and walks over to Sarah. Seth's eyes get wide and he nearly feints, and Sarah quickly turns to Kylie. "Uh, kylie I need to talk to you about...." but Sarah stopped what she was saying when she noticed Kylie get wide eyes as well. She turned to see that Kylie was staring at Seth, and Seth back up to her. "Uhhh.."
