Seth started to inch away and Kylie just sort of awkwardly stared downward, not saying anything. After a few more seconds of silence, Kylie finally asked, "So uhh...where did you come from...?". Seth didn't feel like answering, for he had been overcome with a nauseous feeling which almost seemed to eminate out of him and make Kylie sick as well.

As Sarah got to the bottom of the stairs she could see her parents standing there, obviously frustrated. Her short mother adjusted her glasses and ger imposing father stood there with his arms crossed. "Uh, you wanted me for something?" Sarah asked nervously constantly shifting her weight from one foot to the other. "What is this?" Sarah's mother asked, holding up a piece of paper with her arm cocked at an angle. It was Sarah's report card, she had meant to hide it when she brought it home but had gotten distracted whilst she talked to Kylie. "Oh, uhh...well I can explain!" she said defensivly, as she tried to sum up just how much trouble she was in. "Explain how you failed Calculus, and got a D in Science!" her father exclaimed with dissappointment and a hint of hostility. "And, not only that but what's this about texting during class?" her mother came back, her words like the swift riposte of a trained olympic fencer. "Oh come on, it was one time!" Sarah countered, trying desperately to find some ground to defend herself with. "Look can we talk about this later, Kylie is here and I have some other uhh....important things I have to deal with" she said, quickly running upstairs trying to hide her distress over you. "WE ARE TALKING ABOUT THIS LATER!" her father yelled after her as she ascended back up to her room.

She shut the door quickly behind her, causing a loud bang and shaking Seth back from his near camotose state of fear. "Alright, we gotta find (your name)!" Sarah says with determination in her eyes. Kylie and the Seth both sort of look over there shoulders and then go back to their awkward positions. "Come on guys!" Sarah shouts
1111121211222212221222121112221221.title: Kylie smiles.

11111212112222122212221211122212211.content:
You manage to pull yourself up onto sarah's desk. You see Seth, Standing nervously under the glass jar. Sarah and Kylie are looking for you.
"(Your name)!" Seth Calls from under the glass just as you're about to yell out to Sarah.
You look at Seth, who is frantically trying to get your attention.
"What is it?" you ask, walking over to the edge of the glass.
"How Do I get out of here?"
"I Just call Sarah or Kylie-"
"No! Don't!" Seth begins to panic. "I'm scared of Kylie."
Before Seth can do anything, Kylie spots you.
"Sarah!" She yells. "I found him!"
Sarah looks relieved as she picks you up.
"I was worried!" She tells you.
Your mind completely turns from Seth as Sarah starts to tickle you.
Seth seems to sit there, forgotten under the glass.
11111212112222122212221211122212211.title: Getting places

choices: It's more worth it to run...
111112121122221222122212111222122111.content:
You just sit there under the glass, Watching (Other Person) talking to sarah. Your attention draws to Kylie, Who stares at you. Nervous, You back away until you hit the glass. You gulp.
"Sarah, What are you gonna do with that?" Kylie says impulsevly.
Sarah just looks at you with an unsure expression. "I don't know."
"Are you gonna get rid of him?"
You whimper a bit and curl into a ball. Kylie looks at you sadly.
"I'm sorry. I didn't mean to frighten you." she says.
Hope starts to fill your mind as Kylie slowly lifts the glass.
Thinking that you could escape would be tremendously foolish. But then again, What would happen if Kylie got a hold of you?....Despecting what she just said?
111112121122221222122212111222122111.title: In my mind...

choices: Switch Back to the other POV
1111121211222212221222121112221221111.content:
You've had some experience being handled with Sarah so you shut your eyes tightly and await her grasp. As she sort of roughly and sloppily picked you up you could feel your insides churn and twist about with every (although unintentional) harsh blow. You finally came to rest in the center of her palm and you slowly opened one eye. You peered up at her and slowly opened your other eye, her expression was a mixture of uncertainty and pity. You adjusted your position and looked back up willingly with a fake smile. You opened your mouth to say something when all of a sudden a knock came from just outside the door. "Sarah..." came a muffled male voice, it was her father. As quickly as the knock happened the door swung open. And in an instant Kylie quickly snapped her hand closed with you inside, plunging you into a deep darkness. She turned around hiding her closed hand conspicuosly behind her back. At the same time Sarah in a state of panic quickly hid (Other Guy) in the only place that came to mind in that instance. She quickly slipped him down in her exposed cleavage and quickly straightened up to face her father, hoping desperately he didn't see anything.

So...
1111121211222212221222121112221221111.title: Await kylie's humongous hand.

11111212112222122212221211122212211112.content:
You sit in Kylie's hand scared of what will happen next. Your vision is completely black.
"How am I gonna get out of this." You think to yourself. Your thoughts start turning to before you met (Other Guy.) Life was so simple. A family, Friends, A home. But then the raiders came, killed your family, and destroyed your home. You beat your fist against Kylie's skin. Why was this happening to YOU? A innocent 12 year old that didn't ever mean any harm?
Your head pulsed. You thought about what would happen, even if you did make it out of Sarah's house. Where would you go? How would you make living for yourself? Now, It was back to square one. Depression. But then you thought again...What would happen if you became good friends with Sarah and Kylie? You'd be fed, housed, cared for, and....loved.
It had been a long time since that word meant anything to you or felt it. The best choice was clear. So now, the real question is. How do you get out of this mess?
11111212112222122212221211122212211112.title: Back to Square one, On two Circle 10.

111112121122221222122212111222122111121.content:
You pound relentlessly on the inside of Kylie fist, but it seems to no avail. The prison continues to entrap you and an overwhelming sense of claustrophobia seems to start choking you. You then let your body go limp, trying in one last act of desperation to relax. Your ears then pick up on the muffled conversation going on outside of you, but you notice another voice...one you don't recognize. After a while you begin to start to drift asleep, not from fatigue or a sense of peace, but as if by the hand of some supernatural or internal force. When you regain conciousness you see that you are now back on the table with Kylie's back still turned toward you. Her hand still hovers over you, still obviously shielding you from the sight of whoever is still in the room. After a few more groggy moments you notice the voice's absence, realizing that the figure had left. As you sit up you realize that almost no time had passed and your black out must have lasted only a few moments at the most.

"Oh my god" Sarah let out with a sigh, "that was close". She sat down on her bed and continued to sigh deeply, as if to rid herself of all the panic she had just felt. Kylie turned around and knelt down to check on Seth, while Sarah pulled out her phone and began to check her inbox. Once Kylie was satisfied that Seth was alright she turned around and looked at Sarah with a smirk.

"Aren't you forgetting something?" she asked, pointing to Sarah's chest. Sarah blushed and then began fishing around for her tiny friend. After a some searching she finally pulled him out from between her breasts, gently placed him back into her palm, and began relentlessy pelting him with questions.
Once all the excitement died down, Kylie turned back to address Sarah and said.....
111112121122221222122212111222122111121.title: Try to get Kylies attention.

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
Kylie look's at you (We're still in Seth's POV). She smiled a bit.
"Sarah...Do you think....that....I could take Seth home?" She asked nervously.
You lifted your head up and nearly screamed. Your eyes widened.
Sarah looked at you with a sort of frown.
"Well," she said. "it's up to Seth." You looked at Sarah, then at Kylie.
Kylie just stared. You knew that if you said no, she might be hurt. But you remembered that Kylie almost killed you. Your stomach knotted. Without thinking, you replied, "Um, Sure."
Kylie let out a squeal of happiness. You then looked at yourself.
"The HELL did I just say?" you thought to yourself.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Home is where the heart is.

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
(Back to your point of view)
As you see Seth carried away in Kylie's cupped hand you could see his face twisted in fear and anxiety. You feel guilt and concern wash over you, and almost speak up, but stop yourself. You're sure he'll be fine, I mean she'll treat him just as Sarah did...right? You felt certain of yourself for a while but soon become doubtful. After he leaves and Kylie waves goodbye to you, you turn back up to Sarah, peering up expectantly at her massive form. You shield your eyes for a second because the light is reflecting off her blonde hair, and it takes a few moments for your eyes to adjust and her beautiful but enormous face comes more clear. She looks down at you and smiles, stepping briskly back over to her bed and sets you down quickly on the mattress. You descend so quickly your stomach lurches and you nearly get whiplash, but you sink on the bed and stretch out, trying to collect yourself. Sarah goes on and starts talking but you don't really pay attention, you're too caught up with your own thoughts. Was Seth going to be ok? Am I really that attracted to Sarah? Where am I going from here? "So what do you think?" Sarah says abruptly, waking you from your stupor. "huh?" you say startled, "Do you think Seth will like it over at Kylie's?" she says looking up from her phone, her head resting casually on her hand. "Uhh, yeah...sure I guess...." you say despondently, Sarah frowns at your answer and slowly puts her phone down on her desk. She gets up and comes over to the bed, "Are you ok?, you seem a little...I don't know..." she ask, concern flooding her face. "Yeah, I just got a lot on my mind I guess, its nothing..." you respond, laying your head back on the bed, staring up at the ceiling. Sarah slowly sits on the bed, the disturbance causes you to fly up in the air shortly and crash back down lightly on the bed, you sit up and look at Sarah quizzically. She looks down at you, turns away, and sighs. She turns her head again and looks at you, her eyes narrowed and reaches down and gently but quickly scoops you up in your hand. You go tumbling around but manage to catch yourself in the center of her soft palm, looking up at her once again. "Ok" she says, "spill it..."
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Continue.

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
She stared intently, expecting that you would tell her everything. But, you knew it was best not to tell someone you feared their best friend was putting a life in danger.
"It's nothing. I'll just miss having someone my size around." You knew and she knew it was a bad lie. She sighed.
"Fine. I know there's more you wish you could say, but I understand. I'd feel scared of making someone so big mad in your situation." You felt relief seep through that she wouldn't force it out of you. You hopped onto her thigh and then slid back onto the bed. She simply leaned back and looked at her ceiling.
"I'm a little jealous of you. You have everything taken care of for you. No problems with people."
You chose not to reply and walked around, unsure of what to do.
"We should do something to pass the time. What do you think, should we play a game?"
You decide and say.........
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Sometimes Lies are the Best Option

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content: "Nah.." you stutter, "I'm not feeling up to it" you, further propagating your lie. She frowns, and puts on a faux sad face, "Awwwwwww come on, please!!!!!!!" she pleaded trying her best to look disappointed. She moved off the bed and knelt down so that her chin was level with the bed, her face coming about even with you. "We never get to do anything really fun..." Sarah whined, looking intent and eager. "I don't know, I'm tired, I've had quite a bit of craziness today..." you reply, trying desperately to persuade her otherwise. She frowns once again, and stand back up, rising up to her full enormous height, dwarfing you in her imposing form. For a second you're almost afraid she'll hurt you but that quickly subsides when she reached down and plucks you up between her fingers and places you gently in the center of her palm again. As soon as she has you securely sitting in her hand, she turns and sits on the bed again. "Is this about..."she begins but takes a moment to look down at her chest then back to you "me putting you down in my b-" she continues but you interrupt "No no no that's not it at all" blushing a little. "I don't know, I..." you begin but are this time interupted by Sarah "Its ok I get it you don't have to say anything" she sighed and layed back down on her bed. She leaned against her pillow and put her head back, you clampered up the edge of her open hand and look out at her prostrate form, carelessly watching her stomach rise and fall. The two of you sit in silence for a long time, before she gets up leaves the room for awhile. You see the light down the hall turn on, the same thing she does evening before she goes to bed. So you sit on and look around, think, and then.....
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: "Nah...."

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
A whirring begins outside, at first unnoticed but soon the volume increases and you look out the window, wondering what it could be. You see a man of your size gripping a spinning propellor float towards the open window. He landed, and you got a good look at him. He wore leather aviator-esque leather armor and goggles. A red beard covered what little of his face would have been visible.
"Some kid told me that there was someone living with a human, but I thought it was a joke." He approaches and sticks his hand out. "Gorjalf(Gore yalf), Rotor Knight of Amursta." You shake his hand and introduce yourself. The two of you stand on the bed for a few seconds.
"The damn Crusaders are ruining us. Our system of hiding was so good, and then they flushed out of our homes. If they keep going, we'll become known to humans." He grabbed your shoulders. "Do you trust the girl you're living with?" You nod. "If too many people learn about us it could be the end of our peace. Don't let anyone else know about you." You thought back to Kylie. Too late for that.
Sarah's humming could be heard as she entered the room.
"Bye, kid. I'll check back in occasionally. Don't screw this up!" He sprinted and jumped, then turned on his propellor and floated off.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Unexpected, at the very least

choices: Admit you're are very attracted to her
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
Still rather perplexed by what just happened Sarah comes in and sits back down on the bed, looking casually over to you for a second and then flips her head back again. You want to say something but decide not to, you absently start rocking back and forth not knowing what to do. Sarah sighed leans back on the bed laying back and stretching her arms back, her chest thrust slightly upward in the air. You can't help but stare, you're attraction to Sarah is beginning to the concern you. You always thought she was...well...beautiful, but now you're beginning to find yourself catching glimpses of her physique more and more frequently. The fact that you'd had recently been stuffed down in her cleavage didn't help much either. You shake yourself back into reality, looking back over to Sarah still laying on the bed, you get up and awkwardly walk over. You reach up and tap her hip, but she doesn't notice, you pound harder, still nothing. You run up and start trying to get her attention by tapping her side, "UHHH HEY SARAH" you yell. She finally stirs, shifting her body slightly causing you to fall over and faceplant into her body. "Uhh what is it, I'm tired..." she says in a whining sort of tone. You groan, and she evidently hears you, sighing again and throwing herself up again, looking down, seeing you face down on the side. "Whoa! Hey you ok?" she says worriedly and reaches down but you pick yourself up before she reaches you. "(Your name) what's wrong" she asks concerned. She twists around and lays back down on her stomach, this time with her face looming over you while resting on her hands.

Do you...
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: She didn't see him.

choices: Tell her to ask Kylie to bring Seth back.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
"I think I just miss Seth. It was nice having someone, well, my size around." You say, knowing that this was a good cover, as it was pretty easy to believe. You quickly add a bit to the end. "Not that you aren't nice, it's just different." She gives a pitying look.
"I get it. It was someone else who was in the same spot as you. I hope that you'll be okay without him for a little while. Kylie will bring him back next time if I ask her to." The offer was considerable, and you decide to...
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Something, anything.

choices: She sets you aside and leaves
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content: "Its ok, it'll be nice just the two of us again..." you say, trailing off with less conviction than you had hoped for. She sorta half smiled, sensing your less than inconspicuous undertones. She swept her hand underneath you again, slowly and carefully so as to not hurt you. As you tumble into her palm she lifts you up till you are level with her chest. She leaned back onto her bed so that she sat just barely on its edge with her long slender legs angled out keeping her propped up against the bed. You raised your eyes somewhat sheepishly, catching her ever so slightly exposed chest above her white shirt. Your eyes darted back down then back up to her, seeing her warm but mellow eyes rolling over you. She brushed back her hair and sighed, a look of concern coming over her face. "There's something I do need to talk to you about...." she began somewhat unexpectedly. You look up concerned, and begin to stutter somewhat nervously. "Oh its nothing bad its just that...well its my senior year and that means in about three months I'll be...going" she said, blundering into the final word with just enough misappropriated emphasis that the anxiety you felt only mounted. "Going? going where?" you begin. "Oh well I mean, you could come with me...but it'll be a big change, and I don't really know how we'd...." she stopped seeing your confusion and concern as you begin to contort into a ball without taking your eyes off her. "We can make it work, trust me" she said. "But I don't understand wha-" you began again but she interrupted you, holding her finger up to you, "Shhh its ok, look I shouldn't really have brought it up, its complicated but when you finish school you go....somewhere else...for another school, I'll explain it all to you later its really rather boring stuff anyway..." she said, her voice becoming more and more chipper. She stood up and lifted you up slowly to her face. "It'll be ok don't worry about it..." she began, a big smile drifting across her face. You remained silent but nodded in reply. "You know I envy you," she chirped, before lowering you again. "Envy me? why?" you said, but it was obvious she didn't hear you. You repeated yourself a little louder before she replied, "...because you're, I don't know, so free...I guess? free of responsibility, free from having to deal with..." her voice began to falter a bit. She looked down once more and said "because you have seen some of the best and the worst and you still seem to keep yourself together..." she then closed her hand around you.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Tell her it's fine.

choices: She takes you up to the bathroom
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content: You can't make much out of the darkness around you but you feel content as you gently rock up and down with each of her footsteps. Usually when she completely closed you up in her hand it made you nervous, but for some reason now it seemed peaceful. You decide to lay down and relax awaiting whatever it is she is going to do next. In a few moments she opens her hand again and you see you are downstairs in her living room. She sits down on her couch and lowers you to her lap. She tilts her hand just enough to let you slide off onto her thigh. She gives you a brief smile before turning her attention back to the strange glowing device she was playing with before. She taps away on it, completely enrapture by whatever is on it. You look up at her longingly and pound your fist on her leg, trying to get her attention. She doesn't notice. Finally you speak, "what's that thing?" She suddenly stopped her staring and looked down at you. "This?" she said pointing to the strange rectangle in her hand. You nod emphatically in reply. She giggles a little to herself and then lowers it down to your level such that it stands on her knee and leans against her open palm. "Its called a cellphone," she says with a laugh, "you use it for...well almost everything, you can talk to people, take pictures, play games, look stuff up..." she goes on. You sit there utterly confused as to how any of this is even possible. "Look stuff up?" you ask. "Haha yeah like research," she says. She went on and on explaining the different features and how people used them, flipped through her different apps and showed off pictures of her and her friends. You sit mouth agape, utterly amazed at all it can do. "How do you get one?" you finally ask. "You pay for it, they're usually pretty expensive though" she says, she leaned back a bit and set her cellphone aside. She look down at you again and you back up at her. "You probably have a lot of questions about stuff around here don't you?" she asked sweetly, "it never occured to me that this would all be so alien to you". You shrug a bit and adjust your sitting position. She sits back up again and leans down a bit, her golden hair cascade around you like a shimmering veil. "Come on, ask me something, anything!" she chimes. You have been pretty curious about some things. You sort through your thoughts about what things have been bothering you most and finally decide on one. "Why do you always wear something different each day? You even change clothes when you sleep!" you ask, this had always been particularly strange for you. Your people tended to only have a dozen pairs of clothes and you would wear each set as long as possible, for everything, until it became absolutely unbearable and would be washed after it rained. But she seemed to go through clothes by mood. She laughed a bit and went on to explain how certain outfits were expected for certain things and so on. You nod like you understand but fail to really see what she means. She then narrows her eyes a bit and decides to ask, "Do you ever change your clothes?", you give another shrug and reply: "yeah but we wear our for a lot longer". She then scooped you into palm once more and brought you up to her face. "I guess I never thought about it, but how do I get you tiny clothes?" she asked, "I suppose we'll just have to wash them every once and a while..." she began to trail off again. She tilted her head to one side and asked another question, "do you guys ever bath?" again you nod and reply, "yes but not often its dangerous and laboursome for us to find a good place to do it." She perks up a bit upon hearing this, "well come on I can help you with that, you probably feel filthy" she stands up and heads for the stairs.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: She takes you downstairs

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content: You're enveloped in the darkness of her hand once again as she hops up each step to the second floor. She twists about on the balls of her feet nimbly as she made her way down the hall to the first door on the left. She gently pushed the door open ajar to see if any light seeped out. Satisfied that it was empty she pushed the door aside and flipped on the lights. She brought her closed hand down to the edge of the sink and cautiously deposited you near an enormous tissue box. She quickly closed the door behind her and knelt down so that she could see you better. "Ok well we could do one of two things, I could leave it to you...I could probably find something for you to use. Or if you'd prefer to use the shower," she said, pointing to a large compartment in the rooms back that seemed to be made up of panels of frosted glass. "I could probably wait in here in case you need me." You weren't really sure what all this meant so you just sorta shrugged in response. She smiled a bit and then stood up to her full height. You craned your neck to look up at her as she turned and opened the door. She disappeared for a few seconds into the hallway leaving you alone on the counter. A moment later she returned with a small round white object in her hand. She closed the door once more and set it down next to you. It was almost as tall as you and it seemed to thin ridges running up its sides. She turned the sink on and a steady stream of water emerged, crashing with a pleasing hum into the sink's basin. She thrust her finger into the stream, waiting for it to heat up. "I figure you'd want your privacy so I got the bottle cap you can use." she said plainly. When she was satisfied with the water's temperature she filled the bottle cap about half way before placing it back down beside you. She pinched a tiny piece off of a bar of soap and dropped it into the water. "There you go," she said. "OH almost forgot!" she quipped just as she was about to leave. She took a tissue and began ripping off pieces of it and dropped it down nearby. "You can dry yourself off with those when you're done...I'll be back in about ten minutes ok, hopefully by then I'll have something else you can wear." She shot you a wide smile once before swinging the door open and heading back into the hallway. You sighed and made your way into the make-shift tub. The warm water felt good on your skin as you slid the misshapen mass of slope along your arms. Your kind never placed much importance in bathing, but since you'd began living with Sarah you've began to realize just how strange your society was. This moment alone allowed you to collect your thoughts as you lay down in the crystal clear water. You let yourself float so that only your face was not submerged. Then....
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: She takes you up to the bathroom

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
The door creaked open ever so slightly and Sarah's soft voice drifted in. "Are you ok in here?" she whispered. You shot back up and clung to the edge of the bottle cap, trying your best to hide yourself from her gaze. She poked her head in just enough to see you still in your makeshift bathtub. She let out a slight laugh and quickly retreated, "Oops sorry about that, well when your done you can put this on!" she said proudly. Her arms reached through the crack in the door and dropped a tiny wad of cloth on the other edge of the sink. "I'll be back in about five minutes, be ready by then ok?" she said before closing the door. You lept out of the cap as soon as she was gone and quickly scrambled towards the wads of tissue. After drying yourself off you made your way across the sink's edge and picked up the white cloth Sarah had deposited earlier. It was rather rudimentary even by your people's standards, consisting of a small but soft rectangle of white cloth folded over several times with a few tiny, crooked holes cut into it to act as sleeves and a neckline. You take a few moments but finally manage to figure out how to put it on properly. Once satisfied with how your new outfit looked you sat down cross-legged and awaited for Sarah's return. A lot of things raced through your mind, and even though you were happy with your new life you couldn't help but feel strange about how things were turning out. Would Sarah keep you forever like a pet? What was going to happen to Seth? Who was that strange man who visited me and what did he want? Why was Sarah going away and why was she so nonchalant about it? You were beginning to realize how much you didn't understand this new world of yours.

Suddenly the door swung open and Sarah came back in. She had changed into a white t-shirt and pair of short, loosely fit black shorts; the same sort of thing she always wore at night right before she went to sleep. She seemed in an especially chipper mood, almost to the point of dancing as she moved. She bent over top of you and addressed you keenly. "Awww you look great, I know they're not what your used to but considering it was last minute I'd say I did a pretty good job!" she cooed. You looked yourself over once more and nodded in agreement. She quickly scooped you up and took her back to her room where she deposited you next to the pillow on her bed. She disappeared for a few minutes and returned once more humming to herself cheerfully. The sheets had already been pulled down and after she shut the door behind her she nearly jumped onto the bed. You were sent up into the air good ways before landing awkwardly back onto the massive mattress. Sarah rolls over so that she faces you, a huge smile on her face and your blonde hair splayed about her head. "Hey I'm gonna be gone for a little while tomorrow night, ok? Will you be alright here by yourself?" you shift a little under her gaze but manage to formulate a reply. "Sure, where you going?" you ask. She laughs a bit and says: "Oh just this guy....I've been waiting for him to...take me out somewhere" she said giddily. You were confused and it was readily apparent. She furrowed her brow a bit and gave an amused smirk. "Its ok, its hard to explain, do people....date where you come from?". "What do you mean?" you ask in reply. She adjusted her position ever so slightly and continued to speak, "Like when a guy and a girl who like each other go out places and do stuff together...well its a bit more complicated than that..." she trailed off. "Well we don't have a lot of places to go for fun..." you begin, but you understand precisely what she means. She smiles again and swiftly changes the subject. You talk about your old world for a little while, a little about your history and where you grew up. By the end she was very sympathetic but also excited as she began to talk about all the things she'd take you to see and do "for the first time in your life" as she put it. After that she sat up, leaning on her left arm as her right hand descended on you. She picked you up and brought you up to her face. You were a little confused with what she was doing but complied nonetheless. She lowered you a bit and and then gently pressed you to her chest, just below her collarbone. You look up confused and she peers down with a content look on her face. "This is called a hug, its a sign of affection..." she says, "I suppose it makes more sense if you were my size..." she laughs. She then deposited you on your own pillow by her bedside and flipped off the lights.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: Sarah returned

choices: You two do something for a while
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content:
The next morning Sarah awoke her usual time early in the morning with the same degree of grogginess as she always did. You could hear her stir just as the first few glints of sunlight drifted through the slits between the closed blinds over her windows. She rolled over a couple times groaning with exhaustion before finally her alarm went off as usual. She lifted herself up and sat on the edge of her bed, rubbing her eyes and brushing her hair from her face. She stood up, looked briefly in your direction and then immediately walked out the door. You pretended to be asleep but watched her as she left. Your own fatigue finally caught hold of you again and sent you back into a dream-like state. You felt yourself falling...no drifting upward towards the sky, higher and higher and higher. It started out peaceful but as the distance between you and the earth grew further and further you stomach began to lurch and the calm of sleep was quickly replaced by the uncertain terror of a nightmare. You jolted back into consciousness and sat up...Sarah had gone and it was now mid-morning. You began your usual routine of pacing about and staring at various corners of the room. The door was slightly ajar and you could faintly hear the patter of soft, pawed feet coming down the hallway. Suddenly the same yellow-eyed monster from before poked its head in the room and wandered about the floor. You took special care to be as quiet as possible but you still poked your head over the nightstand's edge to observe it.
http://www.best-cat-art.com/images/gray-...
It paced around the room aimlessly for a while, its long tail swaying gracefully from side to side till it found a spot in the corner next to the dresser. It spun around a few times and once it was satisfied it laid down on the hardwood floor and began licking its paw. Though you were still frightened by the beast you were glad it came along, otherwise you'd be forced to continue staring at the ceiling like you usually did. It wasn't long before the feline was fast asleep and you grew bored yet again. Hours went by. You fiddled with your new clothes for a while, trying to make them fit better though you did little to alter its bulky shape. After a while you heard the door downstairs close. 'That's odd' you thought to yourself, 'Sarah doesn't usually get home for another few hours' But surely enough a few moments later Sarah pushed the door open and tossed her back on ground. She seemed exhausted but with traces of enthusiasm buried beneath her seemingly stoic temperament. The cat sprang to its feet at the sudden intrusion and began walking towards her. As it approached it rubbed its sides against her legs and she looked down at it with a smile. She picked it up and walked over to the bed where she then carefully set him aside. She turned to you with a cheerful expression. "Hey there, I've got good news!" she chirped. You sat up and looked at her quizzically. "I won't have to leave you alone everyday from now on!" "Really?" you ask, your voice welling up subtly with excitement. "Yeah I'm free now, its summer! I'm sure you were bored out of your mind but now we can do stuff!" she quips. A moment later she stands back up and reaches down for you. After gently clutching between her fingers and lifting you up you begin to remember your nightmare and start to choke with panic. She noticed right away and looks down with concern. "You ok?" she asked. You nod, though you can tell she doesn't quite believe you...
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: The Next Morning....

1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.content: After talking for a short while Sarah deposited you on her nightstand and left the room once more. She returned after a brief time and approached you. Typically she would adjust her height when she spoke with you to make you feel more comfortable, but this time she seemed distracted and instead addressed you whilst standing. She peered down like some massive primordial figure passing judgement on a pitiful mortal but her words were as sweet and caring as usual. "I'm going to be going out here soon...I hate to leave you again so soon I know its boring here all by yourself." she said sympathetically. You sort of shrug in an attempt to appear nonchalant about it all, though you secretly hated being left alone again. "Well I still have to decide what to wear, so we have a little time left, it'll be ok!" she said, trying to curb your anxiety. Sarah wasted no time in getting straight to it. She began rummaging through her closet grabbing all assortments of clothing, half of which the likes you'd never seen before. Shorts, jeans, skirts, dresses, everything of that manner was thrown onto the bed in rapid succession. You had no idea that there could be so much thought could be put into your appearance until now. Sarah began analyzing the mass of clothing on her bed occasionally throwing some over her shoulder or sorting them by color or style. She held some up against her body and turned to you. "What do you think?" she asked. You didn't know what to say, you'd never encountered a situation like this before. As you analyzed your current situation Sarah took note of your silence and laughed a bit to herself. She continued her task with a magnitude of focus that you had never seen in her before. After what seemed like half an hour she finally narrowed it down to two. "Ok now you have to give me your opinion..." she said as she spun around to you. She held up both and you took a deep breath. "I don't know..." you squeaked out hardly audible. "Come on you're a guy, I need a guys opinion, which is better!" she pleads. You remain silent. She sighs and look intently at both. Finally she decided on one and threw the other onto her bed. She turned around so that her back faced you and pulled her shirt up from the bottom over her head. You jumped a bit at your unintentional voyeurism but continue to watch as if entranced. She tossed her shirt aside and you could distinctly see her shimmering hair cascade down her bare back just barely touching the horizontal strap of her bra midway down her back. You can't help but feel a little ashamed. She slips her chosen apparel over her head and down around her, finally turning about to face you again. "Alright I think I'll go with this..." she says. Once satisfied with how it sat she approached you once more and knelt down. "I'll only be gone for a few hours ok?" she noticed the stress in your face. "Whats wrong?" she asks. "Nothing..." is your only reply. She frowns a bit and then quickly turns her head to check her phone. "I have to go, but I want to talk about it when I get back ok? I know something's bothering you..." she trails off. She immediately stood and headed out the door.
1111121211222212221222121112221221111211.title: She gets ready to leave

11111212112222122212221211122222.content:
Sarah continues to try and call for you but she cannot seem to hear your cries. After a while you can tell she is getting very frustrated and just gives you searching for you. You start to panic and you look down and see it is extremely high up and it look like a fall off the edge of the grand canyon to you. You start to feel a sense of vertigo and try to shake it off so you sit back down for a minute. You try and listen in on what they are saying but you can' hear it over the birds chirping, and usual of outside noise. However you can tell that Sarah is struggling to explain everything. "Well you see at first they were.....well I mean...no..." you could hear Sarah say, but you could also clearly distinguish a great deal of panic in her voice, no doubt cause by your abrut disappearance. You almost reach the top of the first brick when a gust of wind whip over you and although it isn't very strong it still almost causes you to let go. About half way up you realize that you have no way of getting up past the bottom of the window will which juts out about three inches (like 15 feet to you). So, you decide to pull yourself up and sit on the edge of the brick which you are nearing the top of. As you pull yourself up and take a second to catch your breathe you look down and almost pass out from vertigo. It was so high, and once again you envy birds for their ability to fly......

111131.content:
You are waken up by a loud explosion.

You look around, your eyes hurt, your throat is sore, and you are covered in a layer of dust and ash. Your vision is slightly blurry but you can still make out the grim room that you are in. It is grey, and is dimly illuminated by a hangind lamp which is swaying back and forth. You try to stand up but then feel a surge of pain in you leg, you look down and see that it is bleeding. With much effort you hoist yourself up and take another look at the room you're in. It is made of cinderblocks and on the ground you see a pile of rubble. You look over at the far wall and see scrawled onto it with some kind of black chalk or cinder the word 'Nevermore'

How did I get here, you ask yourself. Where am i, then you notice what appears to be white footprints starting not far from where you were laying and leading out to the rusty metal door to the far left of you. You limp out and find your self in an equally depressing brick hallway leading to a staircase about 30ft away. You limp over to one of the three shattered windows to see if you can find out where you are. As you walk over another explosion goes off somewhere nearby and the violent shaking makes you fall to the ground. When you lift your head you see what looks like a tarnishes silver locket. You reach out and pick it up, on the back 'Nevermore' is scrawled on in the same blackish charcoal like substance.

You open it up and see on one side an old black and white photograph with a boy and a burly man with a thick black moustache. On the other side you see a small sqaurish coin like object, when you take it out you see that each side and slide and twist like a rubix cube minus the colors and all

You flip on the TV hoping that maybe something interesting is on for once. As you are flipping through the channels, you find the news is covering another story about that giantess you and everyone else has been hearing so much about.

"And are resources tell us that this giantess had passed through Willow City yesterday, many in the surrounding areas are advised to evacuate immediately..." the reporter says.
Whats the big deal, you think, has anyone been hurt or killed, its just the media blowing things out of proportion again. Then you remember, Willow City isn't to far from were you are.
Despite your firm belief that this giantess is not a major threat you still feel uneasy about it.

Do you......
111132.title: Curiosity

choices: Sarah is attacked by the government
1111321.content:
You lay down on your king size bed. IT was late in the afternoon, but you are unemployed so you have no we’re to go. You flip through channel after channel on your Tv trying to find something interesting, but every news channel talked about the supposed giantess wrecking havoc all around the country, she was last seen in Willow city, and even though it was Offaly close to your city, you felt like it wasn’t a big deal. Soon your apartment starts to rumble, ever so slightly. At first you thought it was a earthquake but as time passed the earthquakes seem to get worse, soon you couldn’t even stand on your own two feet anymore.

“OH MY, WHAT A CUTE LITTLE CITY.”

you hear a ground shaking voice that rocks you to your very core. You knew immediately, who was behind the earthquakes, you knew who that voice belonged to, and you felt like a idiot, a idiot for not living this god forsaken town. The giantess was here, and you were in trouble. You run outside and stand on your balcony, what you see makes you soul shudder, and your heart skip a beat.

The giantess was 700 feet tall. Her head was in the clouds and her toes towered over every building in your city. You could barley see the top of her head, but you could tell that she had long blond hair that came down to her massive shoulders.

“HELLO LITTLE PEOPLE, MY NAMES SARAH, ITS NICE TO MEET ALL OF YOU.”

The giantess bends down and puts her hands on her knees. She was looking at the whole city with great entrust, and then the unspeakable happens she looks right at you.

She couldn’t see you could she, you where not even a inch tall compare to her, you where a speck of dust, there was no way she could see you. You do not move, you barley had any strength in your legs to stand up right. You stay on the balcony staring at the giantess as she stares back at you. You were starting to get the impression that she could see you, seeing as how her eyes never left your location

“HELLO LITTLE GUY, HOW ARE YOU DOING TODAY.” The giantess said with a smile on her face. The biggest smile that you had ever seen.

“WHATS YOUR NAME?”

The giantess takes a small step towards your apartment. A step that rocks the whole city to its very core. You did nothing, you said nothing. You looked at her toes and saw how they dug into the ground, creating huge cracks that where big enough to swallow hundreds of people. This was her power and now this powerful being was looking right at you, you had here undivided attention. Lucky you.

“CAN YOU PLEASE TELL ME YOUR NAME LITTLE GUY?” The giantess said with a little sadness and fear in her voice.

You still said nothing, what could you say, would she even hear you. It was already obvious that she saw you.

“OK JUST WAIT A MINUTE, DON’T WORRY IM NOT GOING TO HURT YOU.”

the giantess stretches out her fingers and as gently as she can she grasps your apartment. To you it looked like two meteors where coming right towards you, two meteors that where skin colored. Sweat ran down your forehead, you wanted to scream but you lost the will to even do that. Soon the giantesses gigantic fingers grasp the whole apartment building. You felt the building shake, you stumble to the ground as the g-force became to unbearable to stand. The whole building started to rise off the ground at speeds never before seen. It was a miracle you where still alive. The building started to shake again and with a loud “BOOM” everything became still and quite. So quite that you heard the wind run through your ears and blow around your brown hair.

“OK NOW WE CAN HAVE A PROPER CONVERSATION. SO HOW ABOUT YOU TELL ME YOUR NAME.”

You heard the giantesses voice again, but this time it was even louder, so loud that you had to cover your ears.

“OH IM SORRY IS MY VOICE TO LOUD, ILL TRY TO TALK A LITTLE MORE QUITLY.”

The giantess lowered her voice but it still was earth shattering. What really surprised you was that she could see you.

“SO LITTLE GUY WILL YOU TELL ME YOUR NAME.” The giantess said with a little hope in her voice

“M, my, my names Jake, Jake Summers.
1111321.title: Stay put, nothings going to happen

choices: You guys continue to park there.
You two decide to go back to her place now.
You ask to be let back into the city.
11113211.content:
“HELLO JAKE, IT IS GREAT TO MEET YOU,” she answers trying to be casual but with a slight burst of excitement and anxiety. “WHAT DO YOU DO?”

“Ahh,” you begin to answer. What do I do? You ask yourself. You’re currently kind of a unemployed bum. How do you explain that?

“IS SOMETHING I AM DOING MAKING YOU UNCOMFORTABLE?” she pleads with you, your pause causing a pinch of pain in her face.

“No, no, it’s just that…”

“WOULD IT BE HELPFUL IF I SIT DOWN?” She continues, interrupting you. “HOW’S THIS?” She takes a few steps towards the large park a few blocks from your apartment, several block forest next to the ocean. Normally, it’s about a 10 minute walk for you, but she does it in one step. She bends her knees and begins to sitting down. You brace yourself again for the g-forces and fall within her palm, since that helps slightly. She’s careful not to touch any of the large buildings, but still manages to accidently nudge an unoccupied bathroom building collapsing it. She’s sitting in the park, with her dangling out into the ocean.

“HOW’S THIS?” she asks you. “OH NO, DID I HURT YOU?”

She reaches her index finger over, which looks like a pillar for a skyscraper for you. You indicate that it’s not necessary, and she retracts it before it gets to you.

“Oh no, it’s just the g-forces when you move up and down, like a painful roller coaster.”

“I’M SORRY. I DIDN’T KNOW IT AFFECTED YOU LIKE THAT. I’LL TRY TO BE MORE CAREFUL.”

There was a pause. “NOW WHAT DID YOU DO?”

“I’m, uhh, currently in between gigs.”

“OH I SEE. YOU HAVE A LOT OF FREE TIME, I GUESS.”

“Yeah, I guess so.”

“WELL, I LIVE IN THE OUTSKIRTS OF TOWN, GIVEN MY SIZE. IF YOU’RE UP FOR IT AND WANT TO HANG OUT, AT ANY POINT PLEASE LET ME KNOW. IT GETS… LONELY UP THERE WITH NO ONE ELSE TO TALK TO.”

“Ok thank you.”

What happens Next?

choices: She decides to go investigate the boat.
