111231.content:
Robert stood on the docks, the morning sun just peeking over the horizon. He had heard of the giantess rumours that had started way back in the 1700's when the island was discovered. You wouldn't find it on any maps of the area in the South Pacific or by googling its name, Mysteria. You had to have connections and Robert knew one man who could tell him the location of the island. The British colonised the island and had influenced the locals, many spoke English and even wore Western clothing with some semblence of Western civilisation but the islanders were all tanned, the way they were when the English arrived.

A guide had been arranged for him to help him around the island in order to show him around but Robert had not been assured that he would be allowed to look for her, it was a taboo topic on this island. The islanders loved her and would defend her to the death if someone tried to harm her. Despite her large size, she was very gentle and friendly( so he heard) but wouldn't hesitate to hurt someone if they tried to harm the islanders. Robert saw a tall man dark man, his hair coffee black and his skin a medium brown approach him ,wearing a light blue shirt and brown trousers, tucked in. " You must be Robert, I am Michael." he said, shaking Robert's hand.

Meanwhile, the giantess sat on the cliffside, she lived in a cave on the island's extinct volcano, it made for a good warm home for her, the only place big enough for her to live in comfortably. Living with the islanders, no matter how well they got along was a bad idea. Smashed huts caused by her tossing and turning during her sleep and annoying them with her mini quakes everytime she took a step were too much for them and her and she agreed to live away from them and only to come down for visits. She protected them from the monsters that lurked in the interior of the island, none of them could harm her at all so it made for easy defending, just step on the giant man-sized bug and that was the end of the matter.

She wore a floral dress the islanders had made for her, her dress revealed some cleavage but she didn't mind. The sight of a boat made her curious, she hadn't seen one in ages and this meant someone new was on the island. She didn't age, well not very quickly but vey slowly, she had been here when the first islanders arrived about 3000 years ago and hadn't aged at all since then, she maintained the look of a woman in her mid-twenties, tanned with long black hair and a pair of brown eyes.

She looked at the boat and thought about what the visitors wanted, if it was bad, she would be there. She should, perhaps they came to look for her, something everyone not from the island is keen to catch a glimpse of her, her friends had prevented that since they knew to reveal her existence would be to compromise her situation, they would come and try to take her away. Her name was Savannah, she had thought about that word and it stuck, she loved it and made sure all on the island addressed her as such, though some called her Sav.

She pondered coming down t
111231.title: The Mysterious Island.

111232.content: Out Of This World! - You get to a world of giantess. Hey! It may not be expected, but it's still an undiscovered giantess.
111232.title: Others.

choices: A HUGE Shadow Casts Over You
A Warm Blast Of Air Hits Your Back
1112321.content:
Little Note - I'd like it if there are no human giantess.

Your name is Jacob, and you scared very easily. Your father doesn’t seem to care so much about it though. He is a world famous inventor, and is working on a way to cut down on rocket fuel for space travel. How he is doing this is with a teleporter to other planets. He calls it the Power Packed Planet Warper, or the PPPW for short. You have a cat as well, but she doesn’t do much other than sleep.

It was finally time to test the PPPW, and your father was using an apple as a test. He had set the coordinates to the moon, and started the countdown.

20, 19, 18, 17

The computer controlling the countdown said. Sadly your father forgot to lock the lab door, and your cat walked in. She went into the PPPW. She mistook the apple for a ball, and started to roll it around in the PPPW. She isn’t the smartest feline in the world. You had been looking for her for quite a while, but when you went to the lab to ask your father if he had seen her, you saw that she was in the PPPW, and your father hadn’t noticed.

10, 9, 8, 7, 6

The countdown just kept going. You run over to the PPPW as fast as you can. You manage to get to it, and get your cat out. You sigh, and put your foot out in front of you to start walking when you hear.

3, 2, 1. Activating planetary transport…

The door to the chamber slides shut, and you were sealed inside of the PPPW. You start to panic, and bang on the door. Your father sees you, and panics as well. He started to randomly press buttons on a keyboard, but to no avail. You hear the computer again. This time it a siren blared, and you heard.

Malfunction! Malfunction! Last emergency transport activated!

That was all you heard before a weird blue gas filled the chamber. It made your head ach, and you eventually pass out.

When you awoke you were lying on grass. You got up, your legs a little wobbly, and scan your surroundings. To the north there was a GINORMOUS mountain with a huge cave in it. It was WAY to far away for you to get there in one day by foot. To the south there was a landscape full of hills as far as the eye could see. To the west there was a forest of tall trees. It looked like it went on for miles, and looked easy to get lost in. You decide that it would be the easiest to find shelter, and food there. Finally, to the east you see a lake large enough that you could barely see the other side of it. You assume its fresh water, and start to walk to it.

Your father had told you about the purpose of the ‘Planetary Transport Mode, or ‘Safety Mode’. He told you that if the astronauts we not prepared enough for the trip, then the machine would malfunction. It would instantly warp them to the nearest planet with breathable oxygen. You know that your father would come to get you once he found the coordinates, so you don’t want to wander far. The only thing that worries you is that since this planet could sustain life, there could be other life forms around. Weather they’re kind, or cruel, you don’t want to be found by an alien.

You eventually reach the lake, and get down on your knees. You cup your hands under the water, and bring some to your mouth. It was drinkable, but it tasted like something had been swimming around in it. You notice the water start to bubble in the center of the lake. Almost as if something was about to rise out of it. You panic, jump to your feet, and make a mad dash for the forest.

While running, you’re not really paying much attention, but you think you faintly hear the word…

“Stop!”

There was no way in hell you were going to stop running. You’d rather risk getting lost in the forest, than risk your life with some alien. Hearing that voice you just start running faster, and eventually reach the forest. You run deep into it, and hide behind a tree in fear of the possibility that, that creature chased you…

(I edited this to make it fit the rules as best as possible...)
1112321.title: Out Of This World!

11131.content:
Here are a few ideas that you can work with

Mountains - You are a traveller in a foreign land being pursued by hostiles, you can't continue in this frozen enviroment until a helpful giantess saves you, (remember this is set back in time)

Freak Show - A giantess is being held by a group of cruel inquisitors, witch hunters, and purgists, until a man arrives and purchases her and takes her back to a strange place where many other creatures, such as griffins, trolls, and centaurs
11131.title: IDEAS

111311.content: You walked up the mountain. Well, it was more of a hill. You destined to see the great statue of Cohezian, A Egyptian God. It could have been better, dealing with the wildlife, The hill, and the sun. You reached the top and saw the statue. It was 50 feet, and looked like a gigantic woman. You gave a snapshot. Then,
111311.title: The Great...uh..."Hill" Of Giza.

1113111.content:
The voice came from the statue, or at least seemed to come from the statue, as you fell over. It was then that you realise that the statue seemed to be coming to life, and she was staring with a metamorphing gaze at your panicking form as a flash transfigured the statue to a fully realised lady standing as tall as the original statue. You couldn't stop gazing at her perfectly shaped navel as the statue spoke directly at you, her voice booming and you stumble over in shock. She had a cropped hernia coloured hair with blue eye-shadow and a tanned appearance. You couldn't think of anything to say. She looked like a very large Egyptian teenager, at least 19 years old.
"Call me Tethys," the statue-lady spoke, "May I inquire what you are doing, gazing up here?"
1113111.title: "Excuse me, you're up my hills."

1113112.content: A Stairway suddenly appears. "No Freaking way!" You say.
1113112.title: The Secret Entrance

choices: Beldrict talks to the lead figure (High Inquisitor) and you stay put
Beldrict talks to the figure while you prepare the wagon
111312.content:
"Looks like a storm," Beldrict monotonously says, as if trying to stir up conversation. You dismiss his statement and continue staring out into the forest. You shift uncomfortably in your seat next to him on the wagon. The mules are old and gray but they are strong, stronger than any Mule one could find anywhere else, they were bred well, you should know, you helped. The cold wind rushes over you and sways the branches of the barren, creepy old trees to make it look like a crowd of angry demons reaching into the sky. Beldrict is right, it does look like rain. Of course, you think to yourself sarcastically, what more to make this little trip even more depressing, more awkward. You have been working for Beldrict for years now but you are still quite young, and being alone with him on this "business venture" made you rather uncomfortable. However the most unnerving thing is more so what you are going to acquire. Everything about this trip makes you want to vomit. These "Grand Inquisitors of Divinity" seem like a sketchy bunch but when Beldrict heard what they had, he jumped at the chance. You know very well Beldrict is a good man, old, wise, but sometimes he seems too wrapped up in his work. You never had much in the way of family so he's always been sort of a father figure to you. But he's always thinking about the next gimmick, where they plan to travel next, and of course the next addition to his show. Just two days ago when he heard of.... well it, he couldn't stop talking about, the excitement just made his eyes light up. You were glad to see him so happy and so when he asked you to join him today you couldn't just say no.

You've never been here before. Ever since you started traveling with show, you have been able to see many places, but this place; it's different, very different. The trees are grey and barren and you can't help but feel a sense of dread as you both travel slowly down the beaten old road. Your thoughts start to overcome your alertness and you begin to nod into a light sleep. The cloudy sky almost gives an illusion of night only serving to make you even more tired. The rocky road starts to become even bumpier and you look up and see a clearing just ahead. "Well, looks like were here" Beldrict announces as the old cart pulls onto a cobblestone path. You can tell that Beldrict senses your anxiety. He knows because this has happened before. When he introduced many other......things..... to you that have become part of you daily life. You look around at the dismal place you have come to. A large stone building with a tower twisting up at least 100 feet into the air. Several smaller stone and wooden structures that look like they were thrown together overnight surround it. At first the place seemed empty then you notice a black hooded figure with a cross around his neck and a long metal staff. You eventually pull around and stop at the entrance to the large stone building. Another hooded figure is standing there, this ones face is showing though; he has scruffy blonde hair with a scar across his mouth, stubble, and grey hateful eyes. He is resting a crossbow on his shoulder and in his other hand holds a crucifix made from wood and sharpened to a point at the bottom. Then the massive wooden door open and a few more figure step out.
111312.title: Freak Show

choices: You take the giantess back with you
1113121.content:
"So, you must be the one so interested in our.....prisoner" a grisly figure says in a voice that reminds you of a crow cawing. He wore an odd hat, much like that of a witch but flat on top instead of coming to a point. His old duster coat looks to have suffered many abuses while the rest of his garb seemed fit for killing. He hasd a rapier at his side and you could faintly make out what appeared of be blood stains on his coat and boots. He had grey scraggled hair and a large red scar which came across his whole face. "Yes, we're here to see, uh...her is it?" Beldrict inquiries obviously less bothered by this group of vagabonds. "Aye, follow us" The lead inquisitor says before turning with his troop of creeps following. Beldrict clambers down from the cart and you are hesitant to move. "Come along then," Beldrict calls to you in a hopeful voice. You plop down onto the muddy ground and follow close behind Beldrict. They lead you around the stone structure to the large cliff face which looms over the entire area. As you try to keep up with them, Beldrict and the other discuss some business, and you now notice the large number of witch hunters, inquisitor, and mysterious acolytes which dot the encampment that you pass to the right. Some chanting, others sharpening weapons, while one burned a strong incense, whose stench struck you like punch in the face.

As you came to the back you saw a massive naturally formed cavern entrance at least 60 feet tall and 40 feet wide. Once you saw this you were immediately overcome with a sense of dread, as if something truly sinister dwelled within. After some protest you finally followed Beldrict whose own demeanor was as chipper as ever. They guided you down into the depths of the cavern armed with torches and whips.. "So, why are you so concerned with this monstrosity" the leader asked, obviously annoyed with your presence. "Well, I was hoping we might......perhaps if you were willing to.......you see I think that this would be valuable for" but as Beldrict tried to explain his plans you entered an enormous chamber that seemed to extend into an eternal darkness. There, a large crack in the ceiling let in a little light and illuminated a murky, muddy pond across which sat a hulking figure, curled up facing opposite of you. Your heart began to race and a cold sweat formed on your brow. "Hey, come now you wretch, you have company" the Inquisitor yells. It is then you notice the figure is in shackles and a large chain connects the thing to the wall. Then the massive figure lifts its head and you notice that it is a woman, well not a woman but a giantess. She had long black hair, which shined like ravens feathers in the dim light. You looked fearfully into her green eyes and saw a great deal of fear and grief from her as well. She had grime covering her face and arms and was dressed in a sort of leather or brown linen which was torn in multiple places. You look over at Beldrict and his eyes are lit up with anticipation. "So, how much to take this fine specimen off your hands?"
1113121.title: Beldrict talks to the lead figure (High Inquisi...

choices: You arrive and the giantess is stubborn to move
You arrive and the giantess is cooperative
11131211.content:
After much arguing, debating, bargaining and such Beldrict finally convinced him to sell her for a rather high price. So, armed with whips, pikes, torches, and other rather foul looking weapons the assembled vagabonds surrounded the giantess. You saw her eyes get wider and she started to curl up into a ball; she was obviously very afraid of them. Then you noticed that some where latching her wrists together through a strange iron belt, they bolted her hands so they would be locked against her waist. Then for some reason she screamed, "AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!", it was a scream of agony and it caught you and everyone else off guard. Her voice shook the caverns and you dove behind a rock in fear. Beldrict ran over to you and said "Perhaps you should go ready the cart" with a look on his face that was half between worry and regret. You nodded, absolutely speechless, and ran out as fast as you could. Just as you exited the cave you could hear many of the inquisitors yelling and the cracking of whips. You were near to tears. You waited by the cart, there was nothing that you needed to prepare, and Beldrict knew this and only told you to go because he knew how much it bothered you. After what seemed like half an hour, you could feel the earth shake faintly and you looked up and saw the giantess being led towards the cart. As she passed many of the monks and inquisitor bystanders bowed their heads and marked the sign of the cross across their torso. She hung her head so that her long dark hair kept you from seeing her face. Your heart began to race as she approached.You were unsure of what to do, so you just stood there awkwardly with hands at your side, shaking. When they got to you, you look up at her and faintly made out her piercing green eyes through her hair looking back down at you. You turn away and start to walk toward the woods, "Wait, (your name) we need...." you ignore Beldrict cry and he lets you go. You stare out into the woods while they get her to sit down onto the flat cart (which is pretty huge). After Beldrict does some more bargaining with brutes he buys 10 oxen and manages to hitch them up along with your 4 mules, he walks back over to you. "We're ready to go, come along" Beldrict says to you in an apologetic voice. You sort of turn and look at the giantess strapped down on the cart. Her legs are covered in chains which rap around the bed of the wagon. You look back to her face, which is still hidden.'

As you start off you continually look over you shoulder to the giantess. She makes you extremely nervous though you know there is nothing she could or would do; her spirit.....its been broken. Beldrict looks also like he is going to be sick, and has a look of concern and pity on his face as he stares up the road ahead. He notices you staring at him and raises his grey eyebrows as if to ask 'what do you want'. You shake your head and look back and the road. Despite the giantess's enormous size the draft animals are able to slowly pull her along. The trip takes twice as long to get back. The giantess doesn't move, doesn't speak, doesn't make a sound the whole way. "Thank god" you think.
11131211.title: You take the giantess back with you

111312111.content: You get off the cart and a few more people run out. Zenn, the acrobat was running up to the cart. He stopped and did a quick backflip as was customary for him. At 15, he is the youngest of the workers, but despite working for the circus and being an orphan he keeps a good attitude. "Need any help?" he says his boyish face looking happy, with a twinkle in his eye yellow eyes. He is a mix of species, mostly human, with unnoticeable elf and dwarf hidden in there. At 5' 8, he isn't too short and his entire body was laced over in strong muscles. The other to approach was Meg, the cook. She is a skinny little woman and cooks extremely healthy meals. She has short blond hair and a face that looks like that of a child, though aside from her height she seemed to be aged and withered. She stopped at the cart and asked "Need anything?" Beldrict steps down, and pats Zenn on the back. "Zenn and I will unhook her while you two go inside." He tosses a key to Zenn which he catches, and cartwheels over to the locks. "Showoff" Beldrict mutters. "Jealous?" says Zenn teasingly. "Don't tempt me to shoot you, those flips won't help much then." Beldrict says patting his crossbow. As you can tell he was wary of the giantess and Zenn was too. Both talked casually but feared the huge person they were unlatching. You and Meg reach the cottages and huge tent that make up the circus. You look back and see that Belddrict and Zenn just finished unlatching her. Beldrict calls to her in a loud voice. "Come with us for your dinner." but she remained still. Zenn looks over at Beldrict. "You wanna climb up there Zenn?" he whispers. "Are you kidding me? She could easily crush me." she then began to whimper as she turned her face away. "What do we do?" Asked Zenn. "Let's talk to her see if she will get up." Though they spoke as patiently and calmly as they could the giantess remained prostrate sobbing quietly to herself. After half an hour Zenn finally had had enough. "Alright I'll climb up." says Zenn who climbs onto the cart and shakily walks around to her face. Compared to her, he was about three inches tall. He looks at her face and began speaking once more. After a few minutes she rose, shaking the cart violently as she moved. Zenn fell and landed on his hands. He flipped over onto his feet and he looks up at the huge girl. "You want something to eat?" he calls up to her and she slowly nods. He leads her to the outdoor mess-hall and you, Meg, and Beldrict carry the plate of food to her while Zenn continues to talk to her. You go inside quickly and go to your bunk that you and Beldrict share. You fell asleep and had terrible nightmares of the giantess killing you. The next day....
111312111.title: You arrive and the giantess is stubborn to move

choices: You go back and find beldrict
1113121111.content: You wake up in the morning with a bright ray of sunshine in your face. You sit up in bed and realize you were sweating, thank god that nightmare is over. You slide down from your bunk and see that Beldrict has already left, as usual. You walk out and are immediately hit by a cool autumn breeze, and for a moment your mind is preoccupied by things other than giantesses. You see Zenn already at the tent were all the mules, horses, oxen, sheep, bulls, bonnacons, minotaurs, and other beastly creatures are kept. Thats were you usually work, helping to maintain everything with animals, freaks, weirdos and other less human performers. You thought that Beldrict wouldn't try to involve you with the giantess after he saw how much it bothered you, but as you neared Zenn, Beldrict intercepted you and grabbed you by the arm and pulled you aside. It was then, as he was pulling you away that you saw Zenn's injury. He had a gash on the side of his head and a black eye. "What happened to Zenn-" you began to say and Beldrict quickly answered, "Well thats what I wanted to talk to you about" Beldrict said in a hushed tone. "You see last night, we needed to shackle the uh...well you know who I am talking about, but anyway Zenn was trying to talk to her and as he tried to put a lock on her ankle she pulled back and kept on doing it so Zenn got frustrated and started yelling and well...'' he paused for a moment and looked over at Zenn. " Well I don't think she meant to hurt him but she sort of kicked him off her ankle and well I assume you can piece together what happened after that" Beldrict finished. "Yes, and..." you started to say nervously "Why didn't you ask..." but Beldrict interrupted you and said "Well I know kind of bothered you and all..." Beldrict hesistated again "Listen here, since you are so much better with the larger 'additions', and well lets face it you're just more patient then Zenn, I decided to make you the main caretaker of our new guest" he finally finishes with a grimace on his face. You stare blankly at him for a minute. "Oh come now, ma boy," Beldrict continued, you know he was desperate, he only calls you "ma boy" when he desperately needs you for something. "This will be good for you and for her, besides no one else wants to and your the best at it so." "Alright" you say before he is done speaking. He perks up and gives you a smile "Alright!". Beldrict then walks off and starts shouting at bunch of sword swallowers messing with a dwarf. "Hey, so I hear you're in charge of the new addition to the family" Zenn says as he approaches you. You just sort of nod, trying to collect your thoughts. "Hey don't worry about it, and don't worry about this" he says pointing to his black eye. After talking with Zenn you figure you better go and check up on your new "friend", who you see washing the grime off her face with water from a large trough usually used to hold drinking water for large creatures but is merely a bowl to her. She looks down and stares at you, as if frozen, and you can see her eyes looking at you through several strands of her long black hair. You stand there motionless and petrified with anxiety or panic, you can't tell you're to scared.
1113121111.title: Goes smoothly

11131211112.content: Zenn hobbles by and you start to leave, seeing that his ankle was very broken. She doesn't do or say anything but you can tell she sees your fear. Beldrict is standing outside, there to see how it goes. "I can't do this." you say, and Beldrict looks a bit disappointed. "Alright, I won't push you into it, but she needs a caretaker and Zenn is only able to feed the mules himself." He begins mumbling to himself, doing calculations. His finger moves in the air, as if he were writing the problem into existence. You hear him mumble something about selling the third Minotaur and replacing it with something else. He looks up again. "Ah, instead, you take care of the leopards and minotaurs and I take her." you shake his hand and you do your new duties. Zenn hobbles in with his new cane. You go up to him. "You ok?" you ask, knowing he wasn't. "This," he replies, "is nothing. I've had worse. Remember that fall off the tightrope? Now that was painful." You remember it well. He fell off and hit the net, then bounced out and caught himself on the edge of the stands with his arm. His shoulder got yanked way out of joint and he fell again, breaking his wrist. He peeks into the giantess' stall and then hobbles in. You keep walking and leave, not wanting her to see you again. You hear Zenn's calm and cool voice talking to her, still with no verbal replies. He asks only yes or no questions which she answers with nod or shaking her head. A while later he hobbles out and goes to his room to chill out. Which he relishes, considering he does the work of two people for only the pay of one. Tomorrow.....
11131211112.title: You go back and find beldrict

111312111121.content: Later the next morning, while you sit out by a large pond with a natural spring which pours water down from the steep mountainside that is adjascent to the camp you see Zenn start to hobble towards you. You had come here to be alone for a while but this place is always populated by the other workers and performers, and you turned you head as he came over and walked up to him, completely ignoring the man who was trying to talk to you. "So, feeling any better?" you ask him and he just shakes his head and looks down. "Now come on, like I said don't worry about me, the real question is if you're ok." Zenn finally replied. You look, away and say "Yeah sure, why wouldn't I be?" you say in an almost shaky voice. You know that as bad as the feeling you get when you're around the giantess, the fact that everyone thinks, no KNOWS, you're afraid of her just drives you insane. "Alright, I get it..." Zenn says casually. "So what where you two talking about yesterday?" you ask with a curious look on your face. "Who- Oh yeah her, well I was just asking some stuff about her, but she never said anything. Look I really think you should reconsider, you know just as well as everyone else that you are the only one that would be able to get her to talk, or at least cooperate a little more" he said. You sort of nod and decide to go and just see her for a second. You run over to the stalls where she is located and peer in for a second careful not to let her know you are there. You then see she is curled up in the corner, her face buried in her arms. Beldrict is trying to talk to her but it is obvious she doesn't want him there. At first you think she is crying but she suddenly looks up and her eyes are fixated on you. She stares coldy at you with eyes that are full of frustration, fear, and anger. Beldrict turns to and seems quite surprised. "Uh, well now (your name), please come in for a second," you approach warrily. He leans in close to you and whispers to you "Look I absolutely need you to talk to her, I couldn't get her to talk to me at all but all I know is that she wants to talk to you. Beldrict then turns and leaves closing the door behind him. The giantess never took her eyes of you.
111312111121.title: Something happens

1113121111212.content: She says nothing and you stand awkwardly, not to mention you were swallowing your fear. Beldrict speaks up. "I will be right outside feeding the goats." He whispers into your ear. "If anything happens, come and get me. Ok?" You nod, knowing that you need to talk to her or you will be stuck making excuses forever. "You, uh, wanted to talk to me?" You say, not sure she would reply or not. She nods to you. Her eyes seeing your clear fear and she looks sad, yet does not reply. She looks at you again and she stifles a cry. Suddenly, your compassionate side comes out, as it does when you see these things. You walk up and awkwardly give her ankle a hug, for whatever reason, throwing caution to the wind. "Don't cry, It'll be ok. Just you wait and see." She seems touched by your sudden compassion and picks you up. You manage not to wet yourself as she gives you a gentle cuddle. Your fears are diminished at this, and you begin to loosen up. You talk about Zenn first. She listens intently, never interrupting or doing anything but giving the occasional questioning glance. You answer her glances by explaining whatever you can to her. You move to Beldrict and he peeks in, saying "I hear something bad, it'll be coming out of your pay, ok?" She giggles a little bit, and he leaves, happy to see you talking to her. Eventually Zenn hobbles in. "Hey you two, dinner time!" he hobbles over to the shackles at her ankles. Will you unlock her arms?" he asks, handing you a key. You walk over and you hear the lock click, and Zenn's as well. She rubs her wrist and ankle, and then when the next two locks open, she stands quickly, giving Zenn a shove, sending him to the floor. She squats down to look at him, worry in her eyes. He grabs his cane and pulls himself up. He sees the worry in her eyes and says "Don't worry, I'm accident prone anyways, it takes more than that to keep me down. Now casts on both arms? That kept me from doing much." She still looks concerned but less than before. You lead her out of the tent, her stooping to get out the door, and barely making it. At dinner you see a huge one person table with a smaller replica on top of it. You start to climb the ladder up the table leg, but she stops you and sets her hand down. You take a deep breath and.......
1113121111212.title: Silence

choices: She does some stuff with you (this includes just talking and what not)
11131211112121.content:
You decide, that if you are going to get her to accept you and everyone else, its probably best if you show that you trust her. You nervous climb onto her palm and sort of kneel, not sure how to position yourself on her hand. You look up at her and she gives you a weak smile, pleased with your descision. She slowly lifts you up to the table top, which although large in diameter isn't necessarily very tall, only about 20 feet or so. After setting you down she crouches near you and bows her head again, nervous with so many other people around. You look away from her and see that most of the others don't seem to mind the giantess surprisingly, but with so many dangerous, strange, and bizarre things that are involved with the show I guess they are used to it by now. Throughout the evening the giantess doesn't eat, doesn't speak just sort of sits there and stares. Occasionaly she looks over to you and smiles briefly, and sometimes she would nervously look around at others, or back to the mountains were she was being held. After a while you walk over to the ladder and you start to climb down. She doesn't notice you for at the moment she is looking over at a group of workers trying to force some cattle into a pen. When you reach the ground you walk over and set your hand on her leg. She jumps a little, obviously startled, and looks down and sees you there, stifling a smile. She reaches down to pick you up when all of a sudden the crack of a whip echoes through the small valley and her hand freezes. You both look over and see the laborers using a whip to try and control a steer that is giving them a hard time. The whip cracks again and you see her wince, still traumatized from her imprisonment. You look up "Are you alright" you manage to choke out. She looks away and gives a subtle nod but you can tell she isn't. You walk with her back to her stall where she goes and sits in the corner. You are now quite curious about her and you finally build up the courage to ask "How long?", you say almost inaudibly. She looks up and gives you a questioning glance and you repeat, "How long?'', this time ouder. She still looks confused and you repeat once more "How long.....did they have you locked up?" you finally said and kind of grimaced when you were done. She lay her head in her arms and spoke no more. You go up and lean on her ankle and she looks up once more and she looks at you with a glance that says, 'please don't ask me about that'. You decide to leave her then and perhaps come back tommarrow.

The next day...
11131211112121.title: Step on!

111312111121212.content: That day, you did your morning chores and went to her stall, feeling silly you were afraid of her. She was asleep still. She just stayed still, her stomach moving up and down slightly. She tried to roll, but her shackle stopped her and she woke up. Her eyes slowly opened and she smiled s bit when she saw you. She pointed to her shackle, which was now just one on her ankle, and you unlocked it. She rubbed her ankle and slowly stood to a stooping position which is all that was allowed in the space. She squeezed herself out of the tent and stood all the way up outside. You decided to show her everything. You pointed to the cooking tent where the food gets made and then continued to show her the place. You point to the other big tent and tell her it's the show tent. She gives you a confused look and you explain how it's a circus. She is a bit sad that she's a show, but doesn't seem mad. Then the huts that the staff live in. You show her your hut, and she looks inside. It has a coy a dresser and a small cabinet for your things. She opens the window with her mfinger and points to the cabinet. You open it up and show her a pendant and a clean sheet. She points to the pendant and you explain how your parents were adventurous. They gave you this pendant and disappeared. You were just 7 and Beldrict took you in and you started work here. You put it back and Beldrict says "You two! Come over here! We're talking about her part in the shows!" You come in and you hear ideas similar to most. A destructive monster. Then.......
111312111121212.title: She does some stuff with you (this includes jus...

1113121111212121.content: She says, "Sorry, Beldrict, but I don't want to be in your show as a destructive monster, since I am a very gentle giantess and I was mistreated back in the mountains. So if you don't mind, can you please come up with a better script for me?" After having been spoken to, Beldrict sees that she indeed does have a gentle heart, therefore he changes his mind about having her in the show as a destructive monster, instead, Beldrict turns to you and asks what you want her to do in his show. What does he say?....
1113121111212121.title: She speaks up against it!

1113121111212122.content: When you looked back to her you saw her looking down and her long hair covered her face. She was obviously upset by all this. After a little while, no one could come to a descision, since many thought it would be dangerous if she did anything other than sit there. She eventually got fed up with it all and stood up and walked back to her stall. This caught everyone off gaurd, and her hurried steps made the ground shake a little. You look over at Beldrict and he had a concerned look on his face and his gaze quickly came to meet yours, and he hurried over to you. He came up and looked back to the giantess walking away, "Well, this should have been expected, look we need to work with alot more before we can put on, but unfortunately word spreads fast and some have already heard about her so if they come and we don't have her out yet, well...."he stopped, stroking his silvery beard. He looked at you and you knew exactly what he meant; you needed to get her ready and fast. You knew it would be long and hard, first you had to get her to talk, at least to you. Then get her comfortable with her new home and the others, then get used to the idea of being a show; then get rid of her fear of crowds and maybe then you can use her but until then, well. You quickly run back to her stall and find her there in the same corner as always, and she has her face buried in her hands. You know from working with many animals and other beasts that its when they are upset and emotional that they are most dangerous. You approach her, and you lack confidence that you can calm her down. "Hey..." you sort of whisper and she looks up for a second. You can't tell for sure, but she seems to have an angry expression mostly hidden by her dark hair that covers her face. This creeps you out and when she lifts her hand up and sets it down by her side, you sort of jump and take a few steps back. She sees this and moves a little closer. You edge away and start to feel a little panicked. She notices this and stops moving. She lifts her head some more and you see that instead of a look of anger, she seems worried, concerned, or maybe regret. She moves her hand out towards you and then to your surprise says in a quiet calm voice "Don't fear me". You were startled and inched forward a little "What?" you sort of grunted. She says again slightly louder this time "Don't fear me", and now you can distinguish a slight accent. She leans a little closer her blue eyes fixed on you and says "Please". You came forward and just nodded. It was a start.
1113121111212122.title: She does not.

11131211112121221.content: You hear the hobbled steps of Zenn and he rushes in. "(your name)! Come quick!" he says, an expression of fear and worry on his face. You run over to him, saying "What is it?" he points outside. Something hit the lock to the minotaur cage, and all three of them are outside in a rage. You hear someone shout out in pain and run out to the field in front of the tent. There the entire staff is battling the minotaurs. Beledrict and the hired guards are faring well. The others aren't. Beledrict smashes one over the head with the hilt of his sword and it falls, but another smashes him with it's palm. Beldrict lays still. Suddenly, as it goes to finish him off, a hand wraps around him. The giantess lifts him to safety and holds the minotaurs down with one hand. After the action...
11131211112121221.title: Zenn comes in

choices: She takes you back to her stall
She sets you down and stays were she is
111312111121212211.content: After the minotaurs are rounded up and put back in their cage, you walk over to Beldrict and see him rubbing a rather large bruise on his head. "Beldrict, are you ok, I mean, did you...." you begin but Beldrict interrupts with a laugh "Hehe, no i'm just fine, don't you worry, I may be old but it takes alot more than a hit on the head to take me out of comission" he says. You look at him questioningly but turn away to see some of the others nursing various types of wounds. "Injured or not, if she hadn't come along we might of had some deaths" Beldrict followed up. "Wait where did she go off to?" you asked but Beldrict shruggs. You wander off and search for her but she can't be found. Then you go down to the spring and see her sitting by the pond's edge looking at her reflection. You run up to her side, and stare up at her, she doesn't say anything or even look away. "Hey down here!" you yell up at her. At first she doesn't seem to notice but after a little while she turns her head and looks down at you giving you a weak smile. "Hey what are you doing here" you start, and you look up at her expectingly. She doesn't respond, she just sort of stares down at you. "Oh come on now, we are not going back to this whole silence thing, come on talk to me" you say in a frustrated tone. Then without warning she reaches down and scoops you up into her hand, bringing you up till you are about level with her shoulders, and you look up at her quizzilcaly. "I'm, not.....much of a talker" she says although she struggled with her word choice. "Yes, I know" you respond calmly. She nods her head a little and opens her mouth again as if to say something, but shuts it again when she sees some of the others coming over.
111312111121212211.title: Everyone is ok

1113121111212122112.content: Zenn is walking in step Beldrict, who are walking towards the two of you. She sets you on the ground and looks to them. Zenn immediately tells her how much he appreciates everything she did, and Beldrict just says "Thanks." She doesn't say anything, but looks happy. Zenn looks at the pond and then turns to Beldrict. They talk quietly to eachother and then Beldrict nods. "Do you like to swim?" Zenn asks. She looks at him and then nods after a bit. "Well, for what you did we will make the pond into a lake for you to swim in." She seems happy at her reward and then she scoops Zenn up and gives him what must be as close to a hug as she can get. Zenn looks like he needs a little rest to stop his head from spinning. After a small rest he says, "Uh, your welcome." The day wrapped up normally, and as you walk down to the pond, you see Beldrict down there. He takes out some paper and makes a sketch with some notes. He sees that there is one spot where the pressure must be and starts doing calculations. You hear him say "Of course!" he jots down some notes and he looks up and sees you. "How long till she talks?" he says, looking at you with that old twinkle in his eye. "She talked to me." you say knowing that it isn't great but a start. "Not a fan of the beard is she?" he jokes and you two walk away to sleep. The next day......
1113121111212122112.title: She sets you down and stays were she is

choices: nope nothing really (just skip to the next day)
11131211112121221121.content:
The next day despite all the work that you have to do, you decide to stop by and make sure that the giantess is ok. You were thrilled last night how you got her to speak, and you were telling Beldrict all about it. She didn't say much, and you still don't know her name, but again it was a start. You run down the walkway between the stalls nearly tripping over an impish little hobgoblin who usually keeps maintance on most of the draft animals. "Ay! Wuch it" he screams after you and turn around an apologize as you continue moving. When you finally make it to her stall, you slowly step in as if not to be noticed and see her sitting in her usualy corner looking up and the low (well low to her) ceiling. You come up to her questioning her as to what she is looking at. She looks down and gives you a sweet smile, and brushes some of her dark hair away from her face. She doesn't respond but instead just picks you up and brings you up till you're about level with her shoulders. "So, uh how are you today?" you ask awkwardly trying not to look her in the eyes. She laughed a little and said in a quiet, calming voice "Fine" she cooed, "Just fine". Unsure of what to say next, you just sort of sat there looking up at her, when finally she sort of dropped her eyes and then looked around the room and said again rather quietly "Its so cold in here..." she looked back to you "at night." You looked at her questioningly and then she pointed to the roof where she had been looking earlier and there you see a large slit opened up to the outside. It looked to be about 10 feet long. You look back down and lock eyes on her. "I'll see what I can do about that" you say. She smiles and sets you down, and before you leave you tell her about the progress being made on the pond and eventually turn away and leave.

Does anything interesting happen later in the day?
11131211112121221121.title: You talk to her.

111312111121212211211.content: You talk to her for a little bit and then go outside. You see Zenn talking to someone. The man wears a hood and hides his face. As you walk to Zenn the stranger walks away, clearly to avoid you. You reach Zenn and ask, "Who was that?" He responds "Nobody." clearly hiding something. "Zenn, who was that?" you ask again, more forcefully than before. "I said nobody!" he yells in your face and then starts to hobble away. You try to follow him but he notices you. "Go away, (your name). Now." Clearly Zenn was not himself. Actually, this is the most mad he has ever been. He goes into his shed and slams the door. You catch a glimpse of him as you go to your own and his face is buried in his hands. You decide to go to see the giantess again, so you can learn her name mostly. You hear a twig snap next to you and turn wildly. You see a deer that wandered into the grounds. You walk again, but are stopped by Beldrict. "Hey there. How is she?" He asks, holding his blueprints for the pond. "She's good" you say, "But I'm worried about Zenn" Beldrict is surprised but nods. "I'll talk to him." Beldrict walks away and you.........
111312111121212211211.title: Stranger

choices: You see the hooded figure again that day
1113121111212122112111.content: Despite the fact that you have great deal of work to do, you decide to head back and see the giantess, mostly just because you don't want her feeling lonely, and because you are very curious about what her name is. You carefully walk down the hallway again, now the hobgoblin is gone and everything seems eeriely quiet. You can't help but feel a little paranoid and you keep looking over you shoulder or caustiously check around corners. Maybe Zenn is just getting to you but it doesn't really matter anyways. You come back into the stall and the giantess looks up at you rather surprised that you're back already. You walk over to her and she looks at you with concern; you notice and realize that how worried you must have seemed. "Oh don't worry about its nothing" you say trying to shake the feeling away. She gives you a look which strikes you as a if she was getting fed up with people not telling her things. "So, I thought I would come back and just see..." but you stopped what you were saying when she reached down and scooped you up. "So, we've known each other for about a week or so now" you start rather awkwardly, you couldn't help it but she still made you rather nervous. "I was just wondering what your name was..." for a second she looked down and furrowed her brow, as if she couldn't remember. She though about her for awhile and you weren't sure if she was debating whether to tell you or not, or if she couldn't remember herself. "Well, its been a very long time since anyone used my name," she said he voice as cool and relaxed as usual. "Morgwyn" she said then lowered her head and shut her eyes, as if the name brought back painful memories. "Alright then" you say in a slow hushed tone, "Morgwyn".
1113121111212122112111.title: Go ask the giantess' name

choices: The hooded figure knocks you out.
11131211112121221121111.content:
After the night, you went back to your shed. You left a note about the tear in the tent and climb into the bed. You instantly sleep with no dreams. Suddenly a sound wakes you. You see Zenn talking with the hooded figure. You catch what the man is saying.

"There is going to be an accident at her first show." comes his deep ominous voice. "No. I won't do it." Zenn says in a voice clearly pained. "Tsk Tsk Tsk. Now I need to use something I didn't want to." Zenn stays silent. "We have your parents. If it doesn't happen, they die. Understand?" You look out the window and see Zenn shaking with rage. His hand is balled into a fist over his cane, digging half-moons in it from his fingernails. Suddenly, Zenn takes a swing at him with his cane, breaking it over his head. The man is unaffected. He never even moved. "That'll be 20 lashes each." the figure says before walking away. Zenn just hops to his shed and shuts the door. Suddenly the door opens and.......
11131211112121221121111.title: Zenn's Trouble

111312111121212211211112.content:
You feel your heart skip a beat when the door swings open. You jump to your bed, and reach for the large stick which happens to be leaning againt the wall. You slowly stand back up and approach the door. Your heart racing, you peer out the door but see no one. As you stand in the doorway you are hit with massive gust of wind. "Just the coming storm," you say reassuringly to yourself. You close the door tight and go back and sit down on your bed. You mind is racing and feel nothing but fear, for yourself, for Zenn, and it is just to much to bear on your own. You want to talk to Beldrict but you aren't sure were he is. You begin to pace, and decide to go to Morgwyn and talk to her about this. You take up the stick again and cautiously open the door, poking your head out first to be sure no one was around. It was starting to get dark and the looming storm clouds gave an eerie feel. No was about, so you threw open the door and ran as fast as you could to her stall. She was there curled up in her corner trying to keep warm. She seems quite surprised to see you but is welcoming none the less. She reaches over to you, and without loosing your momentum you continue running and practical crash into her hand. She seems confused by your sense of panic and quickly brings you closer. "What is it" she says quietly as you try to catch your breathe. You finally calm down and give a slurred, and hurried version of your story, and she looks down, obviously deep in thought. She then looks back up at you and shakes her head. You know that she isn't sure what to do, but you don't feel comfortable back outside not that it is completely dark out. You stay with her for the night. Staying in the opposite corner, you manage to get comfortable lying out on some straw and a small blanket which Morgwyn gave to you, but you manage to get no sleep throughout the night.

The Next day
111312111121212211211112.title: It was just the wind.

1113121111212122112111122.content:
The next day Zenn comes in to check on the giantess and sees you. He gives you a quizzical look but stays silent. He finishes his chores and leaves before the sun rises. He leaves and goes to his room. A few hours later, you are up and about and Beldrict hands you a ladder.

"Better fix that hole, huh?" he leaves to go get the minotaurs food and you start to climb. Suddenly the ladder begins to tilt. Slowly it begins to fall. A hand stops the fall and lifts you up to the tear. After 5 minutes, It's fixed, and you signal for Morgwyn to set you down. You leave to help Meg on the meal. You see Zenn digging by the pond and remember the swimming hole idea. Zenn seems back to normal but you know it is an act. He now is just on a brace instead of a cane.

Suddenly a loud noise is heard from the tent where Morgwyn and the animals are kept. You see Morgwyn leaving the tent quickly and converge on her. She is.....
1113121111212122112111122.title: Things go fine

11131211112121221121111221.content: Morgwyn runs out laughing. A Minotaur had come into her room after wandering out and had done it's business on her. She was going down to the pump to wash off the spot. She finishes and walks back to the tent still giggling a bit. You wonder whether or not to tell her about Zenn. You decide not to for now, but walk down to go see Zenn and help him dig. You grab a shovel and stick it into the ground. Zenn has already made impressive progress, it is already about the size of a foot wash for the giant girl. You look over at him and....
11131211112121221121111221.title: Laughter

choices: Fall asleep with you in her hand
111312111121212211211112212.content: Unsure of what you should do about all this, you continue to keep quiet. Occasionally you glance over at him but notice nothing out of the ordinary. Eventually he catches you staring and lifts his head, "What is it?" he asks almost threateningly..."Nothing," you reply almost monotone. Work goes on like this for several hours before you grow tired and decide to go see Morgwyn in her stall. On you way over it starts to rain, slowly at first but when you reach the tent a jagged bolt of lightning rips across the sky, illuminating everything with an eerie glow. You begin to grow nervous and again and rush inside to find the giantess. She is sitting there near motionless, staring at a large tub of water on the opposite side of her stall. When you enter she turns her head and a weak smile appears on her face, but it is quickly replaced with a look of worry. She reaches over and picks you up, bringing you close to her body. She then....
111312111121212211211112212.title: Prolong the silence

choices: Beledrict is there, unhappy all your chores were not complete.
1113121111212122112111122122.content: She grabs you and cuddles you up near her face. For a girl so big she's surprisingly gentle. She holds you there as she lays down. You aren't sure but you think she might be a bit scared of the thunder outside. You look at her scars and then think to yourself, she's been through so much. Being just about her only friend, she trusts you more than anyone. If she needs some comfort, you're there to give it to her. But this thing with Zenn, it's throwing off the whole balance of the place, between Morgwyn needing comfort from you and the possibility that Zenn will do something to her, you don't know what to do. Should you confront him? What if he goes after you? But if you leave him be, what will happen to Morgwyn. What will happen to you? Chances are, you'll be the one right next to her. You realise that Morgwyn has fallen asleep and being only a foot taller than her thumb, you realize you could be there awhile. You get into the most comfortable position you can and start to sleep. Her slow rhythmic breathing puts you to sleep. When you wake up you see.....
1113121111212122112111122122.title: Fall asleep with you in her hand

11131211112121221121111221221.content: When you awaken you sit up wiping the sleep away from your eyes. As you start to become more aware of your surroundings you see that the stall is empty, and that the stall is completely empty. You look up and around to see if at least Morgwyn was there to, but she was missing as well. You can't help but feel a little panicked, thinking something had happened. You quickly stand up take another moment to collect yourself and you look about the stall a little more. Nothing out of the ordinary, but, still worried, you run out to go find Beldrict, and ask him if he knows where she went. However as you reach the edge of the door you see out in the distance...
11131211112121221121111221221.title: The stall is empty

111312111121212211211112212211.content:
You pray that what you see is Morgwyn. Assuming she is the only giantess in the area, you go to see her. When you get there she smiles at you. She looks away and at the sunrise. You watch it too, and you share a moment of silence. A lot like most of the moments you two have spent. You watch her and smile a bit at how she seemed fascinated by something so usual for you.

"I couldn't see the sun from the cave." Her voice is quiet, but you can still hear her. You feel pity and your heart goes out to this girl. You give her ankle an awkward hug as she starts silently crying. You tell her the best and most soothing things that you can think of, and after a few minutes, she composes herself. Then you go do........
111312111121212211211112212211.title: Morgwyn

choices: You start to feel sick and black out
1113121111212122112111122122111.content:
You figure that since you had been slacking off so much lately it would probably be a good idea to try and get a few things done. So, you go about the rest of the day working as hard as you can, to make up for all the time you've wasted visiting your giantess friend. Every once and a while you check on Morgwyn just be sure she's ok, and you begin to notice that Zenn is starting to notice.

Later when helping a dark haired elf feed the perytons, you notice Zenn talking with Morgwyn. "That's a little suspicious", you say out loud, thus getting a questioning glance from the elf. "What do you mean?" he asks, you brush him off and start walking over towards them. You don't notice anything inheritly wrong, but you still find it troubling. As you approach Beldrict intercepts you and begins to ask you questions. "Anyway, if the smith is out of nails would you mind running down to the-.....What's wrong?" he asks obviously sensing the urgency in your current demeanor. "Nothing, its nothing really," you lie, but you can tell Beldrict isn't going to give up on you. "Don't give me that now, I've known you since...well I don't know but it's been a long time now tell me what's wrong!" You start to explain everything and when you finish you see Beldrict is clearly troubled by everything, he tells you to meet him later that night and then leaves in a hurry.

By the time you get over to Morgwyn, Zenn is gone and you find her sitting at the foot of the mountain looking up at the clouds. "Hey," you chirp, trying to sound as chipper as possible. She turns her head longs down at you and smiles. "So what were you and Zenn talking about?" you blurt, blatantly sounding direct and altogether nosy. She gives you a puzzled look as if confused by your sudden question. She reaches down and picks you up, placing you carefully in her palm level with her chin. You look over the edge of her hand, suddenly getting a sense of vertigo. You realize you've never been this high since.....well forever.

What next?
1113121111212122112111122122111.title: Your chores.

11131211112121221121111221221111.content: The darkness suddenly closes in on your vision. Your stomach feels as if it's in a vice. You feel yourself fall forward, off of her hand. You look at where you're heading, which happens to be her chest. You are unconscious before you feel the impact. You wake up to Morgwyn's huge face looming over you. You don't even feel surprised as you look up at her. A huge teardrop splashes next to you. You sit up and notice.....
11131211112121221121111221221111.title: Going down?

111312111121212211211112212211111.content:
You look down at your forearm and see that it is bent at a strange angle. "That's not good" you say casually, looking back up at Morgwyn who had at this point covered her face with her hands. Then the pain hit you, it started subtle but then shot up your whole ride side causing you to cringe and let out a small cry. At this Morgwyn sobbed, it was obvious she felt that it was her fault that you were hurt. At first you tried to console, but unsure of what exactly to say you half mumble half shout, trying to let her know that she hadn't hurt you and that it was an accident.

Naturally with all the commotion, many others came over. At first they thought that Morgwyn had done something horrible to you, and many looked either frightened over her or angry. You jump down and tell them what happened, and many thus satisfied with your explanation and head back to work while some help you to the medical tent, leaving Morgwyn alone and upset.

After you patched up you eagerly get up to go see if your giantess friend was alright. As you near the door the physician stopped you, demanding that you rest, but you push past him. As you go back to try and find Morgwyn you see that she had left...

Sooooooooooooo
111312111121212211211112212211111.title: Your arm is broken

choices: You don't find her, but someone camping in the forest does
1113121111212122112111122122111112.content: You recover with the help of Meg. With a sling over your arm you walk to Morgwyn's stall to clear things up. She isn't there. You ask Beldrict if he has seen her. He hasn't. You search around the grounds of the circus, but no huge girl has shown up. Then a thought comes to your mind. Zenn. Was she just running away, or did Zenn do something to her? It isn't until you see a huge footprint in the mud heading to the forest that you let out a sigh of relief. She's only running away. While it isn't good it's better than what it could have been. You run back and assemble a search team and you head out into the forest. There is surprisingly little trail to follow as she steps lightly and is very careful. In the end......
1113121111212122112111122122111112.title: How Can She Hide at That Size?

11131211112121221121111221221111122.content:
As you head off northward through the dense undergrowth you can't help but shake the uneasy feeling choking at you like the paws of a drekavac. The trees around seemed as they were some kind of demonic arms reaching out, and mocking you with your own discontent. You spent the next few hours searching through the thicket, shuffling your way through vines, bushes, and other manners of tangled plants. Yet as the day slowly wasted away your heart began to sink, seeing the sun start to slowly dive behind the distant mountains. Many of your comrades begin to complain, and whine, saying that her leaving was probably for the best, and that it "wasn't really their problem anyway". You almost couldn't take it...

The darkness continued to close in, and the unfaltering chant of the whip-or-will in the distant seemed to paint an eerie picture around the light of the flickering camp fire. The two shadowy figures sat motionless, as in completely entrance by the dancing flames, like tongues of a thousand snakes. After another prolonged silence the unto the other said in whisper, "Did you hear that?" asking almost apathetically. The other turned his head slightly and waited another minute or two before he responded. "I think so..." his voice trailing off with the symphony of crickets in the brush. They both recognized the sound, it was like someone was crying...far away. Neither of them wanted to say anything more though. Eventually one of them stood up and looked around, his body faintly illluminated by the fire light. "Where are you going?" asked the other as he headed off into surrounding woods, "To find her, a storms coming, probably best if she isn't alone when it hits, its dangerous out here." he responded.

The forest was disorienting but the man knew the general direction in which he was going. However, as the sun finally disappeared behind the mountain's crest the woods became flooded with an abnormal darkness which created a nightmarish feel. It didn't take long for him to start and panic, without even the moon to guide him, and the distant roll of thunder and the call of unknown animals his mind became engrossed and his own horror story. He started to run, then sprint trying in vain to follow the voice. As it grew ever louder he knew he was getting closer, but suddenly he tripped and he collapsed on the shadowy forest floor. He began to crawl, desperate, completely commited to not stop moving, as if he stopped the imaginary monsters around him would draw his breathe from his body and leave for the crows. He just kept going throught the vines, and thorns, desperate...desperate. Then he found her, but not in the way he expected...
11131211112121221121111221221111122.title: You don't find her, but someone camping in ...

111312111121212211211112212211111221.content: He held back a scream and swallowed loudly. This girl was taller than him nearly 10 times over! She sat there among the trees crying deeply, but softly. The wind started to wail and covered even her sobs. A log flew towards the man who barely ducked it. He ran to the best cover he had; This huge girl. Fear gripped him as he his under the girls leg, both from her and the storm. She stayed still, only sobbing deeply. The man hid there, until the girl shifted to a side more comfortable to the wind. Her sobs were gone but she still looked terribly sad. The man ran as the wind whipped at him, causing him to only barely make it to his cover. As he runs and......
111312111121212211211112212211111221.title: The Storm Approaches

She was so young back then, with hair as black as the darnkess that now surrouned him. With green eyes like lilipads and when she laughed all of nature laughed with her. He closed his eyes and began to weep, but not about himself about his companion, his soulmate, his forgotten love. One morning a chilling breeze took her life away, carried off like a lone leaf in an autumn gale. His heart shattered and he just wandered on with his friends and companions across the wildnerness, to forget about it all.
