11211.title: 50ft - 100ft

112111.content:
The world had forever changed. All around the world giant women had appeared and began wreaking havoc on nearby communities. It was a very strange phenomenon, one that had yet to be explained, all that the world knew was that these women, all came from sociable backgrounds. These giantesses were very different from their formal selves; they became self-absorbed, vain, violent, aggressive, cruel, and a host of other bizarre behavioral deviations. Most had devastated their native areas but they had been dispatched by the military forces of the world. However some of the larger ones were easily capable of defending themselves. Much of the world's military had been exhausted combating them, and a few of the more powerful ones remained.

Meanwhile in a small city in northern Virginia, the remaining inhabitants milled about the remains of their town. Most had fled west to escape the onslaught, and now only half remained. Most of the largest buildings had been reduced to rubble and the modern amenities that had once been a keystone of modern life were now gone. Electricity, and running water were gone; food was scarce and people were forced to live in a state of poverty. A young man, crossed an empty street , lugging a heavy jug of water behind him. He took a moment to rest, wiping the sweat from his brow. The heat of the dimming June evening was greater than he had expected. 'Can't stop now, gotta get back before dark' he thought to himself. As he continued on his mind began to wander again, 'I wonder when she'll be back...if she comes back'. The sun began to slip behind the crests of two nearby mountains, finally providing some much needed shade. 'I hope she's gone for good this time...' he thought again. However his train of thought was quickly interrupted when he felt something. At first he ignored it but a second later he felt it again. He set down the water jug again...he looked down and saw a ripple reverberate through it. He seemed to grow in intensity, he hadn't felt this since...since it all began. He look up towards the horizon and saw....
112111.title: Conquest

1121111.content: "I'm baaaaack" a thunderous voice roared out across the valley. The young man looked up, his eyes welling with fear as he peered up at the towering figure in the distance. A distinctly female frame could be seen on the horizon, her hands on her hips and her golden blonde hair hanging about her shoulders. She wore the same clothes he had last seen her in. Slim fit jeans and a white tank-top, funny how he remembered that...from all that had happened. She blocked the sun, and the shadow that drew itself across her front made it hard enough to discern her face. However once she moved he could see it again, the same sadistic smile she wore before. Her almost silver eyes flicking back and forth across the cityscape, a smug smile creeping across her lips. She stepped along casually, briskly strolling through the streets, stepping over buildings and bridges, leaving a wake of crater like footprints as she went. The ground shook and people scattered, trying to find some place to hide from the returning menace. "I'm surprised how many of you stayed" she chirped, her head swiveling about as she looked down at the small crowds of people scattering about as she walked along. She came to the center of town where the old bank building stood, there was only a pile of rubble there now. She sat down, sending up a cloud of dust and debris. She stretched her legs out, demolishing a pair of nearby buildings before they come to rest in a fractured parking lot. She sighed and leaned back, "its good to be home..."
1121111.title: The giantess returning

11211112.content: She she made her way into the shell of the city, the refugees and survivors who had previously bore the burden of her tyrannical wrath began to flee to their shelters. The streets, though still mostly deserted, began to be criss-crossed by the emaciated civilians who knew all too well what would happen should they be unfortunate enough to be caught in her path. She placed each of colossal feet one in front of the other as she stepped almost nimbly through the streets between the crumbling buildings. This had been her domain for some time now, and she was happy to see that it was just as she left it. When she finally came to rest at the remains of the old bank building, the young man ducked behind a nearby dumpster. She was close, so close that he could she the dust stirred up from her breath. "Now now little ones, there must be someone out there left to entertain me...or do I have to go looking again" she said in a sharp tone. He knew he wouldn't last long if she caught him. He quickly searched around him for a possible place to hide, but all the buildings in front of him were barricaded or covered in rubble. The only option was to sneak past her and head back home. It was risky but he did not want to sit and wait for her to discover him. He had seen what she'd done to her other "friends" and grew anxious just thinking about the torment he'd endure. He crept around the block and saw that the massive woman had her back to him. He began running from cover to cover as he made his way around her. Meanwhile she had rolled over and rested on her side, picking through the buildings looking for humans. "Ahh there you are" she cooed as her hand slipped through a massive hole in the side of one skyscraper. She withdrew a trembling figure whom she then deposited on her thigh before continuing her search. He sighed with relief, she was distracted. He decided to make a break for it across the deserted urban corridor but as he began to sprint across the cracked pavement he saw her hulking form shift. Startled by her movement and the tremor she created he crashed into a nearby trashcan which sent him sprawling to the ground. His head and hands ached as he caught himself on the gravel below and as soon as he realized what had happened he shut his eyes. He knew she would discover him now, it was only a matter of time. The giantess spun her head around to address the disturbance and saw the tiny figure laying deathly still on the ground. A devilish smile crept across her face as she reached over and plunked his body off the street and brought it closer to her face. "Now now who's this..."
11211112.title: She finds him

112111121.content: Her steely gaze caused the young man to feel a crippling paralyzation that could only come from pure terror. Though her expression was soft, almost peaceful he couldn't help but feel that his life and spirit were being drained by that pair of cobalt blue eyes. The air seemed to grow still, and a silence descended on him like a shroud. Then her lips pursed and her voice slithered out like a viper. "Trying to get to safety?" she asked. He didn't know what to do, he simply lay in her palm choking back tears. She raised her eyebrows inquisitively, "Not in a talking mood?" she boomed. "I can understand that, but you'll have to speak up eventually, otherwise I'll lose interest..." she paused for a moment, letting the fear well up in him. "...and dispose of you." She cackled softly to herself. Without looking down she scooped up her other captive and adjusted her sitting position. She held a cowering human in each hand and her attention shifted back and forth between the two, obviously trying to unnerve them. Suddenly the other captive spoke up, "You--you can't keep doing this! We'll stop you, you--you huge bitch!" he screamed. Her eyes shot to him and narrowed with anger. "Rude" she said. She closed her hand around him slowly. His muffled screams began to emanate out, the young man stifled in a scream and shook violently. The giantess sighed and turned back to young man, "you little guys never learn..." she said matter of factly. She tossed the other man over her right shoulder carelessly, his screams sounding in the distance as he crashed into a building three blocks away. "Now, its just you and me" she cooed. The young man felt like he was going to vomit...
112111121.title: She speaks to him

choices: She decides to keep you to make sure you don't kill yourself.
She uses this to play games with you.
1121111212.content:
He had no idea how to get out of this mess. He simply looked up at the giant captress before him and realized his fate. If he was going to die, he might as well get it over with, before she could have her way with him.

He walked over to the edge of her palm. The surface was oddly curvy and hilly making it a little bit of a struggle. Once he got there, he looked down.

"What are you doing?" she asked sounding genuinely confused.

Without a moments pause, he jumped. This would be the end.

"Okay," she shouted startled and sightly taken aback as she reached her other hand underneath to catch him. "What was that?!"

He didn't respond as he rolled through her palms. He expected his landing surface to be harder. He positioned himself close to the beginning of her fingers. Seeing a huge crevice between her index and middle finger, he decided to make a second jump attempt,

"Are you trying to kill yourself?! This is definitely a first."
1121111212.title: Let's get this over with.

11211112121.content:
"No, no...I don't think so little guy" she stated. With each attempt he simply crashed back down onto her palm. He was going nowhere. His sides were bruised from each impact and his joints creaked under the duress. The young man stood back up and brushed himself off. He figured if he could just get enough momentum he could jump out past her hands and finally end it all. Meanwhile the giantess eyed him curiously. She had never encountered someone so eager to escape her that they would surrender their own life. This only made her want to play with him more. However, there were more pressing matters to attend to at the moment. Her cool eyes locked down on the minuscule figure as he bent down, readying himself to sprint off her hand once again. Just as he started off she brought her other hand down in front of him. He collided with her colossal fingers and slumped down onto his side.
"Come now, I can't have you killing yourself. Am I really that bad?" she asked with a laugh. The young man lay down in defeat, curling up into a ball to await the tortures he knew were coming. The giantess shook her head slowly. "Tsk tsk, now you know I can't have this either!" She nudged him gently with her finger. "Come on get up, I'm not done talking to you yet, I want you to look at me..." The young man didn't budge however. She frowned. The sadistic glee on her face melted away to disappointment. "Booooring, but you seem to be full of surprises so you don't need to be so scared...I think I'll keep you around. Can't have you trying to off yourself while your with me though." She hummed innocently. "Lets see if I can't find a place where you won't get into too much trouble...Ahh here." With her opposite hand she plucked the little man out of her hand while with the other she lifted the strap of bra on her left breast. She deposited the young man against her chest, gentle lower the strap over him to ensure he could not escape. She gave him a soft pat on the back and whispered down to him, "there, don't go getting into any more trouble now, we're gonna have a nice little chat later..." The young man sighed with relief, realizing that his life was not about to end.
11211112121.title: She decides to keep you to make sure you don...

choices: Your captress begins to doubt you.
112111121212.content:
He tried to break free, but he was trapped. He listened as she went about her business: terrorizing the city, occasionally confronting the military, playing games with random victims, and eventually killing them in more ways than he could imagine. Finally it seemed like she had enough, and she went home. He found himself being carried in her breast to the world of the giants. He knew very little about it, because very few people who went there ever came back.

She walked into her apartment and went straight to her room. For her perspective, she had a long day of terrorizing the land of tiny people. It has been a good use of the Saturday, allowing her to destress from work, but now it was late and she was exhausted.

"Hi there," her roommate called to her. "How did it go?"

"Great!" she responded. "You should try it sometime."

With that she walked over to her dresser. The moment she stopped walking, the young man took this as an opportunity to try to break free. His squirms got him no where, but reminded the woman of her little prisoner. She delicately took him out.

"I see you brought one home," the roommate observed. "A midnight snack?"

"No, when I captured him, he kept trying to kill himself. I don't have the guts to help in indulge in such a suicide, so I figured I'd keep him safe. He'll make a great pet."

Her roommate simply scoffed disbelievingly. "He must be clever to play you like that. Well to each their own."

As her roommate speaks, the woman stares at you as she dangles you with her fingers.
112111121212.title: Second Escape Attempt

1121111212122.content:
"Whatever," your captress responded slightly annoyed. "I'm too tired to argue about this with you. I'm going to go to bed."

With that she got out a large shoe box and placed you in. The walls were high, three times your size. You instinctively run the course of the box looking for an exit.

"Well I guess I won't need a lid then," she says as she watches your predicament.

She then walks out and goes to the bathroom. You hear the roommate across the room as she moves around, but she seems indifferent to you. Soon your captress comes back, and they both go to bed.

You sit there as each falls asleep. The cardboard is too uncomfortable to lie on, which prevents you from sleeping effectively. Eventually you are struck by an idea. Below you are the folds of the box glued together to keep it there. You manage to pry one of them up enough to slip underneath. With a little bit of scuffling under the box, you are free!

Now you realize that you are on the ledge of her dresser. It has knobs that may help transition your descent. You jump to the first one. You slip on your landing, though, and fall off. You manage to catch yourself on the knob directly below it, but not without making a loud screeching noise.

There's a ruffling noise from one of you the beds. You stop dead in your tracks. You hear movement come straight towards you.

"What the..." you hear a harsh whisper from above, and a hand reaches for you. It's...
1121111212122.title: Down and Out

choices: She sticks you in a drawer
She finds a place near her on the bed
11211112121221.content:
Her fingers snake around you, wrenching your free from the knob. Although the dark shrouds everything around you, the voice echoing down through the shadows is familiar. The sadistic giantess who brought you here lifts you up to her face, which is now barely visible in tiny bit of light still left in the room.

"How the hell did you get out?" she hissed beneath softly. Her grip tightens and you feel your body lurch as she brings you even closer. For a moment you feel like your rib cage is about to snap, but after a few seconds you feel yourself fall down a good ten feet. At first you scream in terror but as soon as you collapse onto her palm your nerves calm a bit.

"Are you really so fucked in the head that you'd break out just to kill yourself?" she continues. Her hot breath washes over you like a tidal wave. Though she can't see you very clearly, she feels your slight tremble as you cower in fear. A wicked smile drifts across her face.

"Or were you trying to escape?"

Again you say nothing. You see her white teeth flash for a moment as she speaks. Overhead two of her massive fingers begin to descend on you like the claws of a crane. You try to breath but you're so choked with fear that you can only manage a few desperate gasps.

"Well, its late, and I don't have time or energy to deal with your little tricks right now. So why don't we just go back to bed and deal with this in the morning hmm?" she coos. You shift uncomfortably as her fingers pluck you off her hand.

"Now, I can't have you staying in that old box, seem's defective, so where can I put you that you won't escape...." she turns about her room for a second. With each step your head rattles a little bit more. You're not sure how much more of this you can take.

"Ahh how about..."
11211112121221.title: your captress.

choices: She asks you a bunch of questions to determine whether your suicidal story makes
Her roommate arrives to try to hash it out.
She takes you to a psychological expert to figure out what’s wrong with you.
112111121212211.content:
She opens the top drawer in her wardrobe and takes out a sock. She drops you in and ties the opening before you can react.

“There,” she explains, dropping the sock and you onto a wooden surface you assume to be the drawer. “Everything there is soft and fuzzy. No way to harm yourself or to escape. We’ll have to have a chat in the morning.”

The earthquakes as she shuts the door, and you are in complete darkness. After a minute or so, the rumbling fades as she goes back to sleep. You try to wiggle out but can’t. Nor can you even find the walls of the drawer amidst the many socks. Eventually you give up and fall asleep. At least the cotton is a comfortable surface to rest against.

After a few hours, an alarm wakes you, and you can hear your captress stir too. After a few minutes of shuffling as she goes in and out of her room, you feel her open the drawer and her arms wrap around you.

She unties the knot and drops you onto her palm.

“I’m glad you’re still with us,” she states, which you can’t tell whether she’s sarcastic or serious.

You can tell that she has showered and is ready to go about her day. She carries you into her dining room, drops you onto the table, and starts to eat her breakfast. Since you immediately start running open landing, she places a clear cup on top of you.

“Oops, don’t want you to get any ideas,” she purrs. “Now we’re going to get to the bottom of this.”

What does she do?
112111121212211.title: Sock Straitjacket

1121111212122113.content:
You run to the edge of the cup’s walls and try with all your might push it over.

“That isn’t going to do anything silly,” she laughs as she eats breakfast with her spoon.

After pounding on it for a few seconds, you take a few steps backwards and begin to run at it with all your might.

“Oh we’re not going to have any of that,” she exclaims, realizing the potential harm that could cause you and lifts the cup up with her other hand before you collide. You now see a ticket straight off the edge of the table, and you continue your momentum forward. Quick thinking, she takes dips the spoon in her other hand into some applesauce on her plate and drops it directly on top of you. The mushy liquid breaks your momentum, yet the surface is too soft to harm you. As you get your breath back, she takes her final bites.



“To understand you, I’m going to have to get the opinion of someone a little more experienced at these things than me,” she explains, grabbing you and dropping you into her sock again. “That’s why I’m taking you to…
1121111212122113.title: Breakfast

choices: She says she’ll need to keep you for a little while to answer that question.
11211112121221131.content:
She drops you into a front pouch of her purse, away from any other dangerous item and zips it shut. You try to struggle but to no avail as she walks you both into her car and drives away. After a few minutes, she parks and arrives at her therapist.

“Hello Sarah, how are you?” the other woman asks.

“I’m doing well.”

“What do you want to talk about today?”

“Well, I picked up a new human pet yesterday, but he’s been acting really strange, tried to kill himself, and for today, I was wondering whether you’d being willing to check him out,” she narrates as she grabs you from her purse, opens up the sock, and hands you over to her therapist.

Behind you is your captress on a large couch, and in front of you is sitting her therapist on her desk chair. She is an African American woman in her mid-thirties with a button-down light blue shirt, casual but professional jeans, and black, toe-covering sandals.

“Hmm,” the therapist says looking down at you.
11211112121221131.title: Therapy Session

choices: Still keep you as a pet but resolves not to obsess like she was.
Give you away since she doesn’t need you anymore.
Return you back to the human world (with or without some fun destruction on the
112111121212211312.content:
She politely raises her hand to your captress and pushes her palm back gently, rejecting the offer to pick you up.

“I don’t normally counsel pets,” she states neutrally. “Sarah, what’s really going on?”

“I just don’t get why he keeps trying to kill himself,” Sarah replies.

“Ok, but why do you care so much about the decisions of a tiny human?”

“I don’t know,” she answers, pausing to reflect. “I think I’m just anxious about life and stuff. I just graduated from college and feel insignificant and pathetic in the wider world. Yesterday, I figured I’d go terrorize some human city to feel large and in charge.” As she says this, she starts to lean back into the couch, bringing you close to her chest with her open palm.

“Sometimes it’s helpful to do that. I agree,” the therapist responds. “Did it help you feel better?”

“Not really. I mean it did for a little while, but it faded away. When I saw his desire to kill himself, I saw the same anxiety I felt, and even then my attempt at controlling his fate felt empty.”

As she keeps explaining her anxiety, she starts petting your back and hair with the index and thumb of her other hand. You try to run against away from the two fingers, only to run into her middle and ring finger resting against the top of her palm. Her middle finger lifts you up and nests you in between her index finger. She continues subconsciously playing with you with her hand, like a fidget toy while she and her therapist break down her anxiety, periodically moving you between her fingers and periodically petting you, or both.

At the end of the session, she says, “Thank you Doctor. I realize that I was projecting my fears onto this little guy, but that I don’t need to fix him anymore. I need to figure out what I am doing with my life though.”

“Good. Now what are you going to do with him?” the therapist asked.

She decides to…

"Just what the hell are you doing in here?" You spin around, your mind racing with excuses when you see the barrel of a gun put to your forehead. You walk to the exact spot of the drop-off, in a ridge between two cliffs.

"Hello Goddess, I have your sacrifice for you," you call. She's usually already here. She's never kept you waiting before. Something's up.

You hear a faint rustle behind you. You flip around and the cart is gone. You're nervous: she's never crept up on you like that. You shout out again and hear some rocks tumbling in front of you. You turn around and are instantly snatched up by giant fingers. She's dangling you by the shirt in front of her face. Your offering cart is in her palm.

"This seems a little short this time," she bellows, tossling the cart up and done until the wheels break and the containers fall directly onto her palm. "Is this some kind of joke? How could these meager rations feed me. I need at least triple this."

"You said a fifth of all we grow. We had a drought this year!"

"Why should that concern me? I can easily hand you over to your enemies and receive food from them. Or better yet, I could raid your village myself. Do you want me to do that?"

"No goddess."

"Then give me more food!"

"Please we've been starving. We gave you a fifth of our stuff and look how meager it is. We can barely manage as is."

"That's not my problem," she bellowed. "All I've done is protect you guys and keep you alive, and this is how you reward me? This couldn't even feed me for a week!"

"I understand, Goddess!"

"You don't want me to go hungry, do you?"

"Of course not!"

Do you know what I could do?" she cooed, lowering you closer to her mouth. You try to cringe as her tongue licks your body from head to toe. "I could thin your herd a little by eating you. You know. Kill two birds. They'll have one less mouth to feed, and I'll get one more meal!"

"Please, goddess. Mercy!"

In response she simply begins to lower you into her mouth.

"I'm a productive farmer. If you get rid of me, no one will be able to grow my share of the land," you beg.

"K fine,' she concludes. "I won't eat you for now, but...

1) You cannot leave my walls.
2) You're on your own for food. I am starving enough to feed you as well. You may forage within inside my land as you are able.
3) When I call you, you must be back within a few minutes to complete my command.
Do you understand?

"Thank you."

11331.content:
Two options here:

The Wilds: Set in troubled, proto-ancient world in which people live in the depths of nature. People practice a hunter-gatherer life style, live in dense forest communities, and pray to primordial nature deities. You can play as a brave hunter, an apprentice shaman, or maybe a lone wanderer who comes into contact with one of these powerful natural beings.

Apotheosis: Set in the Bronze Age, you will be trapsing about a mythical world ruled by Gods, Monsters, and Heroes. Will you be a courageous Greek warrior? A faithful Egyptian priest? Maybe a scribe to the kings of Mesopotamia. This one's pretty open ended so feel free to write as you want.

Alright, who will be playing as?

A Shaman in training

A fearless Hunter

A lonesome Wanderer

More perhaps?
113311.title: The Wilds

choices: I was attacked along the way
1133111.content:
All is according to the Will of Nature. I have learned this over many years, from many people. When I was a boy and the fisherman came back from the river with spears of trout I knew it was the Will of Nature that we would be provided for. When the Chieftain slew the Bonebiter King even though his face was nearly cloven in two, I knew it was the Will of Nature that we would resist our enemies. When my master, Ekburkan, showed me the hidden pools with which he spoke to the Ik-Haran I knew that it was the Will of Nature that we would never be left in the dark. My name is Kleito, and it is the Will of Nature that I become a Shaman. I will guide our people through this furious world. I will show them how to tame the many beasts. I will teach them not to fear the darkness. I will heal their injured and commune with their spirits.

I was twenty when it all changed though. It started with a simple matter. One of the Chieftain's nephews came running back into the village screaming about demons in the crags. He and the other boys always wandered off to the cliffs overlooking the lake when they were done with their daily chores. It was a harsh place, and my master Ekburan had warned the elders many times that the place was cursed. Mothers often told their children to avoid the place, but only out of fear that they may hurt themselves on the jagged rocks. Few believed our warnings. Now, perhaps, the people would take heed.

"What is it Adu?" the Chieftain asked when he saw his young kinsmen running back through the brush with the other boys. "Where is Vaanku? Where is my son?"
"Black demons in the hills!" Adu cried with tears streaming down his face. The whole lot of them were terrified. "They looked like men with the heads of wolverines! They moved like mist. They have taken Vaanku!"
Immediately the Chieftain was overcome with grief. ALthough he was furious with the boys for disobeying his orders he was more dismayed by the loss of his son. Without hesitation he started off toward my master's hovel on the outskirts of the village. He brought with him many of his strongest, bravest, warriors. When they had reached my master, I saw that the Chieftain face was red with sadness. He pleaded with Ekburkan, asking forgiveness for his apathy and begged him to aid in his sons return.

"Ekburkan, master of the Wilds, do not forsake me now! I have wronged you yes, but now I see my mistake. Do not leave my son to these foul creatures!"
Ekburkan was always a wise man, but he knew that this situation was far more grave than the others realized.
"I cannot chief, it is not within my power to deliver your son from these beings for I do not know of them. But there perhaps one who might..."
"Who?" The chief asked with desperation.
"One of the oldest Gods of the wood. She dwells beneath the oldest tree in the oldest part of the forest, many many miles from here. It is said she has power over all in this domain."
"Then I shall go to her!" the Chieftain decreed, but as he stood to leave Ekburkan stopped him once more.
"No, these Gods, are not to so casually be trifled with. Only one accustomed to their ways may broker such a deal."
The Chieftain's face sank. He knew what this meant, and it grieved him because he knew that only a Shaman could make contact with this goddess. Likewise it was readily apparent to all in teh village that Ekburkan himself could not go for he was far too old and blindness had already began to set upon him. To make such a journey would be treacherous for him. There was only one choice.
"I shall go and petition the goddess for aid!" I cried out.
All eyes turned to me. The Chieftain's face lit up with relief for a second but it quickly faded when Ekburkan chided me.
"You cannot go Kleito, you are not yet ready!", But I was adamant. This would be my defining moment. If I could make contact with the goddess, bring back the chieftain's son, and perhaps establish good relations with the governing deities than my place in the village would be solidified. I argued on and on. Finally the Chieftain came to me after I had stormed out of my Masters hovel and said:
"Kleito, forgive your master, for though he is wise he is far too cautious. I have faith in you, I must after all for you are my only hope. Here take this" he went on, handing me a special totem made of bone. "This is my seal, take it with you and you will have safe passage through these lands. Please hurry! Go to the goddess and ask what you must. If she asks something of me I will grant whatever is in my power to recover my son." I nodded.
The next morning, I rose earlier than usual, just as the sun began to creep out over the ridges. I gathered what I could, including my gnarled stave that I had fashioned from a twisted Willow branch. Then, I was off.
1133111.title: Let's be a Shaman!

choices: I could not bring myself to speak
11331111.content:
I will not bore with my journey through the wilds for it pales in comparison to what happened to me when i finally arrived. I swam across a stream. Climbed across a hill of boulders. Staved off a pack of savage wolves and when I drew closer I wandered aimlessly for hours in a dense fog. Finally, whether it was by sheer luck or divine will, I came to my destination. Before me was the largest tree I had ever seen. Its gnarled roots spread out in an unending fan, creating massive hills in the woodland and displacing other lesser trees. The trunk was cut off a third of the way up, leaving only splayed bark and mountains of moss along the surface. Enormous cracks in the tree's body sprouted life of all sorts. Flocks of birds milled around it as though it was a mountain. I had never been so fully humbled in my life. I took a second to take a knee and give a thankful prayer to Sydros, Lord of the Sky, but remembered how fickle the gods were. It would not be wise to offer a prayer to one god while in the domain of another. A murder of crows eyed me hungrily from a nearby maple, cawing after me as if to mock my approach. I was yet unphased. My skin dripped with sweat, my heart raced, and my muscles grew weary from the day's travels. Yet the excitement drove me forward. I would have to conduct myself carefully if I was to survive and flawlessly if I was to be successful in my mission. I could see the enormous hole in the tree's side, leading to the Goddess' home beneath the massive trunk. Before it was an enormous stone table which served as the deity's altar. Many sacrifices had been placed here over the years, usually when the Goddess slept or was away. Few wanted to meet her in person but if my petition was to be heard I would have to face her myself.
When I stepped onto the stone surface the mist seemed to close in around me. A sharp whisper began to pull at the back of my head.
"Who is this?" I paused, the voice faded, and I continued on. Then again it hissed: "Someone coming to seek my aid?"
I didn't like how she was in my head already, but I knew that I had to follow through with protocol. I knelt down on both knees and began to meditate.
"Have you brought me an offering?" the voice came again. I had. From my sack I produced a human effigy woven from fine flaxen bundles and decorated with shiny stones, black glass, and beads. Feathers from at least twelve birds, the bones of a vixen, and bundle of human hair, blood of a new mother's womb, and small shells from the lake. I set it in front of me on a slightly raised deus. No sooner had I withdrawn my hands that the mist enveloped it completely. Whether it was still there I could not yet tell. My mind was seized by other things, namely the massive shadow rising up out of the fog. A warm orange glow appeared from the depths of the tree. The figure was distinctly female, with long hair. Her shoulders arched back and finally in the gloom I could see her face. It was painted with many strange signs with white and red clay. Her hair was smooth and brown, like that of a fine mare. Her eyes though! Here eyes were a deep green. So green that they reminded me of newly budded leaves. Those dark pupils darted across my form. Finally she spoke again.
"Such young blood comes to me this day."
11331111.title: I reached the Goddess's home

choices: To inhabit the body of a human.”
You to build for me a portal between our worlds.”
113311111.content:
“Hello mighty Goddess,” you stammer nervously. The mist had formed into a giant face, the size of your home, staring expectantly at you. “I have come in seek of your aid on behalf of my village.”

“And what is your request?” She asked.

“The black demons from the hills have taken the chief’s son, and we need to you to force them to relinquish him.”

“Oh, and what would I get for such an ambitious endeavor?” She responded nonchalantly.

“We can give you sacrifices as food for the years to come to help sustain you, and offerings of gold and silver.”

“I have no need of these. I have more food and useless metals in this forest than you could possibly give me. No, but there is something I have wanted that only you humans can give me?”

“What is that, my goddess?” You reply, used to this type of bargaining.

“I would like…”
113311111.title: Petitioning the Goddess

choices: You go straight to the hills.
1133111111.content:
“I have frequently been able to inhabit the bodies of deer, bears, and other creatures of my forest, but you humans in your villages have always stood aloft. I have always been curious as to what it is like to inhabit the body of a human,” she explains. “And to defeat these demons, I would need to inhabit you.”

This seems like a fair deal to you. You knew that she would need to effect the corporal world directly to counter the demons, necessitating your body. This is going better than you thought.

“I would agree to that,” you reply.

“Ok it’s settled then,” she states, her giant face leaning towards you. You flinch as her building-sized faces comes straight towards you. “Do not be afraid, my little man. It will be quick, but we must enter each other.”

Her giant puckered lips envelope your view, like she is going to kiss you. Instead, she sucks you inside her moist, misty mouth. You feel yourself enter her, both materially but also spiritually. You begin to open your mouth to scream, but a cloud of her mist enters your mouth before any noise can come out. You feel her enter your body, causing your nerves to spasm reflectively. She hums softly, which soothes you enough for her to enter your very being. You feel a jolt of pain as your very self gets pushed out of your being so that she can come in. At that, you feel her bringing you back, and you reenter your body and wake from the strange sleep in the real world.

“I am here with you, my little man,” her voice inside your head says. She opens your palms and releases some magic fire. “Go to the hills where the demons hide, and when you get there, I will confront them through you.”

You know these demons are spirits inhabiting the physical world as giants, far too large and powerful for you to confront physically or spiritually, but rest at ease since she can vanquish them easily.
1133111111.title: Entering your body

11412211.content:
Your name is Jake, your 22 years old with brown hair, green eyes and you were wearing a black T-shirt, brown pants and grey sneakers. And you've been bored out of your mind lately. So bored that you were currently in the local town Library trying to find anything to do.

Normally reading would be in the never do column for you. But you decided to give it a shot. The Library itself was huge! More then you expected by far. It was also kind of surprising that the Library was also very empty. There was about five people in the library, including you and the librarian. Guess this town isn't really into books. Which is surprisingly considering the two story library

Your looking through the fictional shelf trying to find something that might interest you. Most of the books were either too boring looking or had thousands of pages. That was when you came across a book you remember from your childhood, it was the Alice in Wonderland book, the one Disney released so it had pictures from there movies.

You remember reading this book all the time. It was kind of your go to book back then. Deciding you wanted to revisit your childhood, you find the nearest seat and read it.

You spent the next hour reading and you were enjoying it. You always like Alice. She just seemed Like a nice girl and you feel like it would be nice to meet her.

While you were thinking this, the book started to glow. You reaction was simple as you threw the book away and backed away. You watch in complete shock as out of the light a small girl appeared. She had blonde hair and you recognized her immediently.

"Alice" you say confused as the girl started to grow to ____________
11412211.title: In The Library

114122111.content:
You watch as the girl Alice grew and grew, growing way past your height and way past a normal person's height. She seemed to stop around 30 feet, towering over you as you notice something. She looked actual about your age rather then the little girl she was in the book. You didn't know her actual age but you could easily tell she was in her mid twenties. Another thing you could easily tell is that she was beyond hot! Her. . . . assets were huge and her. . . . chest bone was very well covered.

She had to sit down as she couldn't stand up properly as she was obviously freaking out very much. "What's going on, am I still in wonderland!"

"Alice, Alice" you yell up to her as she looks down at you.

"Oh my, how did you know my name" she said down to you.

"That's not important. What's important right now is to get you out of sight." you say to her as you walk between two bookshelves. "This way, quick!"

She crawls into the book aisle as she has to squeeze to fit in. You guide her so she doesn't knock anything over and attract attention.

"Alice." you say getting her attention "My name is Jake" you say raising a hand to her.

Alice with her hands and knees raises one and shakes your hand. Her palm engulfing your arm as she shakes it up and down. Raising you off of the ground before placing you back down.

"Likewise jake, can you please tell me where am I?" Alice asked.

"Your in the real world, you came out of this book" you say grabbing the book and showing it to her. You didn't show her the title though.

"Can I ask another question Jake?" she asks.

"Of course Alice" you reply acting nice and friendly.

What is her question?
114122111.title: 30 Foot Alice

1141311.content:
Madelyn was walking down a dark hallway, so dark that she only see but a few feet in front of her. She didn't know how she got there, or where she was, only that she had to keep moving forward. She saw a small light ahead, illuminating a lone door. As she walked forward she heard a scream come from behind the door. "Hello?" she cried out. No reply. She continued forward, somewhat uneasily approaching the door. "Hey are you alright in there?" she said nervously. She reached for the doorknob, but just as she was about to touch it it began to turn, back and forth, back and forth. The door began to open

Madelyn suddenly awoke, her head laying atop a mound of books and papers. She quickly sat up in her chair, brushing her loose hair from her face, her eyes wide. She looked around her small apartment, with a tinge of fear. What an odd dream, she thought. She looked back down at her desk seeing the pieces of last night's work strewn about...ugh! "I need some kind of break, all this studying is getting to my head" she said to no one in particular. She sat up and switched on the tv on her nightstand, the news was on and they were talking about her again. "Ugh seriously? They're STILL talking about this shit..." she said with frustration. The shit she had been referring to happened a few days before when Madelyn, or Mega Woman rather, stopped a series of attacks in New York by a technology based terrorist cell, using machines and helicopters to attack major landmarks. She managed to dispatch them with relative ease, like swatting flies out of the sky. However being a giantess she naturally caused some damage of her own, and everyone either praised her over and over again for her deeds or criticized her for her mistakes. In the past year and half that she's been Mega Woman she would always get a mix of love and hate from the people. The government always hated her because they couldn't control her, in her first few appearances (before anyone knew who she was or what she was trying to do) the army repeatedly tried to destroy her, but their weapons did little to affect her. The worst though was the media, half wouldn't stop talking about her outfit alone. Though she like helping people, honestly the attention was getting to annoy her, she was just glad most people hadn't found out who she really was yet (they had a good idea though). Just then her phone buzzed and when she picked it up she saw it was...

Tokyo 2078 --- Department For Monster Activities

Briefing Room:
Colonel Saito paced back and forth trying his best to come up with an answer. "Well we are waiting Colonel..." said General Ayshu rather irreverently. The assembly of generals, strategists, and intelligence officers all watched Saito intently waiting for his response. The meeting had been called to resolve the recent international issues caused by project GIDA, a secret government program which hoped integrate genetic coding of different species. It was this program that generated the now world famous Girlzilla, as she was popularly called. When she was first released she got quite a bit of media attention. Nations around the world were outraged, fearing this new technology could be used to breed a super army. The action was condemned by the UN Security Council and now nations everywhere were in a desperate race to make their own super-humans. Colonel Saito, leader of project GIDA, had been called to address the new diplomatic perils faced by the Japanese government and what he intended for the future of the Monster Defense Program and the GIDA project.

"Need I repeat myself Colonel?" General Ayshu said, a sense of mounting anger in his voice. "How is our government to respond to these threats? Though the initial use of Subject G-94 was sanctioned by our government pressures from the UK, US, China, and Russia now put our program at risk. We cannot afford to divulge the secrets of Project GIDA, nor can we continue it as it is going now, so I ask again colonel what do you propose we do?" Ayshu finished, the rest of assembly looking onward, staring the man down as if he had just killed the President himself. The colonel wiped his brow and then....

This just isn’t Japan, we are talking about the entire goddamn planet, and if you don’t want to listen to that… then you can get the fuck out of my office right now, my decision is final!” Colonel Saito yelled out to the entire board in the office in anger. Just then another platform lowered right in front of her face with a troop of well-dressed intelligence officers and military leaders upon it. Girlzilla didn't mind this at all, and in fact... it was good, as the world needed someone who can resist against those monsters that are destroying their cities and killing the humans off. "Well... I think it was about time away... you know... they should have reasons for us to believe that they are, it's not like they are going to attack us or anything, aren't they?" Girlzilla asked. "Good news is, they won't... in fact, they are following in our footsteeps, and that's great... although people will be outrage to here this though." Saito replied. "So... what are you calling in me for?" she asked.

"That's what I am getting to, we are going to go to New York City and demonstrate your and Project GIDA to the world, and... let the world know that we have the weapon to fight those monsters. We will be leaving in a week or so, enough time for you to proceed with the Girlzilla holiday and being with the children. But.. after this Girlzilla, you won't be the only super powered giantess as of now. They have the same reasons, to fight and defend their city. Go on ahead and head back to the children, and.... sorry for interrupting your day." Saito said, sorry that he nearly ruined her day with the kids with the sudden news. "Thanks... I will go. And thank you for offering to let me stay for the holiday and all..."

114131211122.content:
The Next Day....

Girlzilla woke up to the slight hum of voices outside her hangar. She knew what that meant, it was her very own eponymous holiday. She loved the people, and it was nice to be appreciated but she still hadn't adjusted to all the attention. She rose from her bed and approached the door, trying to wake herself up from her rather restless sleep. "Ready for the big day?" She heard a tiny voice chirp. She looked up and saw Takumi, the systems engineer waiting on a platform just above the door. He was sitting before a large panel of buttons, dials, and levers all of which controlled the hangar and its functions. "Morning Takumi," she replied rather sluggishly, still rubbing her eyes. "Just keep your cool and everything will be fine, I hear the old Colonel has a surprise for you as well..." Takumi chimed, trying his best to sound uplifting. "Yeah I bet he does" Girlzilla said with a heavy tone of condescension. "Well goodluck, door's opening in 10...9...8...7" he began to count down. Girlzilla though wasn't paying attention though, she was still thinking about these other giantesses. Would they be like her? Will she get to meet them? What does this mean for her and the rest of the program? "3...2...1" Takumi finished, suddenly the hangar door opened letting in a blinding ray of sunlight. Girlzilla stepped out, shielding her eyes with her hand. She was immediately met with cannons filled with confetti and the cries of thousands. As her eyes adjusted she looked out at the tiny townspeople cheering in the streets and from rooftops. She stepped out into the streets which had been cleared for her. She began her usually parade down to the center of town where she would meet the mayor and proceed with the day's activities. As she passed down the street, the crowd closed in behind her, cutting off her path back and following her to her destination. Girlzilla scanned the streets seeing every manner of person along the sidewalk. School children, businessmen, families, creepy male look-alikes, even the street urchins. As she walked on...

"Ladies and Gentlemen.... are you ready for the big surprise... this year... as of now... she isn't the only Girlzilla now!" the announcer said, and then Girlzilla and the people started to get really hyped up for the 2 things that would surprise everyone. Terror Destroyer... and Big Destructor!!!!!" they said, and the helicopters land and reveals the giantesses, and the 2 are hyped to see Girlzilla.

The metal containers fell apart, revealing two massive female forms inside. The one to the right had a light tone of skin with smooth brown hair that came down to her shoulder blades. She wore a bikini top made from plates of metal and specialized polymers, with a pair of skin-tight shorts made of some synthetic fabric, and a pair of pointed boots that came up halfway her calf. The most noticeable thing about her was her eyes though, her irises were a bright green but she seemed nervous and kept her eyes down, staring down at her feet. The other seemed more confident. She seemed to be around 21 one years old and had shoulder length blonde hair. She wore a sort of onepiece suit with thin shoulder straps and similar boots. She wore a frown, not at all pleased with all the attention. She walked over, just barely stepping on a host of civilians as she approached Girlzilla. 11413211.content:
Wonder Woman had just returned to Justice League headquarters after saving the world....again. She was coming back from the cargo bay when she saw The Atom bolting down after her. "Diana wait I need your help!" he cried after her, his voice filled with desperation. She turned around and grabbed a hold of him. "Calm down Ray, what's wrong?" she said calmly. "My experiment...its...its going unstable come on!" he cried pulling onto her. "Alright alright just calm down and explain" Wonder Woman replied as they reached The Atom's lab. She looked about and saw a collection of various machines and gizmos that The Atom used in his size altering experiments. "Well I was working on a way to stabilize my regrowth process and...well things got out of hand, its hard to explain but the controls are locked up and I need someone super strong to open the quanta chamber!" he cried pointing wildly to a large glowing cone shaped machine. Wonder Woman waited a second longer, she then immediately stepped up to the machine and punched a hole in it. Meanwhile Dr. Palmer was typing away at his station trying to bring his machine under control. As Wonder Woman ripped the machine open with relative ease a blinding light erupted out. "No no this isn't supposed to happen, the core is getting to hot...we have to.." Dr. Palmer cried, but he was interrupted by a blast that sent Wonder Woman flying. The intense energy knocked the amazon out cold...

She came to a few minutes later. As she opened eyes and stood up she saw The Atom looking up at her. He looked like he had shrunk down to 2 feet tall. "Hey what happened? Why did you shrink-BAM!" Wonder Woman rammed her head into the ceiling as she stood up. How could that be though, she thought, the ceiling is like 16 feet tall. She then looked around and realized that Dr. Palmer had not shrunk but she had grown! "Wha- what happened to me..." she asked, obviously quite stunned. "There was a malfunction, the core...it...it changed you quantum ratios you started growing as soon as you were knocked out..." he said sheepishly. "what does this mean? will I- BAM!" she hit her head again she could feel herself growing even more. "You will keep growing until you stabilize, you took a lot of energy so you will likely grow a lot more, we need to get you off this ship!" he said, but she had already bolted for the transport pad. She ran down the hallway, her now massive feet shaking it violently as she went. She reached the pad and The Martian Manhunter was there. "Diana what happened to you?" he asked quizzically. "No time J'onn beam me somewhere without many people, hurry!" she said desperation mounting as she continued to grow bigger. He did as he was instructed and in a few moment she was gone. Then....

This town was still occupied by civilians so Wonder Woman took extra care as she touched down. It didn't take long for a chorus of screams to erupt from the surrounding land as the titanic Amazon landed, and everywhere people took to the streets, either to catch a glimpse of the giantess or to flee from her towering red boots. Wonder Woman scanned the ground around her, seeing tropes of people and vehicles gathered about. Finally a streak of green light cut across the landscape and came to rest in front of her face. "Diana!" the tiny figure cried. "Hal, I'm glad I found you!" Wonder Woman echoed in reply. She looked down around her again nervously, clearly afraid she'll accidentally crush a building or two. "I know, but we've been monitoring you, but you're still a huge liability...errr literally" he said. Wonder Woman nodded, "I know, I still want to help but perhaps I should lay low for a while, have you figured out a way to fix me?" she asked desperately. The Green Lantern sort of shrugged his shoulder's in reply, "errr we're working on it, apparently The Atom's machine is really messed up, but we need you to travel to a safe location away from populous areas, just you're footsteps have been sending seismic activity up the coast...". Wonder Woman winced, "yeah sorry about that, its sort of hard to control when you're this big, I'll find a place". Green Lantern drifted closer and flew towards her ear. "Also just between you and me, the army getting pissed, they think you're gonna destroy the whole world or something..." Wonder Woman gasped, "I'd never", "I know" Green Lantern interrupted but they're thinking about escalating their attack if you don't...you know, slip off the radar." Green Lantern flew back again and just before he departed he turned back to her, "Good luck Diana!' and then like that he was gone. Wonder Woman looked down at the crowds of people staring up at her in amazement. She crouched down to get a better look at them. They all began to scurry about like tiny ants as she drew closer. "Its ok I'm not gonna hurt you!" she boomed. She looked over at a skyscraper which stood near by. At her full height, the skyscraper would only reach her waist, but from here she could see inside. She peered into some of the tiny windows and saw dozens of little people flee.

Meanwhile a young intern in a new law firm was just coming back from break. He had heard the commotion outside and felt the building shake and assumed it was an earthquake. As he opened the door he looked out the window across from him and saw an enormous female face peering in at him. "Holy shi-" he began, dropping his coffee on the floor.

He looked up and saw Wonder Woman looking down at him. He sat up and realized he now rested in her hand.

Her two enormous hands crash down into the path of the fleeing humans, creating a tremor that sent them sprawling to the ground. She began to ease the panicked mob into her palm. After some careful doing, she managed to sit the last of the tiny people on her hand. Those that sat in her grasp screamed and wailed with fear as their colossal captor rose to her feet and proceeded to walk to the nearest town. Upon her arrival she stepped over a few city blocks and found a nice, open square where she could deposit the humans. She let the slide off onto the ground, and stood back up to her full height. Nearby there was a gigantic monitor on a nearby building, showing a local news report. The screen had shaky footage of Wonder Woman's recent titanic escapades, including the recent mid-air collision. Wonder Woman knelt down and watched the screen anxiously. The media was making her out to be a monster as well. "Hmph, after all this you guys still think I'm some kind evil rampaging monster?" She asked to no one in particular. The populace below was already in great chaos. Then all of a sudden she heard a faint familiar voice...

1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.content: "Ahh, so it is true..." Wonder Woman peered down and saw another peculiar figure atop a nearby building. A harsh red aura emanated from his fierce armored facade. A long black cape cascaded down around him, billowing with a cloud of smoke. Atop his head was a striking, crested Corinthian helmet, from which his glowing red eyes could be seen. "Ares!" Wonder Woman boomed. "What are you doing here?" she asked. "Hahaha, oh Diana, you honestly don't think I'd miss this well of power? Since your metamorphosis the armies actions have fueled my powers beyond any expectations. I haven't felt this invigorated since the last world war." Ares laugh echoed out over the city. "Believe it or not you are the most destructive force this world has ever seen...pity you aren't using your full potential." Wonder Woman scowled back down at him. "Leave this place, you are no match for me..." she cried. Ares simply laughed and waved his hand. "I know this...no one's a match for you...that's the point..." With that Ares released a blast of red magical energy straight into her face. She reeled back, crashing into a skyscrapers. The top half immediately crumpled and collapsed into a pile of debris. Suddenly Wonder Woman...
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.title: Ares

Give into the anger and destroy all you hold dear." Gritting her teeth while keeping herself from damaging anymore buildings or people Diana grunted "Never Ares you can't control me..." "Oh I don't have to your anger is doing the job quite nicely the more you struggle to contain it,the powerful the urges become eventually you will have little choice but to start destroying stuf and what a sight that will be. Even the mighty Justice League won't be enough to stop your rampages once it begins I wish I could stay here and help you channel your anger problem but I got things to do and places to see." As he vanished in a layer of black smoke Wonder Woman meanwhile was a terrible loss if she gave in the slightest amount of anger no doubt innocent lives would be lost the whole planet was at her mercy literally as she struggled harder than before to contain it
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.title: Became incredibly angry, but tried to fight it

1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.content: Her blood boiled. Her head throbbed. All she wanted to do was smash the tiny buildings around her. She grabbed her temples and shut her eyes. Her breathe began to quicken, creating a series of violent gusts that swept down to the minuscule populace below. She suddenly felt woozy. She stepped back, her massive boot crushed a convenience store and another apartment building collided with her hip, causing it to crumble and fall. "NOOOOO!" she roared. By now more helicopters belonging to the media and to the cops surrounded her once again. She lifted her foot as if to smash the nearest block. She quickly removed her lasso of truth and wrapped it around her. "Come on..." her mind became sharper, focused. She remembered her times back at Themyscira, back with the Justice League and suddenly her anger began to soften. It was push and pull, for every peaceful thought she had another violent one would resurface. She began to stumble around even more, trying to maintain her composure. As she stepped the city below rocked and quaked. The skyscrapers shook, the roads crack and sank and countless people fell to the ground amid the extreme tremors. People screamed as the towering titaness trampled the city block. Something finally gave way. She let out a cry that sounded out for miles. "AHHHH!" she cried. Suddenly the red aura disappeared as the combined force of her willpower and the magic of her lasso drove the last traces of Ares' magic out. However the severity of the situation had made something inside of her snap. She was so exhausted she immediately lost balance. She felt light-headed, so much so that she finally collapsed. As her colossal body came crashing down at least a dozen buildings crumbled beneath her. A shockwave emanated out statewide. Finally as the dust cleared Wonder Woman's unconscious body lay in the ruins of the city.
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.title: She overcomes Ares' control

choices: A general is there with the kid from before
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.content: Some time later Wonder Woman began to stir. Her head throbbed and the rest of her body felt numb. 'What happened?' she thought to herself. Had it all been a bad dream. Her being a giant, causing untold destruction everywhere she went? Slowly her eyes opened once again, blinking as they adjusted to the sunlight. She lifted her slight off the ground only to realize that the events of the past few days were, in fact, reality. Around her were the shattered remains of a sizable portion of the city. Mounds of rubble surrounded her titanic limbs but what really caught her eye were the dozens of military personnel surrounding her. At least 20 helicopters dotted the sky around her and all across her body were tiny soldiers mulling about. Upon noticing the giantess waking they turned their attention to her head, weapons raised. "Wha-what are you doing, get off of me!" she cried. The sheer force of her voice caused many to drop their guns and cover their ears in a futile attempt to block the thundering noise. On her chest a dozen soldiers cried out in terror. Wonder Woman inhaled deeply, causing the majority of them to fall to down as her chest rose. She let out a gust of air as if a gale from a hurricane knocking the remaining down. She began to sit up. Causing those on her chest and neck to tumble down onto her boobs, a few stragglers fell down between her breasts. Those on her stomach fell into her lap. Wonder Woman took a second to assess the situation and decided it was best to get out of here as soon as possible. But it was then she noticed the nearby command tent erected a hundred yards to her right. Perhaps she could finally put a stop to this constant harassment by the military if she could get a hold of whoever was in charge. She began collect the humans in her lap in her hand, ignoring the barrage of fire from the helicopters and tanks. After depositing them elsewhere she began to collect those that had fallen in her cleavage. "Hera help me, if another of you little people end up down here" Once her task was done she rolled over onto her hands and knees and crawled toward the camp. Personnel were fleeing in all directions and she was careful not to cause any more destruction than she already had. She plucked off the canvas cover of the command tent to reveal the tiny occupants below.
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.title: She wakes up

1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.content: When she raised up the canvas cover Diana was utterly shocked to see not only the general but the same teenaged boy from before. Her jaw dropped. "Why are you here?" He looked up nervously "The military picked me up just after you left and they have been asking me countless questions about you and I'm sick of it. Please take me with you!" Arching an eyebrow the Amazing Amazon couldn't help but be skeptical, afterall was this not the same boy who was terrified of her before? Instead of replying she turned to the General and said "Please tell your men to stop attacking me I was tolerant the first few times but if it happens again I may not be able to control myself." He seemed unmoved "You're a menace Wonder Woman not only to the U.S. but the rest of the world as well, I don't see why the rest of your teammates don't put you out of your misery right now!" She looked completely sour but managed to keep her temperature in check "Meaning?" He looked squarely at the titanic beauty "Until you somehow shrink back to normal I'm authorized to hunt you down and end your reign of terror. And believe me I will succeed, we got half of the world's military forces at our back, even LexCorp and Starlabs have offered to aid us so you won't be around for long I'm afraid. That is, unless your friends can somehow shrink you back to normal. Men, fire!" He commanded to the men. They were armed with both normal and LexCorp weapons designed to severely wound superhumans. Wonder Woman readied herself but the boy leapt up onto her left boot crying out "Quickly follow me there's a way out of here." What route does she take now?
1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.title: A general is there with the kid from before

1141321122221222212212212111121222211122.content: Though Wonder Woman was not one to back down from a fight, she couldn't risk causing any more damage to the city. Besides she could easily hurt one of the hundreds of tiny soldiers mulling about around her. So, acting quickly, she reached down and picked the young man off her boot with her thumb and forefinger. The general below began to scream at her through a megaphone, "PUT HIM DOWN NOW, HE IS UNDER THE PROTECTION OF THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT!" Wonder Woman simply rolled her eyes as she lifted her tiny companion up to her chest. She lifted her breastplate just enough to tuck the tiny figure between it and her boob. Once he was secure she stood to her full height and stomped her foot on the ground, creating a shock wave which sent most of the army in a fearful frenzy. With the men distracted she looked down at her minuscule passenger who was pointing frantically northward. She leaped up into the air and began soaring in the direction indicated. She had to do a little tricky maneuvering to fly past the dozens of helicopters surrounding the city but in a few minutes she sped through clear skies. "I'm getting real sick of them...'' she went on. She looked down at the boy, "Where are we going exactly?" He began to speak but the roar of the wind around them drowned him out. She stopped midair to address him. "Alright we need a plan, Ares is on the loose now and I still need to lay low, where precisely are we going?"

She realize that was standing in the remains of a destroyed food mart. "Maybe staying this big wasn't a great idea." She told herself. She opens her eyes and look around, she was in a room. An empty room, this room was white with a fancy feel about it and the only thing in the room was a table with some cookies on it. But she was more interested about how she's in one piece, she was falling for ages.

He opens his eyes to see that she wasn't lying "No way! Your Kim Possible, I'm Jake and I'm a huge fan!"

"Oh thanks kid. I do my best, but I have to ask you a question? Do you know where we are?"

"No clue. I just fell down a hole and ended up here, and then you fell on me"

"Well that's no good. Cmon Jake, let's figure this out"

So both Kim and Jake looked around the room. While the only thing to really care about was the table and the cookies, Kim found a small door on one of the walls, but this door looks like it wouldn't even be able to fit a toddler, let alone a teenager like her. She looks over to Jake and....

Seeing no other options, she reached down for a _____________ and ate it"

"Now you servant woman. Fetch me my white gloves and be quick about it, I have a meeting with the Red Queen and trust me when I tell you. You don't want to get on her bad side" the rabbit said as Kim decided to do it. The two walked inside while the Rabbit waited. It would of been good if he told them where the gloves were. 11413222122221.content:
Daria woke up, finally getting a comfortable and long sleep, it usually always got interrupted by her evil step family. Daria wouldn't admit it outright, but her life on the farm might just be the worst.

That's why when she woke up in a room she did't recognize, she wasn't that worried. The room was fancy, much fancier then the farm and honestly a bit small. It was more like the room was made for someone who was barely over a foot. She walked around the room looking for anyone.

"Hello, is there anyone here? Anyone who might know where I am?" she asked. She didn't get a response however. No noise other then a slight snoring sound.

Wait Snoring? It didn't take long for Daria to follow where it came from. As when she walked towards the couch. She spotted a young boy no older then Eleven. The weird part about him was his white hair.

Daria started to shake the boy trying to Wake him up.

"Don't Worry, Ace Savvy Is Here To Save The Day!" the boy said as he woke up. "What? Where am I? Who are you?" the boy asked.

"I'm Daria. And as for where I'm not quite sure. Would this be your house?" Daria asked

"No, it doesn't look like my house" Lincoln replied

"It would seem we both have just..... Woken up here"

"I'm Lincoln. Lincoln Loud by the way" the boy says introducing himself. "nice to meet you Daria"

"Likewise Lincoln" Daria replied.

"So we both just woke up here huh?" Lincoln said as he got off of the couch "Then I suppose we better find out where we are?"

"That seems like a good plan Lincoln" Daria agreed

And with that both Daria and Lincoln tried figuring out where they were?

"Oh Dear Heavens, this place Is dirty beyond belief. Oh no oh no" the Rabbit said as he ran around frantically, both to Lincoln's and Daria's confusion. The Rabbit stopped when he spotted Daria.

"You, maid woman, what have you been doing all day! This place is filthy?" the Rabbit asked her.

"But she's not a-" Lincoln interrupted.

"I don't want to hear it" the rabbit interrupted back. "The red queen is coming today and I need this place to be as spotless as can be, otherwise it will be 'Off With My Head'. Now I'm off to get a cake
Prepared. And I want this place clean, do you understand maid woman"

The Rabbit ran out of the door before Daria could argue back. Both her and Lincoln were left confused until Daria shrugged her shoulders and started cleaning up

"Daria, you don't have to clean up just because he told you too?" Lincoln said.

"Oh it's no big deal, I've done this all my life, plus didn't you hear the rabbit. The queen's coming. Maybe she will know why we just woke up here" Daria said explaining her actions. Once understood Lincoln began helping her clean up.

"Oh Lincoln. You don't have to help" Daria said to the young boy.

"It's no big deal Daria. I have 10 sisters in my house, so I'm used to cleaning up. In fact you could say I'm a pro." Lincoln replied

And they started cleaning up the house for the small rabbit

While dusting the table Daria found something that caught her eye. It was a plate or cookies on the table. Now Daria would know better then just to take someone's cookies. But there was just something about them that made them so irresistible to her. Finally deciding that there would be no way they would be able to tell if one cookie was missing she reached down and ate one.

No sooner from when she ate the final piece of the cookie down her throat and it made the trip to her stomach. The side effect took place. She felt her body go through a weird change. It felt like it was expanding, and truthfully it was. Her height was now doubled as she looked at the already small house and noticed that it looked half the size. And even worse for Daria, she was still growing.

Lincoln realized this too when he turned around and was greeted by the giant leg of Daria.

"Daria, what's going on?!" Lincoln asked both concerned and confused as he looked up at her.

Daria reached the top of the ceiling and sat down just to avoid growing even more. Her legs easily reaching from wall to wall. "I don't know Lincoln, I just ate a cookie and this happened" Daria told him. Watching the young boy get smaller and smaller. However it wasn't long until she couldn't see him anymore, because her head broke the ceiling and she came out on the other side. She saw the forest that was surrounding the house as her head saw above all the trees. She felt her arms and legs break through the walls too as she was at this point wearing the house like a dress. Finally after a while the growing seemed to stop as Daria was relieved. She didn't know much about what happened but she did know one thing. The Rabbit will not be happy. After a while Daria began to grow concerned about the boy she might have just killed

Daria asked concerned "Lincoln, please tell me your all right!".

Is Lincoln alright?

"Lincoln are you alright, your not underneath me. Are you?" Daria asked once again. She was beginning to get a little worried. However Lincoln managed to pull through.

"I'm okay Daria, just a little surprised" Lincoln finally said giving Daria a much needed answer. Lincoln crawled out from under her dress. It appeared that he was under the fabric but not under her leg or butt. Luckily for him considering that he wouldn't want to be under her weight

"Wow, what happened to you Daria." he said as he looked at Daria. At least the parts that was still in the house. Her face was being blocked by the roof so he couldn't really see her, and she couldn't really see him.

He climbs up and eventually pass the ceiling. He climbed until he reached the top of her head. Her red hair moving.

11421.content:
(Hey guys, I'm back, haven't done any GTS/SM stories in a LOOOOONG time, Oh well, I'm back :])

The last thing Rik remembered was being on that "luxury cruise" that was destined for somewhere he couldn't pronounce. It was supposed to be all safe and fun, at least, that's how he remembered it. The rooms and food were great, Especially that weird purple drink that was "wine." It didn't taste like wine though. Probably something like cough syrup. Whatever it was, it made him dizzy...

Rik opened his eyes slowly and groaned, lifting his head up off of what felt like a sand pile. He looked around at the water and the beach around him. Clearly, he either fell off or shipwrecked somewhere. Otherwise, there was no explanation. Whatever had happened, Rik felt a panic coming on as he kept his hand to an anxious chest, thinking he might be stuck here forever.
"Oh no, Oh God please no." Rik buried his face in his hands, letting his blond hair flow over them as he sniffled. He felt alone, scared, and with that, he fell onto his side and fell into a much-needed rest.

114212.content:
In his dreams, Rik died alone on the island, even though he had only spent a short time awake on it. That time resumed to him as he woke, yawned, and stretched. It was night. From the warm but cool breeze the day had brought, it had turned into a chill. He shivered as he crawled upward, his clothes still wet and foul from the salt water. Rik sniffled again, his thoughts speaking to him. Maybe you'll get found. Don't give up yet. There's probably people looking for you. The thought made Rik feel only a bit better, as all his life, he felt as though he hadn't a friend in the world. It was that feeling that lowered his chances of ever being found. He sighed and crawled onto a green palm leaf, curling up. He wasn't that tall anyway, so he fit like a baby in a crib, warm and content to sleep. And so Rik did.

The next time he woke, Rik found himself feeling a bit happier. It was dawn, a new day to do whatever he felt like. But he couldn't do anything, all he wanted was to see someone, or hear their voice. His stomach grumbled as he scratched his head.
Food time, I guess.
