1211.content:
Name: Jessica
Jessica was born among the mountains, and knew no family. Her earliest recolletcions are of a family of bears raising her. She set off into the world after a harsh winter, and found to her shock others who resembled her. However, these others were much shorter than her, the tallest only 6 feet while she was almost 17 feet at the age of ten. Jessica's growth rate has only increased, and now is almost 200 feet on her 22nd year. She is often feared and shunned by local populations, and her attitude toward humanity is...
1211.title: Medieval

choices: "One of our outlying villages is under seige..."
"There have been reports of a large woman in the mountains..."
12111.content:
Jessica awoke with a sleepy yawn that shook the foundations of the castle. It was built especially large for her by Lionel, king of these lands...and one of her few friends. She had helped him oust the previous, corrupt king, and his loyal followers. Though she wore little clothing, for she had been 150 feet tall at the time just 2 years ago, their weapons proved incapable of drawing blood from her. Most of said followers either ran away with their proverbial tails between their legs, or...reluctantly permanently neutralized. After the remainder of them had surrendered unconditionally, she had personally gathered the dead and gave them a proper funeral by burning their corpses in a fire. It had been a terrible day filled with bloodshed, and she had nearly lost her hope in humanity that day...

Yet, Lionel did his best to maintain her positive attitude towards humanity in general, reminding her that this terrible day was a necessary one for a better tomorrow to occur. And indeed, though the local villages still feared and shunned her for being a giantess that could wipe them out in a heartbeat if she so desired...they at least started to treat her with a little more kindness much to her joy. She hadn't asked to be born big and grow ever bigger as the years passed, but she would try to show humanity that it had a friend in her.

Jessica sat up near the keep, which would only come up to her proportionately large breasts should she stand up. Sometimes the garrison would have to help her adjust her top, which she's grateful for whatever help they provide considering the danger. Those who live in the castle are much more open to Jessica, at first on King Lionel's orders, but eventually on their own terms. A wizard even helped cast an incantation on her clothing so that it would grow with her should she grow again.

Her growth is a matter which Jessica is most uncertain of about herself. As of now, on her 22nd year, she's roughly 200 feet tall. But as she has known no family, she has no clue if there are others of her kind or if she was once a human baby that had been gifted to grow to incredible size as she grew older. Furthermore, she has no idea if she's stopped growing yet, and if not, how much bigger does she have to look forward to...if she is ever to stop, that is. Ideally, she was done, but she can't say for sure and no one else she knows can either.

However, such thoughts are put aside as Jessica greets her friend, saying, "Good morning, Sire." softly so as to not make him go deaf. One benefit to being who she is is that her eyesight is incredible, able to pick out the tiny humans that scurry about the castle with ease, including King Lionel himself.

"Lionel, please, Jessica. We've been over this before, you needn't address me in any special way..." Lionel responds in a friendly manner. Jessica has proven to be a most valuable ally to him, and a close and trusted friend since saving his life a few years ago. Thus, he has dedicated much of his power as king to trying to make her feel comfortable and welcome. She's beautiful, and her green eyes reveal a woman who only desires to see the good in people, even when they fear and shun her for being larger than even this castle's keep. And though he has forced his people living in the castle to be open to the giantess, it warms his heart to find that they gradually come to know her like any other person, and not as a humanoid monster. He then informs Jessica...
12111.title: Positive, she looks for the good in people

12113.content:
Most days, Jessica sat content in the seclusion of her mountain fortress. The citadel was nestled between three mountain peaks overlooking the lush lands below. The three mountains were the highest point of land for miles in any direction, although to call them mountains was stretching the trust a great deal. The huge lumps in the ground were barely worth of the title, but when everything else was flat the word mountain sufficed. Jessica's seat of power used to belong to some lord or another, whose family's exalted rear had sat in their fancy chair for many generations. Then Jessica decided it would make an excellent 18th birthday present to herself and took it. Now her rather larger butt sat on the keep, long ago crumbled from the giantess's tremendous weight. Taking the jumble of stones had been a very simple business. At eighteen she had already been nearly 150 feet, so she stepped over the 50 foot tall walls and into the courtyard. Crush the garrison that hadn't fled, walk past following strongpoints on the way to the top of the mountains, and step daintily into the inner keep. Once there, sit down on the fancy rectangle housing the lord and his family, and the castle was hers. All the survivors had fled into the towns dispersed along the valley floor, although that didn't guarantee them safety from Jessica's adventuring. Over her three years' occupation, Jessica and the tinies she had come to rule had struck a form of understanding. She was an all-powerful giantess, and took what she wanted. It wasn't too excessive, and never left too many starving. In return the inhabitants wouldn't rise up against her and die, and wouldn't deny her any of her wants. A few villages had tried at first. Those villages had simply ceased to exist, and no survivors lived to tell tales of what had happened. But occasionally some workers would also journey up to her castle to keep it well in order, even if its only inhabitant was much too large to live in it. These laborers were generally treated well, and almost always returned. Only when Jessica was feeling especially playful, hungry, or lonely did problems arise.
Jessica tried to keep rampaging to a minimum, and understood that it tended to tick people off. That's not to say it didn't happen, although villages with lots of food to give up as offering were often spared the worst. Any towns beyond her domain were at constant risk of instant annhiliation at any point in time. She had also learned that other lords considered themselves as good as herself, and felt hurt when she killed their villagers. When several got angered, things got serious. Her most recent swaths of destruction had covered all lands and people, for the most part excluding her own. And as a result, a massive army marched itself across her lands. At night she could see thousands of fires burning as the horde inched closer day by day. Jessica had decided to let it come to her fortress unmolested. Her greeting would be so earnest, it would knock them dead.
12113.title: Negative, they are a good source of cruel fun

121132.content:
Jessica spent the next few days pent up inside her castle. Reveal herself too early and her sheer size would often scare off entire armies. She especially hated having to hunt down groups of three or four men scattered throughout her territory after the main horde had been dispersed. As they moved up the mountainside they would pass numerous walls and gates, and their descent would be that much slower. To pass the time she went through the plans for defense in her head, picking the most amusing way to slaughter the assembled army.
When the army finally reached the gates of her castle, Jessica realized the size of the host waiting to confront her. It obscured the pass leading up to her gates, as well as many miles beyond that. The other rulers seriously wanted her dead this time then. Jessica grinned a predatory grin. She liked challenges. Her keen eyes picked out numerous siege weapons scattered in the army. When the siege towers rattled forward, she knew the time had come to begin the defense of her castle. The giantess rose from the crumbling keep, falling bricks tracing lines of dust through the air. She lifted her arms and yelled out several words in an ancient tongue. The ground shook as she spoke the words, only partially because of her volume. Along the walls of the castle, and down on the ground as well, a bloodline substance seeped up into terrifying mounds of dripping red ichor. Slowly, they solidified into more definite shapes. They were men slain by Jessica in earlier battles. At first they were as they had been as they died. Some were flat as pieces of paper, some had armor crinkled like tinfoil, others had missing limbs or heads, and others unfortunate enough to die in her mouth were little better than the red goo that had formed them. For a moment the troops storming the walls recoiled in horror. But as purplish light swirled around the corpses, the men were restored to the shapes of normal people. And the began to fight back against the invaders.
But the dead made for poor fighters. The first three of five walls had fallen by the end of the day. Jessica didn't mind, she had played this game before. She could rise up late at night and push the entire force from her lands by daybreak if she wanted. But she enjoyed the rush killing gave her, and seeing her slaves fight had warmed her up. On the second day, the going was slower as the living fought the most skilled dead, the ones who had penetrated deepest into her fortress. But once again the dead were outmatched and outclassed. The evening found the attackers encamped outside the high walls of the main keep. Jessica herself was still unseen, she could lie down on the ruins of the keep or crawl back into the mountain abode the nearby towns had made at her request. While the armies below slept, the giantess prepared herself for war. She carried no weapons, she had yet to find any as deadly as herself. Clothing herself was difficult due to her size, but she still had some outfits. Jessica chose to wear a tight leather bra, made only a few months ago. This was before she stopped growing, so it was barely up to the task it was presented. It left little to the imagination, allowing the soldiers to gave upon her well-toned belly and beautiful snow-white color. To cover her sensitive regions she had a cloth covering. Due to shortages of cloth that year, (mostly her doing), this outfit was also as small as possible while still fulfilling its role. Jessica didn't mind, she had a gorgeous body and enjoyed showing it off. Her stunning legs were the last thing many men saw, and Jessica kept them beautiful enough for the task. She decided on no foot ware, she did enjoy the feeling of stepping on armored soldiers. Her preparations thus completed, Jessica emerged from her cave just as the dawn shined down over the mountains. She stepped into the hordes below the keep walls with a wonderful squishy feeling and paused for a moment to let the armies drink her in. She was an angel of death, painted gold and red by the rising sun behind her. When the first waves overcame their shock they rushed forward and the battle began.
121132.title: A vanguard arrives

1212311.content:
March 12th, 1942, Somewhere in Northern Maine

A large man with a round stomach and an even rounder face stepped into the dimly lit bunker. He wore a wrinkled white shirt, stained with coffee and sweat, and from the looks of things he hadn't slept in a while. In his right hand he carried a thick brown folder with a faded photographed clipped to its front. As he made his way towards the center of the room another man, seated behind a broad wooden table, lit up another cigarette. This second man was in a similar disheveled state, though he had a few more years on him. He ran his wizened fingers through the grayed mess of his receding hairline before taking a long drag of his cigarette. The round man tossed the folder onto the table in front of his partner and took a seat across from him. Shortly after another man entered. He had a strong, square figure, and dark green officer's uniform with his silver star proudly pinned to his lapel.
"Gentlemen," the officer began, "I'm glad we could find the time to meet" The two men nodded and pushed the folder towards him as he approached the table. "I've heard quite a bit about this project of yours." As he neared he saw the folder before him, the words 'Classified' written in bold black letters across it. Beneath that it read "Project Talos".
"We can assure you, Colonel Ashton, this will work...she's the perfect subject" The round man said. Ashton exchanged a few wary glances with the two before picking up the photo on the file. He nodded approvingly.
"When can I meet her?" Ashton asked. The older gentlemen smiled.
"Right this way..." The older man said. He rose and opened a nearby door...
1212311.title: Yeah sounds like a good idea

choices: This afternoon as a matter of fact
12123112.content: As the older man opened the door to reveal a young woman with dark brown hair(think of Hayley Atwell from Captain America but a bit younger almost still in her midteens) Colonel Ashton raised his eyebrows "What is the meaning of this gentlemen? You said a test subject to undergo this particular mission and all I see is a teenaged girl!" The older man carefully explained "Er yes this is Susan Shepard she was a popular cheerleader and straight A student in her school you see we searched endlessly for a proper test subject for no one else would dare volunteer not even the toughest men not fighting overseas so we had little choice but to choose a female in the end." The Colonel was still unsure about this "But..but she's just a..." Then the girl spoke up with a strong air but sweet tone "I'm capable sir to perform the tests and I'm quite aware of the risks after all I do want to serve my country it's unfair that women don't get to fight in this war." The other man nodded eagerly "Quite right Susan you see Colonel she is very courageous and willing to do what it takes to aid the Allies.." But Ashton now asked the jackpot question "Hold on just what is she doing to be doing to aid them? What is this top secret experiment?" Sighing the first man handed him the files he had earlier the Colonel took one look and gasped aloud "Are you serious? You're turning her into a..a..monster!" "No monsters only exist in fairy tales and folklore Susan will be transformed into a giant nearly hundred feet tall according to our measurements or our mathematics this way she will prove to be the ideal weapon against the Axis why should we waste more men when she will be literally a one man Er I mean one woman army?" Ashton looking over the reports frowned "So she will be a giantess fighting against the Axis fair enough but how long will she remain this way? I mean will she automatically be restored to normal once the war is over?" The first man shook his head "That much we are still working on we pored over the results of the experiments and concluded that it's highly possible she may be stuck like this forever but don't worry it's just a theory hopefully we'll be able to reverse the effects once Susan's done her part." Ashton turned to the girl once more "And you're okay with all this young lady?" She nodded "As I said I'm willing to do whatever it takes to aid in this war." She stated truthfully finally Ashton shaking his head walked out of the room thinking this was pure craziness did the President know about this hidden operation but he turned back to ask one more question floating in his mind "Alright I don't like it but we got little choice and the girl does seem very brave to undergo this dangerous task so when do you start Project Talos?" The other man replied
12123112.title: A normal sized woman is inside

choices: She is shipped out to North Africa
She is taken to a training facility
121231121.content: The procedure was to be long and arduous. Taking at least four days to complete. In a week Susan would be titanic giantess, standing at least 200 feet tall. After a few days she was taken to a large hangar and placed in a tank to which dozens of cables and hoses were attached. The process was begun, sending Susan into a trance-like state. The scientists monitored her vitals around the clock, ensuring that everything was going according to plan. On the final day Colonel Ashton returned to see the great unveiling. As the clock counted down the last of the hoses hissed and wheezed as the machine powered down. A moment later there was rumbling, almost like an earthquake. Suddenly the tank burst open, a colossal arm arching out toward the ceiling. The assembled crowd fell silent as the giant woman slowly pulled herself from the crumbled metal container. She was dripping wet, her long dark hair clinging to her skin as she stepped out onto the the cold linoleum floor. She wore only a black skin-tight nylon suit stretching down from her chest to her hips. "uhhh, so what now?" she boomed. The assembled crowd began to cheer. The round man from before sprinted forward and addressed Susan. "It worked, you're ready!" Colonel Ashton nodded approvingly. "So...it begins."
121231121.title: A week from today

choices: A ambush the Axis was already aware of her presence
1212311211.content: Though Susan was reluctant to begin so soon she was shipped out to Africa in a wooden crate the size of the Titanic it seemed as it took up to six army helicopters just to fly it all the way there once she reached her destination Susan was given specific instructions to remain hidden for the time being until the American units arrived but this made the giant teen frustrated "What? So you guys just dump me off in the middle of nowhere and tell me I have to stay put? So unfair I thought I was supposed to be helping!" The cadet in charge sighed heavily nobody informed him just how incredibly whiny this giant girl was but he spoke in the calmest tone he could muster "Listen Ms. Shepard.." "Call me Susan." She replied huffily "Right Susan we got orders or you got specific orders to stay here for the time being we don't want you wandering off and scaring the locals now do we? Or destroying livestock like a..." Susan raised her eyebrows "A monster? Humph you guys still don't fully trust me do you? You all think I'm going to rampage across the globe and destroy the planet's life forms. Men how typical no wonder you needed a woman to do this..." "Sheesh you are one crazy broad even such a stunning beauty we know you're not a rampaging monster Susan and believe me we have no intent of leaving you like this just please stay here the Allies will be here in a matter of days or weeks and if you ever hungry there's plenty of food in those crates over there(gesturing to the large stacks of crates labeled 'Food for the Giantess') plus we got you a radio transmitter of sorts so you can listen in on any conversation between us and back in the USA in case you're needed well that's it Susie." "SUSAN!" The girl screamed causing a slight tremor many of the soldiers let out frightened yelps as the earth shook violently Susan blushed "Sorry I don't like it when people call me Susie it sounds so ordinary and currently I'm far from normal as possible." A soldier getting over the shock of the quake curiously stated "Wow you really must be pretty excited by this being larger than life thing huh?" She beamed "You bet! It's something I always dreamt of being taller compared to my usual short height this is a dream come true for me!" The men could tell she was enjoying every moment of being bigger than any living thing they could only hope this oversized teenager didn't let the power and influence go to her head once more the first man spoke up "Yeah please just stay here for now help will be here in a few days hopefully okay Susan?" Finally she understood completely despite the expertiment on her they clearly didn't trust her one bit or thought she was capable of carrying out this dangerous task smiling inside Susan thought she would show them all that a female could be just as useful in a war as a man "Yes I will stay put sir until help arrives." Taking their leave the young giantess was left alone for the next few days nothing happened nor did any troops arrive as she had very little to do except listen to the distant sounds of jungle animals though none would dare approach a creature hundreds of times their size and listen to snippets of discussion between various countries until she stood up "I can't just stand around doing nothing I don't care what they said I took this mission for a reason to help stop this war and darn it I'm going to do it!" As she took her first earth shaking steps towards civilization where she found

Maira sighed as she shuffled along the dusty road. She had been walking for several days now and was beginning to tire. It wasn't easy dragging a large pack full of vegetables to sell at the market. Where she would barter with the humans for goods. Since the giantess lived in human territory, she was an odd sight to see. She was fifteen feet tall, built like a heavyweight wrestler, had blue tattoos all over her body, and had a low voice for such a young female. However, she was welcomed by many villagers because of her gentle nature. She was a talented healer and apothecary. She also had a soft spot for children and would often give them rides on her broad shoulders.
However, she looked up and saw that the sky was growing dark.

Maira...

You had just grown to 50 feet tall, and you were a little freaked. "Run! She Humongous!" A Man running with the crowd said. "Are you calling me fat?" You asked plucking the man from the crowd. "Damn you, you whore!" The Man screamed. That had only got you angrier. You sucked the man into your mouth, and swished him around for a few minutes. You then spat him out. "You taste absolutely..awful! Ugh! Do you every shower?" You said trying to wipe the taste of him off your tongue. "Since you called me a whore, I'm going to punish you, and I shall NOT spare your life." You said. The Man was already scared sh*tless. You gently released your grip, and let the man fall 50 feet. His legs were broken upon impact, but he survived. So you lifted your bright red heel over his body, and pressed down.

The Man splattered in bloodshed beneath your heel. You really liked the power, so you began stepping around the city killing everyone in your way.

choices: You break out of the base
12222.content:
http://0.static.wix.com/media/e6f6bf_0b1...

There was a sort of dark mist that seemed to surround you rolling in from all sides, obscuring and blinding your vision. You wanted to move; step beyond the purplish mist but found you could not...it was like you were floating...wait, you WERE floating. You began to rock back and forth but found yourself restrained by someone invisible chains. You had no memory of where you were, nor how you got there. Then suddenly the whir of drill broke the silence and you lapsed back into consciousness. You open your eyes, realizing it was only a sordid dream. However when you try and lift yourself you find that you are in fact being held down by iron restraints, a bright light shining down above you, almost like you were in some demented dentist chair.

"She's awake...we can't have her awake..." you hear a voice drone in the darkness. Soon another answered this one more high pitched and shaky..."We'll increase the sedative...but there's no guarantee it'll work after the process it complete." You try to speak but find yourself too dazed to form words, only allowing a clumsy mumble to emanate from your mouth. You looked down at the rest of your body which lay prostrate on the chair or table or whatever it was you were confined too. It was completely covered by a black latex looking material like some kind of skin tight suit made of rubber or some other material.

Suddenly the whirring began again and you felt your entire body go numb once again. The suit became illuminated by pale wiring like seams of blue light twisted and turning about the contours of your body like veins. You began to lapse back into unconsciousness, but as you did a mask-like breathing apparatus descended from the darkness above and clamped down on your face. Your claustrophobia kicked in and you started to writhe, convulsing desperately to escape whatever it was you trapped in. You let out a weak muffled scream, but it was no use...you were too weak to fight back.

"Begin now, bring the DBME up to functioning capacity..." you heard the voice in the distance trail off, you could hear further words but a mixture of dulled pain and drowsiness clouded your mind until once again you fell into the purple mist of your dreams.


What felt like only a second later your eyes shot open with intensity. They darted about the dimly lit warehouse that you know found yourself in. The chains from before had been replaced by bundles of thin metal chord, and you no longer sat on the metal table, instead finding yourself on the cold concrete floor. However everything seemed...distant, different somehow. Small figures milled about, as if unaware of you. Suddenly you became filled with some instinctual rage; some force seized hold of your mind and body ignoring the continued numbness and attempts at reasoning. Every muscle of your body flexed at the same time and the constraints which bound you suddenly creaked. You did it again and again, this time rocking your body back and forth. The small dark figures became panicked and began running about, but you paid them no heed you just kept going and going. More numbness returned in a wave in your bloodstream but you ignored it. Suddenly your twisting and convulsing allowed you to free your legs, then your torso, then your arms, till all that was left was that which bound your head. You effortlessly pull it off, freeing your long brown hair and allowing you to sit up. Something was definitely wrong
12222.title: Angela

122221.content:
You didn't think, you didn't reason, you simply went. From there you stood up, smacking your head into the ceiling above. The room only seem liked it was 3 ft tall but as you looked down to see the minuscule people and equipment below you, swiftly realized that was not the case. For reasons unknown to you, you felt angry...angry at yourself, angry at the little people but oddly enough mostly angry at the ceiling. You pushed up against it, expecting it to resist, but with a little force it gave away. You through the rafter and tiling upward, allowing a hole just large enough for you to stand through to form. Carefully standing to your full height you were suddenly met by a faded sunlight. The sky was gray, as though rain was coming. You couldn't tell the time of day but it was temperate and pleasant. Calm suddenly filled the place of the anger you had just felt, but it was swiftly interrupted by tiny pricks on your legs. You looked down and saw that you were being shocked with tiny wires, but they did nothing to you. You lifted your right foot and brought it down. You felt something crunch underneath your foot but did not know what you had just stepped on. Tiny screams eminated from below. Annoyed you ripped apart the remaining roof and with your foot, knocked over one of the walls. You stepped out onto a large concrete clearing filled with tiny box-like buildings and swarming with tiny people. You took a few steps forward but were suddenly struck in the stomach by some small projectile. You look down and find yourself surrounded by tiny vehicles and people all shouting at you, brandishing guns and other assortments of weapons. They looked pitiful and for whatever reason you were intensely annoyed by them...you wanted them to go away....you wanted to hurt them. So, without warning you lifted your foot up and brought it down on top of the crowd. They screamed and ran, and you loved it. However you were assailed by a barrage of bullets and missile fire. But aside from a few bruises you were relatively unscathed. You decided to get out of there as quickly as possible and decide what your next plan of action would be. You ran forward, paying no attention to the vehicles, buildings, and people you trampled as you went.

Once you were clear of the complex you sat down in a clearing. You could see tiny helicopters circling in to follow you, but you didn't care. You began to think back in order to divulge how you came to be here. You remembered who you were but not much else about your personal history, nor how you came to be where you were. You simply felt confused, and annoyed. You looked down and inspected your body to see if you had been injured. The black suit which had once completely covered you now hung in tight scraps about your waste and upper legs, as well as most of your upper torso. You wore nothing on your feet and your arms were compoletely bare. You were tired...what's more you were hungry and for whatever reason wanted revenge....
122221.title: You break out of the base

1222212.content: You heard the whir of choppers converging on your position, you wanted more time to collect your thoughts and your breath but you decided to keep moving. You turned in a random direction as began to jog at a brisk pace. You mostly saw trees and small mountains but then in the distance little blocks appeared. A mixture of grey, blue, and reddish brown permeated a plane that stretched across the valley. You could tell it was developed land filled with buildings. You don't know why, but you decided to go there, thinking you'll find something there to help you. As you walk their you feel the numerous trees crunching under your feet until you see a line cleared through the brush. An interstate, packed with two lanes of traffic is leading towards the town ahead. Curious you step towards it and as you do you notice the cars become erratic, trying desperately to get away from you. You step over the road so that you have a foot placed on either side. You lean down to inspect the tiny cars, packed together tightly with horns blaring trying their best to escape. You notice some people have abandoned their vehicles all together and have fled on foot. You pick up a small white van just as a portly middle aged man opens the door and runs away. You turn it over in your hand thinking to yourself 'funny how tiny these things are now...at one point one of these could have easily killed me...now' as you give a slight squeeze crumpling the metal frame like cardboard, twisting the tiny vehicle into a flattened mass of metal and rubber. You drop it carelessly and pick up another, again crushing it with your bare hands. Feeling somehow invigorated you lift up your foot and bring it down onto the mass of traffic, flattening multiple cars and creating a shockwave that rattles the entire street. When you remove your foot the resulting crayter begins to fill with the bodies of fleeing citizens. You smile with a devilish satisfaction and continue towards the town. The noise of terror behind you somehow feels...good...you're not sure why but it just does. As you approach the city that lay before you notice it isn't very large, the tallest skyscraper probably not more than a couple hundred feet tall. You stroll over to an intersection where you see waves of tiny people scrambling about, screaming in terror as they try to escape. You kneel down once more and lower your hand; blocking the path of one the little people, they smack into with great force before tumbling to the ground. They look up in terror as your fingers wrap around their frail little body. You bring them back up to your face and narrow your eyes, inspecting their trembling form.
1222212.title: You go find a city

125.title: Other

1251.content:
Ahh, its funny how memories can be distorted sometimes isn't it? I remember how I used to chase sheep down the creek beds and how they would speak to me in funny accents when I caught them. Or how I once found a tiny granite statue half buried in the sand by the sea and when I broke it in two out poured liquid gold. To me those memories are as real as any, but I know now that none of that could have been true. Sheep don't speak, statues don't contain liquid gold, and I...well I wouldn't even really been allowed that close to the sea anyway. Youth gives us so many fond things to reminisce about but I often wonder if it'd have been better to have forgotten it all. All the little adventures I made in my head. I never thought anything even remotely magical could ever happen to me, and in a way I was right for the longest time. It wasn't until a few days after my 23rd birthday that the first real adventure of my life ever began...

I was walking down the grassy causeway between the basalt mountains to the west and the forested cliffs to the east of what was once my homeland. It was late November, yet the air was barely chilled by the breath of winter. My long skirt was fastened by a neatly woven leather chord from which small golden trinkets swung. I kept my head tilted to the ground as I stepped over the tiny crags and pebbles beneath me. My eyes jumped back and forth from the path that lay ahead and the jostling golden emblems that hung from my waste. I was so caught up in my own thoughts that I almost didn't hear the tiny voice call out to me. At first I stopped and said nothing, twisting my head around to investigate the peculiar noise. Nothing. I continued on my way when I heard it again. This time I stopped and turned about. It sounded like someone very far away trying to get my attention. I was just about to turn back and continue on my way when I heard the distant cry once more. I bent down slightly when I suddenly caught a glimpse of a minuscule figure moving in the corner of my eye. My attention shot to my right where on a nearby hilltop a human stood upon a mossy boulder waving his arms frantically. This was odd.

You see humans rarely strayed into our territory and I'd only ever seen a few from a distance. Now, here one stood in arm's reach alongside a path I walked nearly every day. What could he be doing here? Why was he trying to get my attention? Humans typically feared us, and took particular care to avoid our gaze. I leaned in closer to the tiny figure to get a better look at him, but he reeled back ever so slightly out of fear. I thought for a moment he was going to turn and run but he stood firm, shifting uncomfortably from foot to foot. I opened my mouth to speak but he quickly seized to moment and cried out instead.
1251.title: Brown hair, pale skin, brown eyes

choices: I came upon a small village...
I came upon a small campsite...
12511.content:
"We need your help!" cried the miniature figure. After he spoke he fell silent and looked up with his arms outstretched as if to protect himself. I could feel my mouth slightly parted and my eyes fixed on his form. I didn't know what to say, what to do...nothing like this had ever happened before. I lifted my hand and reached slowly toward him for a moment. He quickly jumped back and made as if to run off. As he turned about I finally croaked out a response. "Wait..." He stopped and cautiously turned back to face me. "What's wrong?" I asked in a stiff tone. For a second he stared back up as if entranced. I could feel his tiny eyes peering back into mine and I was suddenly seized with an urge to reach out and seize him. My hand drew up at a snail's pace and as soon as he caught sight of it inching closer he snapped out of his fugue state. "We, uhh, we are being attacked, held hostage, drifters from the east...we need...help" his words began to drift off as I leaned in a little closer.

Looking back on that moment I honestly can't say what came over me in that moment. I wasn't a cruel person, he seemed desperate, but...I should have walked away. I wanted to, this wasn't my concern; our people don't usually mix. Yet, he approached me, in spite of the fear that i could clearly see in his shaking limbs. Without reply, without even really thinking about what was happening I shot my hand out and wrapped my fingers around him. He was only half as tall as my index finger, and his shaking body felt frail, almost malnourished. I brought him a little closer to my face and sighed. "Where?" His anxious face melted to a strained content as I spoke. He lifted his head as if to speak but couldn't seem to croak out any words. Instead he simply pointed. I rose and looked on in the direction he indicated and with a steady step began walking.
12511.title: "We need your help!"

choices: They were about to execute someone.
125111.content:
As I walked on I couldn't help but steal a few curious glances at my tiny companion. He was younger than me, but not by much. As I peered down at him I could tell he felt my eyes on him, as he would shy away with each passing glance. I wanted to speak to him, but he didn't seem interested...no he was far too frightened. That was something else that bothered me. Humans have always been afraid of my kind. The size difference tends to put them on edge, and who can blame them, compared to me this little thing was so fragile and helpless. Yet, he still approached me, asked for my help. Given our peoples' history I'm surprised he didn't run for his life. My kind had made habit of tormenting these little buggers in the past. In fact there were still some communities where humans were still considered a delicacy. I myself never had eaten one, and I don't think I ever could. Anyway it wasn't long before we came to the edge of a forest, whose tallest trees reached only up to my knees. I looked down once more and pointed to the forest, to which my minuscule friend nodded warily. I began to wade through the trees, occasionally stepping on smaller ones in the underbrush. In my wake a left a trampled path of shattered trunks which the little human looked back on in awe. Suddenly I could little wisps of smoke rising through the tree tops. The human began to grow anxious as we neared what appeared to be a broad clearing in the thicket. Suddenly he began to squirm furiously, pounding his tiny hand down on my fingers which still wrapped around him in a secure embrace.

I looked down and raised my eyebrows, "what is it?" I finally asked. Then I lifted by head and saw a small village, built in a circular pattern around what appeared to be a makeshift fountain. The town was filled with with little crowds of people, who all turned their attention to me as I approached. As they peered up in sheer horror I finally saw....
125111.title: I came upon a small village...

choices: She goes to a lake and begins to speak with him
He freaks out and demands to be let go
1251111.content:
As I looked down I noticed a group of brutish looking men surrounding a crowd of people. I wasn't sure exactly what was going on, but I could tell it wasn't good. Whatever violent acts they were committing they stopped dead in their tracks as soon as I came onto the scene. Everyone in the village looked up at me and I could feel the tension in the air. No one made a sound, the only noise that drifted in came from the wind in the trees. The little human in my hand began to thrash about frantically, drawing my attention away from the silent mass of people below. He pointed wildly at the brigands below looking on with both fear and anger. I wasn't sure what he expected me to do, but I suppose I had agreed to do something as soon as I started playing along.
I took a step into the village, and the silence that had once hung over the tired little town suddenly broke. Screams of terror flowed from the crowds of people as they began to scatter in my shadow. The ruffians turned their tails and ran back into the forest, without so much as a glance back. The remaining humans tried to flee into the woods as well, some hid in their homes, while others simply ran in circles. "Well, that was....easy" I said quietly to myself. The whole village was in disarray, and, uncertain of my next course of action, I looked down at my tiny companion for some sort of guidance. At first we was preoccupied by the chaos several hundred feet below, but with a gentle shake I got his attention once more. He wriggled around for a moment before turning to face me. He no longer looked fearful, instead somewhat relieved, even thankful as I began to speak to him. "Was that all?" I asked. He looked up and nodded, "yeah" he squeaked out. I turned my eyes back down to inspect the village and it appeared as though it had been completely abandoned. The humans that remained likely were stowed away in he various buildings that dotted the hidden hamlet. I turned and started walking away, still clutching the little human. "Come on" I said, "I need to talk to you about a few things"
1251111.title: They were being attacked.

choices: I won't be letting you go
I want to go see the rest of your village
12511112.content: Now, up to this point, I thought things were going pretty well. I mean, sure i'm a few hundred feet taller than the little human I was carrying, and yes he was sort of helplessly trapped in my grip but I hadn't done anything to harm him! Yet, as I walked away from his village he could not have been more upset. He began to thrash about violently, screaming incoherently with a voice that sounded somewhere between a sob and a angry scream. I wasn't but twenty steps away from the tiny town that I grew visibly concerned about his mental state. I stopped dead in my tracks and knelt down in a small forest clearing. I loosened by fingers and opened my hand so that he sat on my palm rather than trapped in my grip. He immediately began to calm down. As I took a seat on the soft mossy earth I brought my new companion a little closer to my face. "Feeling a bit better?" I asked him. He made no response, instead he stared back up at me nervously. He wasn't quite terrified but he was still clearly uncomfortable. "Was that it? Some bandits attacking your village?" I asked him. He nodded and motioned as if to speak, but then quickly recoiled back into his silent state. "Are you okay?" Again no response. "Come on now, I'm not gonna hurt ya, I'm just...big is all" He began to stand up. After a moment establishing his footing he finally addressed me. "Thank you..." he said sheepishly. I cracked a weak smile and brushed some hair from my face. "My name is Lera, what's yours?" I asked him. He averted his eyes for a moment but then looked back up, "I'm Darian" he said. I continued to look at him intently. "I'm sorry to ask you this, but I'm just...well curious I guess." I began once again. "What made you try and seek my help, I mean, especially considering most of the other humans fled at the very sight of me?" He shrugged and returned to a sitting position. "I don't know, I was...desperate I guess, I thought you definitely could get the job done, and...well you didn't seem malicious." I smirked and began to lower him towards the ground. "Well, I don't deal with humans very often and I must say you certainly made my day more interesting, which is why..."
12511112.title: He freaks out and demands to be let go

choices: I'll let you go, but I want you to meet me here tomorrow
125111121.content: As I told him I didn't plan on letting him go right away his face sank. Had he not been so petrified he would have likely lept off my hand. I should've expected as much of a response. His breathing quickened, and for moment I was afraid his heart was going to give out. "Wh-why?" he finally stammered. Truth is I was terribly lonely, and he was the first person to approach me that wasn't a member of my own household. You see, my kind doesn't place a great deal of importance in...well having friends, and things were especially bad since I moved out of my parent's house. So, having someone I could talk to, someone I could control, well it made me feel good. "Its just that, I...wanted to get to know you better, I'll show you around my hometown, then maybe you won't be so afraid of me or the rest of my kind." I said weakly. He clearly didn't buy it. "I'll bring you back, just come...for a little while, I promise I won't hurt you." He continued to cringe. I began to stand, dusting the grime off of my leggings as i got to my feet. He threw himself forward with his hands clasped together. "Please, no, let me go I...I just want to go home!" he begged. I felt bad, but I still couldn't just let my chance at companionship slip away. "*sigh* alright this is what we'll do..."
125111121.title: I won't be letting you go

choices: It was one of my neighbors
1251111212.content: As I told him my plan he seemed to perk up a bit. He didn't look quite thrilled, but a tad relieved as I set him back down on the ground. He quickly got to his feet and began to scramble over a few fallen trees in the direction of his village. As he ran away I spoke out to him, "Remember, here...tomorrow at noon, ok?" He stopped and turned around, looking back up at me with a mixture of emotions. "Be here...or I'll come find you" I said, right before giving him a mischievous wink. He looked a little panic stricken but nodded and continued on his way. I chuckled softly to myself before turning and making my way back home. On my walk back my head was filled with the events of the day. It was a welcome change of pace from usual routine. I must say I liked the idea of being...approachable, even if its out of desperation. Though it felt a little weird making an entire town flee for theirs lives just by showing up but still...it was interesting to interact with humans so closely. As I made my way over the hills and long pastures that separated the the border of the human realm from that of my people I felt the sting of loneliness hit me again. I sighed when my own home town came into a view. The cottages were relatively conservative in relation to some of the human dwellings, albeit hundreds of times larger. I walked up to my own door and pushed it open with little effort. I passively wandered inside and plopped down onto a cushioned chair immediately opposite of the hearth. It was a pain living alone sometimes, but then again my neighbors did tend to find their ways inside every once in a while. Still, I'd grown quite sick of them, I simply wanted some kind of escape. Before long I drifted off to sleep where I dreamed of a fire consuming my house, trapping me inside. I awoke suddenly to a knocking at my door....
1251111212.title: I'll let you go, but I want you to meet me ...

14.title: Other Choices

info.brief_description: Gentle or Evil, Mindless Destruction, In Depth Story, Have fun with these giantess stories
info.description:
Ok start off determining who you will play as either a giantess, human male, whatever

Also keep the giantesses themselves older than 14 so I will be either deleting or editing any additions involving giantesses under the age limit

NO sexual stuff, its ok to have some vore and use references to the giantess's breasts and all but no nudity or lesbian anything really strange try to keep it clean

i am ok with violence just don't make really disgusting with organs getting ripped out and stuff like that

You will get a chance to determine where and when it takes place you can play it like traditional giantesses in a medieval/mythological world or just keep it mindless and have a giantess trash a city

oh and i almost forgot no giantesses from video games anime or manga( i don't mind superheroines being used though)

Try to steer clear of male giants, i not saying you can't have them but don't allow them to impact the story to much

Now i will say i don't like having characters that are really specific, try not to write as if you are writing in the perspective of a person with a set age look job etc.

thats it be creative and have fun!
